story:
Our concept is born out of a desire to see children who have been branded as illiterates, children which the world have given up on, children who have been labelled with all negative adjectives – we take these children, and put them in a world class learning environment with every other children so they can experience love and care, transforming their lives in the process.

How much is the child of a life worth? Do we care enough to see these lives transformed to become good leaders of the future, or we simply fold our hands and care less about what become of them?

The answer lies in what we do today - you will be amazed to discover how much a little as $5 could do to transform the life of a child.

Martin Luther King didn’t get up 50 years ago and say: I have a budget and a plan! – Alan Clayton

On April 14, 2014, the world was shocked as notorious terrorist group, Boko Haram abducted over 200 schoolgirls from a village in Northern Nigeria. This news was heartbreaking and I began to wonder how we arrived at this point as a nation. I was not in the country during that moment (I was in South Africa for a training program), but that event sparked a fire inside of me and I decided to do something, no matter how little, to help transform the lives of people who have been faced with such harsh realities.

On arriving back to Nigeria in August 2014, four months after the abduction, I went on an investigative journey down into the northern part of the country. I was shocked at my findings. The level of education in these regions was just poor and unacceptable. I saw children who were supposed to be in schools, roaming the streets aimlessly, in tattered clothes and begging for alms. I saw kids, scavenging through heaps of thrash looking for what to eat – no home, no love, no shelter, and then it hit me. This is why it is easier for these kids to become recruits for the terrorist group. They are brainwashed, given food and a home by these terrorists and trained to carry out deadly attacks.

I am a firm believer in the power of education to transform a life. It was on this journey that the idea of Lead Academy was birthed – to contribute in transforming the lives of these innocent children. All we need is just a commitment, a vision and a call to action to be part of this journey in transforming these kids to becoming great leaders in the future.

 This call to action is going out to YOU today.


People will forget what you said. They will forget what you did. But they will never forget how you made them feel. – Maya Angelou

This Indiegogo campaign is raising funds to build a modern and self- sustaining school in the Southern region of Nigeria. Our plan is get a massive piece of land that will house both the school and the residential building where we will accommodate and care for kids that we bring from the streets.

The key word in Lead Academy is TRANSFORMATION. We believe that we can transform our community, one life at a time. We are bringing up responsible people in a conducive environment, providing quality education and efficient learning system with emphasis on developing good character and imparting sound social values in their lives, and making life better for those around them.

We have only goal in mind – to raise the future leaders of tomorrow. We believe every child, irrespective of their background or what life has thrown at them deserves an opportunity for a better education.

Our core value is L.E.A.D – Love, Educate, Achieve and Dream.

Everyone wants charities to spend as little as possible on overhead. That’s backwards. Overhead is what drives growth. If charities can’t grow, they can’t solve problems.  – Dan Pallotta

Lead Academy aims to be privately funded and independently operated in the long run. Our plan is not to solely rely on charities and aids for sustenance once we are established. The main idea behind this plan is inspired by natural laws.

When a seed is first planted, it needs watering and constant care, but when it grows into a tree, it sustains itself by extending its roots to reach out for nutrients.

Our vision is the seed, and the watering is the funding we hope to get in setting up structures and getting things running. Once we develop into a “tree”, we plan to be self-sustaining by generating our own source of income to take care of logistics.

We have developed a model that uses a sharing ratio of 70:30. This means that once we get operations running, 30% of our students will be catered for by the school. These 30% will enjoy free education, free accommodation and rehabilitation from Primary School to University. Our plan is to visit areas affected by terrorism and get abandoned kids for training in our school system. Our maximum number of students will be 500. This means we will be providing 150 children with free education, accommodation and upbringing.

70% will be regular paying students. It is the money generated from the 70% that will handle the logistics and day to day running of the institution. The reason we are also involving regular students is to make raise these abandoned children in a loving environment. We understand the kind of environment they come from – one devoid of love and of constant fear- and we believe by that by changing that environment and integrating them with other kids, thereby effectively changing their mindset and perspective positively.

If this campaign is able to exceed our target, we will start future phases immediately. This includes construction of all buildings, classrooms, hostels, labs, equipment and teaching materials. This campaign is the start of a much bigger vision – one that gives every kid we take from the streets a chance a getting quality education and living.

We need your help to make this project a reality.

Unless you believe you’ll find the cure/right the wrong/feed every child with your next appeal it’s unethical not to focus on lifetime value. – Charlie Hulme

Our Indiegogo campaign target of $100,000 will help us reach our Phase One goal, which is to get and secure the land space required for this project. We have a long way to go before we reach our ultimate goal of $1,000,000 to build a permanent school and campus for these kids before the school becomes self-sustaining based on our model.

I believe we can achieve this, your financial support – small or large - could ensure that we meet our target.

EDUCATION IS THE MOST POWERFUL WEAPON WHICH YOU CAN USE TO CHANGE THE WORLD.” – NELSON MANDELA

Education impacts all of us. Lead Academy is made up of team of visionary people who have developed themselves in leadership and transformational process over time. Our founder is a Pilot and a Life Coach. Using his global experiences, we have partnered with the best hands in child development and education in developing a program that benefits students, the community, and the world around us - today and into the future.

We aim to teach our students the importance of self-sacrifice in making a difference in our world. We are not concentrating our efforts on the academic part only; we put a huge focus on social development and appreciation of humanity. What better way can we teach them these values than the evidence of your numerous support. This is why we will set up a Wall of Donors for every single contributor to this project. This will serve as an everlasting reminder that every individual has the power to make a difference in this world. Even the smallest donation means a lot to our vision.

Our project is not really one of those that produce physical things that can be gifted. However, we do really want to show our appreciation, and what better way can we do this than building a Donor Wall for EVERY SINGLE CONTRIBUTOR.

Donations over $1000 will be recognized with their names engraved in wooden blocks and strategically positioned in our learning center. This is a symbolic gesture that represents the building blocks contributed by our global supporters who have sacrificed to make the vision of LEAD Academy a reality.

We know that our total budget for this project is quite large, but we really believe that with the generosity and resources of people like YOU, who believe in the rights of a child to quality life an education, we can make this dream come true. YES WE CAN

If you call yourself Save the Whales, every once in a while, you have to save a whale. – Tom Ahern

We need your support. Even if you are unable to contribute a financial donation, you can still help us:

  • Please share our vision with your family, friends and colleagues!
  •  Spread the word on social media (Facebook, Twitter, LinkedIn, Instagram, etc.) and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Act now and use the Indiegogo share tools to let your circles, your tribes, your friends and your families know about the important initiative the LEAD Academy is driving forward.
  • If you are involved in media (blogger, Radio/TV presenter, Journalist, etc) you could interview our founder and hear him speak more about this vision.

The team at LEAD Academy is made up of a bunch of passionate and hopeful high achievers with a dream to positively transform their community through education.

Meet the team:

Mona Ocheme E. – This is the brain behind LEAD Academy. Mona holds a License in Aircraft Maintenance Engineering from Nigeria, and is also qualified as a commercial helicopter pilot in South Africa, with 7 years’ experience in the aviation industry. He holds several certifications in Leadership courses. As recognition of his excellent services and training success, he was granted audience by the former President of Nigeria, Goodluck Jonathan, and even had the opportunity to lend a voice to his re-election campaign.

Mona is currently undergoing a Professional Life Coach course in The Coach Training Academy, U.S. He aims to use his experience as a coach in transforming the lives of the students.

Tk Madugu, a professional quantity surveyor, entrepreneur and commercial helicopter pilot. Tk brings his wealth of experience in quantity surveying to the LEAD Academy project by offering sound advice on geography and topography of our proposed site.

Nicole Pinkman, instrumental to the LEAD Academy project by bringing her experience in media and creativity in showcasing our dream to the world. Her humility transcends her nature and she prefers to be anonymous, working tirelessly in the background, providing insights, creative ideas and campaign to the vision.

Mary Smart – fashion entrepreneur with a strong sense of leadership and purpose. Mary brings her vast experience in branding into the team.

story:
Give the Gift of Safety

Dr. Loretta Long has been helping kids learn on TV for over 30 years.  Best known for playing Susan on Sesame Street, she is an actress, singer, writer, educator and public speaker.  She has dedicated her career to helping kids.

Let's help her “Give the Gift of Safety”. 

                                                      

With your help...Here is what I want to do

I want to give these safety DVDs to schools, churches and organizations to help kids stay safe.  These places can then give the DVDs to the children they serve.  We need to empower kids with tools to help them stay safe by helping them to recognize and avoid dangerous situations. 

            

                                

The Impact

It will be a major impact to a child’s life to become empowered with tools to help them recognize and avoid dangerous situations.  Unfortunately child abduction is a tragic part of our world.  We can’t be with our kids all the time…the information in this video can help.

How will we get the DVD to the kids?

We will ship the DVD to schools, churches and organizations so they can give it to the children in their lives.  They will receive a special letter accompanying the DVDs letting them know that they are the beneficiaries of support from generous people like you around the country who just want to help kids.

                  

About the DVD  “Kid to Kid: Staying Safe!”

                                    

“Kid to Kid: Staying Safe!"  empowers kids to be street smart about safety! Aimed at kids 5-12, this DVD gives them real-life strategies to deal with dangers at home, at play, on the street and the internet. Hosting with Dr. Long is 8-year Nicole, who speaks to kids from a kids point of view.  The DVD is full of helpful Child Safety Tips, Safety Rules and Danger Clues.  This safety video is designed to help prevent kids from getting into dangerous situations and to recognize and avoid child predators and child abduction hazards.  It covers topics like "What is Safety?",  "Who are the Bad People?", "Why are Kids Targets for bad people?" and  "Don't look like a Target".  Dr. Long also plays the "What-if game".   Safety can be a difficult subject to discuss.  The DVD comes with a "Safety Discussion Guide" to help parents, teachers and caregivers.          

"Kid to Kid: Staying Safe!" is approved by the Coalition for Quality Children's Media.

                                                                  

 

 Sometimes "Nice" people...            ...can turn bad                  Recognize Danger Clues

The Story behind this DVD

Hi, I'm Chris Daniel, the Producer of this DVD. The reason I produced this video is because I am a father (also a video producer).  I am also a martial artist, and firmly believe in being prepared.  I cannot count the times that I've told my kids safety instructions whenever we went out or when they would go to a friend’s house to play. One day I decided to try to put that information into a video that could help other kids as well. 

I first met Dr. Long on a TV commercial shoot. I brought my daughter Nicole along to the shoot because she was a big fan of Dr. Long and loved watching her on Sesame Street.  So when it came time to make the video, I immediately reached out to her and we created this program. 

When Dr. Long recently suggested that we re-issue this DVD as a special give away...I said "great idea" and thought crowdfunding could make it happen. 

What we need?

Your contribution will help us reach an initial goal of giving away 10,000 DVDs.            For every $350 worth of contributions we will ship a box of 100 DVDs to a church, school or organization. The more contributions we receive, the more kids we can help.  We can also customize the DVD case for contributors so they can proudly show their support.  For these custom packages we will send out 100 customized DVDs and a bonus 100 un-customized DVDs for each individual $700 contribution.

             

                                   Regular Case                                 Custom Case

Testimonials

"I commend you for taking on this difficult topic and producing a kid's safety video that will be of tremendous importance to our children. The video will make an excellent springboard for discussion between parent and child or teacher and child."- Alane Fagin, Executive Director, Child Abuse Prevention Services

"It really made me think"
"It showed us how to be safe."
"Kids related to the characters. They were kids just like us."
"I feel safer walking to school now."
"It taught me to be smart."- Kid Viewers (from “Kids First" Judging panels) 

"My wife and I have viewed this production numerous times with our children. The advice and child safety tips that are highlighted in this video are imperative to your child's safety. I feel this is a must see by all, and should be a part of all new parent and childcare programs."- Dr. Brian Roper, NJ

“My kids were glued to the TV. It was informative and still fun to watch.
It gave us a chance to talk about a difficult subject such as child abduction.”                - Parent (anonymous)

 "I got this video and gave it to my nine year old. He really enjoyed it, It's got lots of music and colorful graphics and did a great job of keeping his attention. The video basically teaches young kids how to watch out for themselves.  The program is narrated by a cute little girl named Nicole. The way the program is done is very good because the kids watch it and see a little girl talking to them instead of just an adult lecturing them. There is also some adult instruction by one of the "Sesame Street" cast, which was real helpful because kids are already familiar with her from watching "Sesame Street." The video doesn't just gloss over the dangers of what could happen to a kid. It shows real dramatized situations. This is definitely worth getting to show to a child that you love and care for."  - Parent (anonymous)

Risks & Challenges

There are no risks in this campaign.  We will ship the DVDs out ASAP to try to get them delivered before the holidays.  If not, there is always a need to get this important message to children anytime...anywhere.

How can you help?

  • Make a contribution
  • Share us on Facebook
  • Spread the word about this campaign
  • If you have any connections with media, ex. newspapers,  blogs, magazines, radio shows, please tell them about our campaign.

We thank you for your support!

story:
The National Warplane Museum and Leslie "Les" Palmer Cruise, Jr. are asking for your help to raise funds to restore our Douglas C-47A, named “Whiskey 7” back to its D-Day configuration. 


The goal is to restore the interior of the lead airplane in the second wave over Normandy on June 6th, 1944 and make it complete.



The National Warplane Museum maintains a fleet of historic aircraft.  The Museum's mission is to honor veterans by telling the stories of their experiences and sacrifices, and the sacrifices of “The Greatest Generation” to keep the past connected to the future. 

Leslie Palmer Cruise, Jr, a member of the 505th Parachute Infantry Regiment of the famous 82ndAirborne Division, is the last paratrooper who jumped from Whiskey 7 over Normandy on D-Day.  Les is a hero, our friend, and a partner in the effort to stop time for that one moment where the past becomes the present for all Americans to enjoy.

Getting W7 back to her D-Day configuration will mean installing items that have long since been removed.  Equipment no longer available needs to be created from original drawings.  A fabrication shop has agreed to do the work and by becoming a partner you will insure the parts we need are installed for our next season. 

  • We need $35,000 for Interior Items on our Phase One List: items for the radio room, navigator's station, and the cabin area (litter supports and troop seats.)
  • Additional dollars over Phase One will be used on restoration items to   includeg recovering flight controls and repainting them to the proper colors and markings:  exterior items like antennas, glider tow equipment, and many other minor.




Please select one of these levels of support and accept these items as our thanks for becoming part of our mission.


Our volunteers have been teaching about the events of World War II for 31 years from our base in Geneseo NY where we host an annual airshow known as "The Greatest Show on Turf".  We also send aircraft to events across the United States to serve as a living history lesson especially for children and young adults. 

With this funding we will:

  • Expand our ability to illustrate the techniques used during the airborne assaults in Europe.
  • Show technologies used to navigate and communicate with ground and air services across the globe.
  • Develop S.T.E.M. (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math) programs by connecting the technology of the past  through the study of aircraft operations and navigation systems.

By becoming a partner in this project, you will be assisting the teaching of our history and encouraging young people to appreciate the struggles which helped make the world free for millions. 

in 1995 the National Warplane Museum was granted a Charter as an Educational Institution by the New York State Board of Regents and is a 501(c)(3) organization.  We have consistently demonstrated our ability to set goals, work toward reaching them and being a good steward of donations.  With this project, we will continue that legacy of trust by having a standard control of documents, artifacts and financial stewardship mandated by this endeavor.  The yearly audits of our programs and records insure the proper tracking of assets and costs.  We report all activity to New York State to insure we continue to earn and maintain our reputation as an educational institution.

We realize not everyone is in a position to donate financially to this cause.

Here are ways you can make this project a success:

  • Share this campaign with friends, roommates, relatives, military & veterans groups and coworkers -- both past and present! Share on Twitter, Facebook, Pinterest, forums – every little bit counts!
  • Volunteer. If you’re interested in donating your time, consider becoming a National Warplane Museum volunteer – or volunteer to be involved in the funding campaign effort. There’s lots to do, we promise! (We could use another experienced videographer, for instance... see: http://www.nationalwarplane.org/GetInvolved.aspx for more information and get involved.)
  • Refer. Know someone who might be a great donor or volunteer? Get in touch with them and send them our way! (email: NationalWarplaneMuseum@gmail.com)
  • Ideas, have some? – we’d love to hear them! (email: NationalWarplaneMuseum@gmail.com)
  • Questions about this project, or anything else that goes on at the National Warplane Museum ?  Please feel free to ask us via this IndieGoGo project page!


See more about our plans and projects at www.nationalwarplane.org

The story of Les Cruise:  World War Two in Their Own Words By Brian Lockman, Dan Cupper via Google Books

story:
Introducing Lingmo

Lingmo is a simple, affordable Bluetooth language translation device that will let you communicate and understand in 45+ languages.

Forget about bulky dictionaries and awkward, slow translations on your mobile. Now with Lingmo at the touch of a button you can instantly translate the words you need into any chosen language and hear the results of your translation instantly!

Lingmo users will also be able to complete translations over VoIP phone calls and text messaging, we are now testing this function and it will be made available before backers get the product so you can now also call ANYWHERE in the world and speak with the locals for business deals or even just booking a hotel.

What sets Lingmo apart from its competitors is better accuracy level during translations, we have utilized our own custom designed and developed speech recognition software as well as translation software so we can achieve a  accuracy of 80-90% compared to the likes of Google which has a average accuracy of 60-75%.

Lingmo also allow users to make free local or International VoIP phone calls and text messaging of which will be translated between the 2 desired languages



Lingmo can also be used for answering phone calls, and as headphones to listen to your favorite songs or movies on your desired device making it a must for all lifestyles. 

Our Mission 

At Lingmo International our mission was pretty simple, We set out to make a device that pairs up with your smartphone / tablet so users can communicate easier in any language no matter where in the world, You might be either on holiday or for that all important business meeting. 

Imagine going to any country and being able to communicate and understand the locals to order a simple coffee or meal.

Lingmo came from the word multilingual (being able to speak and communicate in more than 2 languages) which fitted the type of device we were producing.

Lingmo allows near real-time translating of 45+ languages. It has two modes of voice translation. You just simply set your native language, then the language to translate to. By pressing the first button and speaking your phrase Lingmo in turn will translate and pronounce it in a language you have selected By pressing second button.

We at Lingmo International have produced a working prototype which has been tested in specific regions across the world from late January to present, We have and will be taking all the feedback from our testers and implemented those changes to make the PERFECT device for you our backers and the general public.

                

Lingmo is available on iOS and Andorid for both smartphones and tablets with Windows Operating Systems available mid 2016.

                                      


Languges 

* English (US , UK & Australian) * Spanish * Hebrew*  Czech * Turkish * African    
* Malay * Croatian * Thai * Greek * Bulgarian * Turkish * Slovakian * Hungarian 
* Ukrainian * Hindi * Spanish (United States) * Spanish (Mexico)*  French * Finish
* German * Italian * Japanese * Chinese * Mandarin and Cantonese(Taiwan / Hong Kong) * Catalan * Korean * Dutch * Norwegian * Swedish * Danish *Portuguese (Portugal) * Portuguese (Brazil)  * Polish * Russian * Arabic * Indonesian 

                                   


Why do i need Lingmo?

It's a no brainer, if you are travelling overseas to a foreign country for your once in a lifetime holiday or a regular traveler for business  just having a Lingmo to communicate and translate in real time is essential to making your life easier while abroad.

Lingmo can also be used to answer phone calls or as headphones to listen to your favourite songs.... Because of its small, light size you can take it where ever you go with ease.

If we reach our stretch goal of $350k we will make Lingmo a offline translation device plus incorporate technology so that when translation occurs it automatically gets put into a phrase you understand.

Along if we hit our $500k stretch goal we will put into production our Bluetooth translator which will have reverse translation by pushing a button and speaking, It will have a outward facing speaker for others to hear your translation. 

What the future holds for Lingmo International.  

As the late Steve jobs said NEVER stop innovating...... 

We at Lingmo have used his words wisely after we have launched our Bluetooth translator we have plans of designing a translation pen scanner that will scan foreign text and translate it to words through to your lingmo ear piece. 

So not only will you be able communicate easier in any language but also convert foreign text to words making all aspects of travelling abroad easier.

How we got here.

For the past 12 + months we've been busy conducting feasibility studies, Market research, Sourcing suppliers, coding and designing of the Lingmo devices and app's, 

From Early March through to present we have been designing & testing the iOS, Android apps & devices to ensure the balance is perfect.

We are currently partnered up with a major Indian phone manufacturer to Distribute our app through out there significant network as well as bringing all 22 Indian languages into the 1 translation device.



Risk and Challenges.


We at Lingmo International didn't want to launch our Kickstarter campaign until we had a working prototype that had been tested in the field along with manufactures lined up and our production schedule in order.

We have been working closely and building up a strong relationships with our device supplier to ensure we deliver the best quality devices with minimal problems, 

We have confidence to ensure stock and lead-times are within our production requirements; and ensure all the components have been tested and met the highest standard possible.

The spirit of the Lingmo International is high speed implementation across the board, What we promise with gifts / time frames to you our backers we will ensure that we meet & beat your expectations.

We now have a working prototype so all that is required is to fine tune the product and put it into production, We will then have it to you our backers in or before the time frame we indicated.

We are unlike our competitors that have promised and not delivered.



Thank you so much for your support..

story:
Summary

Boomerang Festival is a global indigenous arts & culture event aimed at Aboriginal access for audiences wishing to engage with a quality, unique, true Indigenous experience.

It encompasses dance, weaving, carving, talks & ideas, workshops, music & authentic cultural exchanges between Aboriginal & non-Aboriginal people.


With full support of and in conjunction with Bluesfest Byron Bay's Festival Director, Peter Noble, produced from an Aboriginal perspective by one of Australia’s most accomplished & respected Artistic Directors,  and proud Bundjalung woman, Rhoda Roberts (Sydney Opera House, The Dreaming Festival,  2000 Sydney Olympic Games Opening Ceremony, Garma Festival), Boomerang Festival is programmed with high-quality performance art, featuring masters of craft & cultural leaders from around the globe. 


Boomerang ran successfully in 2013 in Byron Bay, on the Bluesfest site, to widespread audience and critical acclaim. It was nominated for several major arts and tourism awards, and contributed significantly to the local tourism and economic sectors.



However, both arts and Indigenous funding was cut, and forced the indefinite suspension of what was heralded as new way forward in harmonious relations for all Australians, and imperative national healing.


What We Need & What You Get

Without adequate funding, Boomerang must raise funds to grow into the stand alone festival, and a major contributor to the North NSW cultural landscape, tourism and economy, as well as a landmark event for Australia.

NSW has the largest population of Aboriginal Australians than any other state in the country, and less fiscal support than other regions in the country. Ownership & pro-activeness with art & culture is key to empowerment and inclusion in our diverse society.


In order for Boomerang to run effectively in 2016 we need $30,000. We've already raised $7,000 - so we aim to raise the remaining $23,000 on this platform.

Additional funds will be placed in trust to go towards the future development of Boomerang into an independent, stand-alone festival (for which, we ultimately need over $600,000).

Each package has different features and benefits, with a focus on local and Indigenous experiences so you get a unique, cultural experience in exchange for your support.

This is thanks to donations from local businesses who see the importance & relevance of this landmark event, including:

-  Bluesfest

-  Harvest Café

-  Arakwal Aborignal Corporation

-  The Farm

-  The Three Blue Ducks

-  Clayton Donavon & The Jaaning Tree

-  Australian Good Food Guide

-  The Music

-  Virgin Australia

-  The Byron @ Byron Resort & Spa

- Common Ground Byron Bay

- SAE Byron Bay

- Elements of Byron

- Rhythms Magazine



The Impact

Australia Council for the Arts recently reported that:

  • 92% of Australians agree that Indigenous arts are an important part of Australia’s culture
  • 64% of Australians have a strong or growing interest in Indigenous arts
  • 24% of Australians attended Indigenous arts in the previous year

(Source Australia Council for the Arts, 2015)

Boomerang offers the solution to this discrepancy between people interested in engaging, and not knowing how to access Aboriginal culture.



Bluesfest, as one of the most successful and enduring major events in Australia, and Boomerang’s only non-government partner, invites you to join them as leaders in positive change in our local, state, and national cultural landscape.

We invite you to lead the change we want and need to see in our national narrative.

You can be proud to say you took a stand on Australia's relationship with its Indigenous culture, for the betterment for all Australians


Risks & Challenges

As a progressive and forward-thinking artistic team, Bluesfest & Boomerang festival recognise that we might be ahead of our time. But the importance of the event, and readiness of the community for it is undeniable.

The volatility of the economy and arts industry will affect us, however, with the expertise of astute and revered festival programmers in Peter Noble and Rhoda Roberts, along with their dedicated and experienced teams, we are confident we can hedge against negative impacts.

Our biggest challenge is garnering the support of the people who will benefit from it the most - the Australian public.



Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Any support you can offer will be warmly and gratefully received. Some options include:
  • You can put the word out through your social media channels
  • Volunteer at the festival
  • Donate products or services
  • Get in touch and discuss your ideas with us - we love to collaborate with all members of the community, far and wide!

Thank you for taking the time to read, and for any assistance you are able to provide.

Rhoda Roberts and Team Boomerang.

story:
The Conservatory

                                 
       "Help create and be a part of the best music education program around!  As a strong community of musicians we can learn and develop the craft of music together!"


       I am starting this fundraising campaign because I need your help in creating a school that I wish existed today. A school where my colleagues and I would be excited to teach every day. A school where technology helps advance musicianship. A place I wish I could have attended as a student. And a place where we prepare the musicians of tomorrow by cultivating artistry through community. 


I am Dave Carroll, the founder of The Conservatory. I've been teaching music in Massachusetts for over 10 years. I've taught everywhere from public schools to in-home private lessons. What I've seen throughout my work has inspired me to create a new school for music education and I need your help. So many schools and lesson programs are missing the 21st century learning model that students need for success today. My passion for music education has led me to build a school where we will provide the tools for musicians of all ages and skill levels to develop their craft and love of music together. I need your support to make this program flourish. 
Since graduating Boston University with a degree in music education and throughout my teaching experiences I have seen good and bad in music education. I have worked extensively in creating a model for teaching that is based on positive learning atmosphere coupled with technology. The model adapts to each student's individual learning style and integrates music theory with ease. With this technique I have seen students succeed and most importantly develop a love and appreciation for music. The Conservatory will embody this music education style.  
Located in Newton Highlands, Massachusetts we are easily accessible by the T and perfect to drive to with lots of parking. This location will allow the best musicians from Boston and elsewhere to join us in creating a vibrant music community.


 
Programs
   If we can reach our goal The Conservatory will offer very unique programs: 
  • Ensemble lessons where students can play together in rock bands, chamber groups, jazz bands and more. 
  • Private lessons where students learn one on one with the best teachers in the area.
  • Master classes taught by musicians from New England and beyond. These sessions will range from performances to lectures to song writing seminars. 
  • Adult group lessons where adults can learn an instrument together, or be directed in a band.
  • Special needs classes creating a a place where music is hands on for everyone in the community. 
  • Early education music and movement classes because the earlier you are exposed to music and movement the better!
  • Technology classes (recording, engineering, producing) specializing in the music production software that is becoming a bigger and bigger part of the music industry everyday. 
  • Performences/Open Mic recitals where students can present and perform their work. 



Help

We need a lot of help to get this project off the ground. Some of the funding for this project will go to the technology needed to create a 21st century learning model. Tablets, computers and recording equipment are needed to make this technological driven school a possibility. 

Creating an optimal space for performances and group lessons is very expensive. Although we were lucky enough to find an ideal location, it needs renovating to make it great. The space is large enough to have groups playing at the same time as well as individual private lessons. If we are able to renovate we will be able to offer all of our unique programs. 

It is going to take a lot of work to get The Conservatory started and we need the help of the community. Everything from marketing to construction is going to be a big initiative. And we need as much help as we can get!


Perks

With your contributions you can have access to discounts on private or group lessons as well as masterclasses in the first year of our school. You can be invited to our grand opening parties or just sign up for a T shirt or other great swag. 


The Impact

The Conservatory will not just be another music lesson school. My vision is a place where musicians grow together and prepare for the role that music will play in the rest of their lives. By contributing to this school you are helping create the best music education program in the area that will help so many students develop their goals in a positive learning environment. 


Other Ways to Help

The main goal of this campaign is to bring together the community that will become The Conservatory. Telling a friend and a neighbor or sharing this page on social media will be such a huge help in creating this program. Also if you have instruments or equipment you would like to donate please contact Dave at davecarroll@highlandsconservatory.com.

 

Thank You!

Thank you all so much for your time. I hope that you will become a part of The Conservatory. Everyone's excitement for this school and music education is the most important thing to us. We are so grateful for your support. I  can't wait to see you soon at the grand opening party!

Sincerely,
        Dave Carroll
story_txt:
The Conservatory
                                 
       "Help create and be a part of the best music education program around!  As a strong community of musicians we can learn and develop the craft of music together!"


       I am starting this fundraising campaign because I need your help in creating a school that I wish existed today. A school where my colleagues and I would be excited to teach every day. A school where technology helps advance musicianship. A place I wish I could have attended as a student. And a place where we prepare the musicians of tomorrow by cultivating artistry through community. 



I am Dave Carroll, the founder of The Conservatory. I've been teaching music in Massachusetts for over 10 years. I've taught everywhere from public schools to in-home private lessons. What I've seen throughout my work has inspired me to create a new school for music education and I need your help. So many schools and lesson programs are missing the 21st century learning model that students need for success today. My passion for music education has led me to build a school where we will provide the tools for musicians of all ages and skill levels to develop their craft and love of music together. I need your support to make this program flourish. 


Since graduating Boston University with a degree in music education and throughout my teaching experiences I have seen good and bad in music education. I have worked extensively in creating a model for teaching that is based on positive learning atmosphere coupled with technology. The model adapts to each student's individual learning style and integrates music theory with ease. With this technique I have seen students succeed and most importantly develop a love and appreciation for music. The Conservatory will embody this music education style.  


Located in Newton Highlands, Massachusetts we are easily accessible by the T and perfect to drive to with lots of parking. This location will allow the best musicians from Boston and elsewhere to join us in creating a vibrant music community.




 

Programs


   If we can reach our goal The Conservatory will offer very unique programs: 



Ensemble lessons where students can play together in rock bands, chamber groups, jazz bands and more. 


Private lessons where students learn one on one with the best teachers in the area.

Master classes taught by musicians from New England and beyond. These sessions will range from performances to lectures to song writing seminars. 

Adult group lessons where adults can learn an instrument together, or be directed in a band.

Special needs classes creating a a place where music is hands on for everyone in the community. 

Early education music and movement classes because the earlier you are exposed to music and movement the better!

Technology classes (recording, engineering, producing) specializing in the music production software that is becoming a bigger and bigger part of the music industry everyday. 

Performences/Open Mic recitals where students can present and perform their work. 








Help

We need a lot of help to get this project off the ground. Some of the funding for this project will go to the technology needed to create a 21st century learning model. Tablets, computers and recording equipment are needed to make this technological driven school a possibility. 

Creating an optimal space for performances and group lessons is very expensive. Although we were lucky enough to find an ideal location, it needs renovating to make it great. The space is large enough to have groups playing at the same time as well as individual private lessons. If we are able to renovate we will be able to offer all of our unique programs. 
It is going to take a lot of work to get The Conservatory started and we need the help of the community. Everything from marketing to construction is going to be a big initiative. And we need as much help as we can get!


Perks

With your contributions you can have access to discounts on private or group lessons as well as masterclasses in the first year of our school. You can be invited to our grand opening parties or just sign up for a T shirt or other great swag. 


    The Impact The Conservatory will not just be another music lesson school. My vision is a place where musicians grow together and prepare for the role that music will play in the rest of their lives. By contributing to this school you are helping create the best music education program in the area that will help so many students develop their goals in a positive learning environment. 


    Other Ways to Help The main goal of this campaign is to bring together the community that will become The Conservatory. Telling a friend and a neighbor or sharing this page on social media will be such a huge help in creating this program. Also if you have instruments or equipment you would like to donate please contact Dave at davecarroll@highlandsconservatory.com.
 

Thank You!
Thank you all so much for your time. I hope that you will become a part of The Conservatory. Everyone's excitement for this school and music education is the most important thing to us. We are so grateful for your support. I  can't wait to see you soon at the grand opening party!

Sincerely,
        Dave Carroll

story:
Short Summary

We are Top Note Performing Arts Academy. We started as a summer camp with our sister company, Top Note Music Academy and have gained enough momentum to start our own school.

Now we need your donations to successfully open the doors to our new space in the Lincolnwood Town Center in the Northwest suburbs of Chicago.

We have made a lot of progress with the renovations. We are ready to start classes in early February, but we need some help with the finishing touches.

Your donations will help our passionate educators bring arts education to children of all ages, so please donate.

Your support for arts education will help create a generation of people who are confident, compassionate, and multi-faceted.

What We Need & What You Get

After seemingly never-ending issues with permits and licensing and self-crafted construction, we are almost ready to open our doors. We have beautifully painted walls and a nicely laid floor, a few odds and ends to piece together office and waiting room furniture, but our space is bare. Your generous donations will help us acquire the following:

  • Audio equipment (surround-sound speakers for two classrooms, microphones, microphone stands, microphone cables, speaker cables, sound mixer)
  • Storage and shelving (This need includes: bookshelves, hooks/shelving/storage for students' belongings, storage bins/shelves for props, costumes, etc., and cabinets for our office and front desk areas.)
  • Props (This need includes all types of simple things that could help set a scene or story. For example: hats, capes, jackets, canes, sports balls, stuffed animal, blankets, overalls, purses, boots, lamp, pool floaties, neckties, tutus, and sports equipment.)
  • Refrigerator (Our classes take place after school, we host multiple hour long camps and workshops, and our educators plan on spending ample time in our space. We have a full kitchen, but nothing to keep our students' snacks cold. We're not looking for a stainless steel, freezer on bottom, ice maker in the door kind of fridge. Just a good ol' full size refrigerator.)
  • Dance bar and mirrored wall (We offer dance classes too! We also want our Theatre Fundamentals and Music and Performance students to be able to see themselves perform, to better understand what the audience sees. We have a perfect wall on the far side of our main classroom, all it's missing is a mirror and dance bar.)
  • Furniture (seating for the lobby)
  • Decor (Your donations will help us decorate, adding lively and inviting artwork to a creative and energetic space.)
  • A budget for future workshops and classes. The more resources we have, the better equipped we will be to expand our programming and most importantly, keep our prices as accessible as possible for families of all income brackets.

Our perks were carefully thought out by our own group of multi-talented educators and we hope you appreciate our thoughtful and handcrafted offerings. If we are unable to reach our goal of $5,000 we will still use whatever monies are acquired towards the purchase of the above items.

Rather Purchase an Item than Donate?

If you would like to ensure that your donation goes to a specific item, feel free to click here to check out our item registry list. Please note however, that due to the impending opening, Teacher Amanda will be purchasing many of the decor/furniture items in the next few weeks and will remove them from the list accordingly.

The Impact

We feel that arts education is vital to the development of a well-rounded individual. Performance arts provides students with a wealth of skills including: teamwork, patience, compassion, confidence speaking in front of others, empathy, being able to trust instincts, heightened communication skills, lowering inhibitions, social aptitude, self-awareness, and self-confidence. Your willingness to invest in the arts will support a development in these children that is life-lasting.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Do you know someone who can get us any of these items at a discounted price? Please let us know.

    We're also still painting. Feel free to bring your own brushes and rollers and stop by to lend a hand. You can also help by sharing our social media and website information, enrolling your children in our classes, enrolling your children in any type of arts education classes (let's achieve this dream together, despite the distance), or by sending us love and light on our adventures in creating and sharing art with the future generations.

story:
I'm coming to Busembatia, a small village in Uganda, to join the team of WIL Uganda and help local women and girls advocate for change and become leaders in their own communities. 


WIL Uganda! 

Women in Leadership Uganda is a grassroots organization empowering women and girls in Busembatia since 2014. In Uganda due to cultural norms some parents feel that it is a waste of time and money to educate girls. Therefore, many young girls in the community drop out of school due to teenage pregnancy, early marriage and family pressure. International volunteer team is constantly working on new projects to provide them with equal opportunities for education and self-representation, encouraging young women to become successful individuals in their own communities. For more information, feel free to check out their website.

Teen Voices Project

I believe that there is no tool for development more effective than education. Therefore, I'll be joining the WIL team in February to work on a Teen Voices programme that runs in partnership with Teen Voices based in NewYork. Throughout the programme we will:
1) Discuss with the girls the challenges they face in life 
2) Guide them on how to tell the world their stories and reach an international audience
3) Advocate for change and inspire people to get involved and make a difference

The Impact

Working with young women, organizing sessions and workshops for them, we will provide them with safe conditions for proper education and personal and professional growth to make their voice heard and their dreams come true. 

Gender inequality is still an issue and still takes many forms in Uganda. Education is the first step on the way to empowerment. Teen Voices Project is an opportunity for girls to get their articles and feature stories edited in New York and published online reaching an international audience. Girls learn how to  use social media to share news and advocate for change.


Challenges and How you can help 

As a part of my internship, I have to raise a minimum of $300, however, I'm definitely striving for more. I'm sure there are a lot of people out there who are eager to help in any way. Even though it is an unpaid position and I'm covering all the expenses myself, the organization is providing me and other volunteers with accommodation, while constantly aiming to expand its programs. I will appreciate any financial aid that would help us keep the projects going, provide girls with the proper study materials and school supplies and welcome new enthusiastic and passionate volunteers to keep the team working and inspire the girls and women. 

Thank you for reading and keep up to date with the latest news on WIL Uganda Facebook page.

story:
Here's what we have done so far. 

With funds from sales at Hands on Drums Pop-Up shop and generous donations from our community, we have ALREADY funded the following phases of the project: 

1. Purchased 1 acre of land off Ghana's coast in the village of Senya Beraku: COMPLETED 2011

2. Built 300 X 100 foot wall using concrete blocks: COMPLETED 2011

3. Built 12 x 12 weatherproof shed using concrete blocks: COMPLETED 2012

4. Built 3 wood and straw beach huts: COMPLETED 2014

5. Well drilled, 550 feet: COMPLETED 2015

6. Polytank for water storage bought and secured: COMPLETED 2015

7. Generator for well pump bought and secured: COMPLETED 2015

8. Excavation of on the land: COMPLETED 2016

9. Concrete foundation mixed and poured: COMPLETED 2016 

10. Blocks built and then laid to create 3 rooms and an upper bunk area: COMPLETED 2016 

11. Iron pipes (rebar) inserted in concrete foundation: COMPLETED 2016

What We Need & What You Get

What we need moving forward (costs include transportation, workmanship and materials): 

*Materials include cement, sand, metal, wood, nails, paint, stone, gravel, shovel, wheel barrows, toilets, pipes, kitchen appliances, bamboo and drinking water 

1. Concrete poured to create first and second floor: $3500

2. Metals (rebar) for the upper floor: $3000

3. Block laying for the upper bunk room (accommodating 10-15 people): $1500

4. Brick roofing and carpentry work = $3000

5. Plumbing for 3 indoor toilets and showers: $3000

6. Plumbing for outdoor composting toilet and outdoor showers: $3000

7. Structure, plumbing and appliances for outdoor kitchen: $4,500

8. Structure for sheltered work station: $1500

9. Materials to build a playground: $1500

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need to finish the Artist Home. We need blocks, bricks, metal, concrete, wood and piping. We need to build 3 bathrooms, so we need to buy appliances for those as well as for an outdoor kitchen. We need materials to build a simple outdoor workshop shelter, and to build a playground for the community children. 
  • We have drums, drum classes, lessons and a drum circle for up to 60 people as our perks. VERY EXCITING! Please do give and we'll "Perk" you. 
  • If we do not reach our goal, all the money that's donated will still go toward building the Artist Home. We want you, our community to help us finish this project! This is our greatest hope.
  • YOUR DONATION is TAX-DEDUCTIBLE! 

The Impact

1st - Our craftworkers have a home and a place to work, indefinitely. THEY ARE NO LONGER AT RISK OF BEING DISPLACED. 

2nd - Hands on Drums, with our without a storefront, can continue importing and selling our craftworkers' beautiful creations. This benefits the craftworkers and their families, as well as our work here in DC, and all of the people that work impacts. The more successful our cooperative economics become, the further our reach. Young women in YWDEP, young men in DUFP, all of our students and those who benefit from our workshops and performances. 

3rd - We can begin regular mentoring programs on the land with young people from the village of Senya Beraku. These young people will engage in mentor/mentee relationships with our craftworkers. They will apprentice with them to learn crafts such as batiking, carving, jewelry and mask making, tailoring, drum building and more. Their knowledge becomes their power. They create, we purchase by direct trade, they have a place to live and work and money to take care of their families, in perpetuity. Their children go to school, and grow up with more opportunities and a better life. Amen and Ashe. 

4th - When you come to Ghana (via our Akoma Tours or otherwise), you have a place to stay. Whether you are coming to learn how to build drums, or do batik arts or learn other crafts from our craftworkers, or take drumming and xylophone lessons, or spend time with the community children, playing with them and/or tutoring them, or if even if you just came to soak in the sun, sand and surf: WE HAVE A PLACE. 

5th - Once the Artist Home, outdoor kitchen, playground and sheltered workshop are built, our next step is CREATE A COOPERATIVE. This means understanding how our craftworkers - and this includes a women's community near Senya Beraku who make black soap - can turn their arts into real life improvements. It means investigating models of co-operative building and figuring out which works best. Then working with the craftworkers to understand their own goals, how they match up with our goals, and figuring out how to achieve them together. 

 

Risks & Challenges

Despite obstacles and challenges, like rarely having cash-on-hand; living as self-employed artists in one of the most expensive areas of the country (Washington, DC); raising a child; moving our store from our basement to our first shop (for 3 months) to our current shop; miscommunications as we push forward, even though we come from such different backgrounds - we have achieved so much in just 7 years. Possibly the biggest success has been the growth of our community (YOU). We have taken 20 people to Ghana on fulfilling cultural immersion tours; we've received imports from our craftworkers no less than 12 times and have showed up to dozens of markets locally and regionally prior to receiving our storefront. And our storefront! This came from a contest we applied to and WON through Cultural DC. And even though that storefront was slated for only 3 months, ReCreative Spaces in DC believed in our work and found us another spot for a full year. Ashe! We have produced at least a dozen successful events including a yearly African bazaar and fundraiser; weekend workshop series with master drummers Monette Marino, Dr Djo Bi from the Ivory Coast and Sayon Camara from Guinea; Greenbelt Rhythm & Drum Festival and more. We've performed over 100 times as the Bele Bele Rhythm Collective, the Akoma Drummers, YWDEP and with Cheick Hamala Diabate. We continue to teach classes and bring drumming experiences that uplift communities to wherever we are called. Building unity through the drum, and building a community based on the joy of drumming and the concept of cooperative economics. We will continue to rise with your support, as we always have. When we say WE, it means all of us, together.  Ashe! 

Other Ways You Can Help

We need assistance: 

*Digital Assistant - someone to help us with updating websites, refreshing our online shop, keeping our brand popping up on all social media paradigms, especially when we have events or campaigns coming up 

*Creative/Journalistic - someone to assist us in creating profiles of all our craftworkers. Photos, bios, and videos of each, so that our DC and Ghana communities can better interface with one another. 

*Organizational - someone to help us creating and maintaining databases of our community both here and in Ghana. 

*Logistical - someone we can call upon whenever we need assistance with our events. Set up, take down, running errands, etc. 

*Childcare! - for our wonderful son Kwame, who will be inheriting all of this someday! 

PLEASE NOTE: YOUR DONATION IS TAX-DEDUCTIBLE. And we are SO GRATEFUL. Ashe, and Medaasi Paaaa.....

Kristen  & Kweku

Kristen  & Kweku

story:
Hi, my name is Celeste Bedard and I'm a 16 year old girl in eleventh grade at a French high school in Windsor, Ontario. Last year, there was an exchange student from Spain in one of my classes and I thought about what a wonderful experience it would be to be an exchange student. So, in March I applied to International Student Exchange Ontario to go to Switzerland. 

About five months later, on August 14th, my family and I had the pleasure of hosting a girl named Audrey from Thônex, a small municipality outside of Geneva. We had a lot in common and had a great time together, and she is now and will always be part of our family. Audrey left on October 24th, so now it's my turn! In February I will be joining Audrey and her family in Switzerland, where I will be going to school and living a whole new experience.

I have taken all of the necessary precautions to avoid any possible conflicts with my schoolwork and education this exchange could cause me since I still need to keep up with my classes here in Windsor. Before Audrey's arrival I took my eleventh grade math course during the summer and I am now taking my most difficult classes, (biology, chemistry and physics) so that I don't have to worry about them during my second semester while I'm in Switzerland.

Now, I have just been informed that Audrey's school will be going on an educational trip to Ireland during my stay. However, this trip costs $1500 and my parents have already been so generous in helping me pay for this exchange, so I'm trying to raise the money on my own. I have a part-time job at Domino's Pizza, which is helping me with a portion of the funds, but I won't be able to earn the full amount needed by the time of my departure.  

 It would be amazing if I could get to go to Ireland while I'm already in Europe as well as spend as much time as I can with Audrey, since at the end of this program it is possible that we will never have the opportunity to see each other again. I'm so excited for what lies ahead and hope that with your help that I can reach my goal to go on this trip of a lifetime with my new sister.

story:
"Teach For Nigeria is a social enterprise (non-governmental organisation) focused on developing leaders to bridge education inequalities by transforming the learning outcomes of the underprivileged Nigerian child"

The Problem

Most Nigerian children share these challenges on a daily basis:

“Our teacher does not come to school.”

"I feel lost in the classroom but I can't ask questions because there are so many of us in the classroom."

"Our teacher comes to the classroom, writes the note on the board and leaves us alone"

"I don't know how long I can stay in school for because my parents need me to bring home money."

"My siblings went to the university, but have no jobs, so I will rather become an apprentice"

Their reality reflects a broken education system that makes it difficult for Nigerian children to receive an excellent education, consequently making it impossible for them to fully realize their potential. The statistics paint a grim picture: Nigeria has the largest number of out of school children in the world despite that, 60% of the children enrolled in primary school are not learning. The quality of teaching and learning is so poor that many don't go to secondary school, and of those that go to secondary school many can't even read and write when they finish (WASSCE results indicate this rot), and only about 10% make it to the tertiary level. This has frightening consequences for the development of our country. We must ask ourselves - are we educating the teachers, doctors, entrepreneurs, politicians and leaders of tomorrow? How will people of this quality of education build the kind of country we want?

Nigeria's educational system is in crisis and this is why Teach For Nigeria exist.

We believe in the power of every single child to learn and make a difference if provided with the chance to achieve regardless of their socio-economic background.

Our Solution: 

The Teach For Nigeria model provides a holistic solution to the current educational challenge in Nigeria. Our solution starts with capable young Nigerians who are passionate about educational reform.  We recruit and train fresh university graduates, from a range of academic backgrounds and place them in classrooms in poor & deprived communities for two years with on-going support to effect sustainable change in the form of:

  • Increased number of committed teachers in under served areas
  • Quality teaching because our fellows will be fully accountable for their classrooms
  • Better community involvement because our fellows will impact the communities they serve

Our model provides the motivation to build long-term solutions to the problem of educational inequity in Nigeria. The game changer is that after two years of teaching, these leaders  enter into an alliance of leadership, working to address challenges facing Nigeria's education ecosystem.


Impact

Our goal is to expand our presence to about 500 public and low income schools and  impact 200,000 students by the year 2020.

Fundraising Goal:

Our target is to raise $300,000 by April 31, 2016. This will help support the following key program elements:

i. Recruitment and matriculation of  our first set of fellows (teachers).

ii. Training program for our fellows

iii. Support 4000 students for our first academic year

By raising $300,000, we will be much closer to meeting our 2016-2017 academic year budget. This will enable us to introduce our fellows and school children to the best teaching approaches and help them develop into great future leaders.


Spread the message

We need you, let's work together, let's win together...

Consider using the following phrases as you share our message:

"One day, all Nigerian children will have access to attain an excellent education. Support TFN“

How much you achieve in life should not be determined by how much your parents earn

I raise my hand for quality education

#handsupforeducation

Thank you for your support!

In case bank restrictions might hinder you from donating on this platform, please make a transfer to:


Account name: IADT (Teach for Nigeria)
Bank name:Zenith Bank
Account no: 1014412236
Sort code: 057150165
Zenith Bank Swift: ZEIBNGLA

story:
What are we doing?

I Look Like A Civil Engineer is starting a worldwide citizens-of-the-world movement to transform how our toughest challenges will be solved.  Civil engineers will play an important role in designing solutions to the most pressing issues of the day, including climate change, increased population, scarcity of clean water, and increased damages from storms. 

I Look Like A Civil Engineer will support our current civil engineers and inspire a new generation, including women and students of all backgrounds, to become civil engineers.

Want to know more about why it's important to promote diversity in civil engineering?

Here are some facts to consider about teens, women, and minorities.  

You can also hear from civil engineers themselves in our video below. 


I'm on board with increasing diversity in civil engineering. How will $25,000 help?

We've already developed the initial website that allows civil engineers to share their stories. Please visit our site at www.ilooklikeacivilengineer.com.  Plus we’ve used our photo booth to show kids they can look like a civil engineer.  However, there’s much more we need to do to meet our goals.

With your help I Look Like a Civil Engineer will:

We will use new and creative ways to promote and showcase the work civil engineers do and show the next generation that they look like a civil engineer.  We need additional funding to build our interactive app which is discussed below.  We’ll also take our photo booth to more kids and teens.

1. Build an Interactive App that Promotes and Showcases the Work of Civil Engineers

We need a better way to explain who civil engineers are and what they do. We will create a fun, accessible & interactive tool for civil engineers and their companies to allow them to showcase their work in a unique way, that can also be used by teens and the general public to learn more about the civil engineering projects that are happening all around them. 

Civil engineering projects often have a permanent physical presence that often go unnoticed because they serve such basic and fundamental needs. With your help we will build a central place for companies and engineers to showcase all of the great work Civil Engineers do to improve our lives and communities. This is like a wiki page-- specially designed for civil engineers-- with an interactive map feature that allows you to search or browse projects by project type and location, and to learn about the engineers who worked on those projects. Watch our video below to find out more about the Projects Page App.

We really want this app to belong to our backers (that's you!), and would love for you to join us in our app development journey.Did you know? All of our backers will be invited to join us at key milestones, to see exactly where their money is going, and to be involved in the design process. 

Here is the breakdown of where your money will go and what the app development journey will look like: "where will the money go"?

If you've ever had an app idea and are curious about how an app gets developed, join us as a backer now and see exactly how it works first hand! Plus, you will also get the opportunity to network with a unique and varied group of people and engineers from all over the country. 

2. Take our Photo Booth to more Kids and Teens

On February 27th we showed about 500 kids that they look like a civil engineer. We had an overwhelmingly positive response from hundreds of grateful parents and excited kids and now we want to give more kids and teens the opportunity to picture themselves as an engineer. 

Here are some photos from our Photo Booth day at Discover Engineering Family Day so you can see that your contribution will go to something you can feel really good about.

Visit The Wall to see more photos of the kids and teens.


And here are some photos of the booth...

Who are we?

We are a group of civil engineers and individuals who want to see more diversity in civil engineering.  Many of us are civil engineers ourselves and we know the challenges and rewards of the field. 

We started I Look Like A Civil Engineer after being inspired by Isis Anchalee and the worldwide response to I Look Like An Engineer last summer.  We’ve been operating so far on our own savings, passion, and belief that what we’re doing is as important now as ever. 

Visit our blog to learn more about how we got involved and why we're motivated by this issue. 

To read more about us, visit our About Us page. 

What investment has been made to date?

1,000+ hours of work, fueled entirely by our passion and savings accounts

$10,000 in donated funding

$15,000 in donated services

Countless generous contributions of family, friends, and colleagues - editing, filming, reviewing, providing feedback, designing graphics, and more. 

See a list of all of our Founding Contributors. 

If We Exceed our Target Goal

If we exceed our target goal, this will allow us to:

  • Take our Photo Booth to more kids and teens
  • Spread the word in more places, all over, through social media, visiting local colleges and schools, representing I Look Like a Civil Engineer at career and STEM events, and more
  • Interview and conduct surveys of Engineers, students, young people, and the public to refine our message and measure our impact

This Campaign is About More than 25K

We need your support.  What we plan to do can only be possible with the support of our communities. We need to hear you say "Yes, please do what you're doing! That is something we care about!"

Other Ways to Support 

Like us on Facebook and follow us on Twitter!!!

  • Share this campaign with your friends
  • Visit our website at www.ilooklikeacivilengineer.com and provide your feedback! 
  • Ask your company to be a corporate sponsor of our website
  • If you are a civil engineer, provide your story on our Stories page. 

Perks

For our $25, $50, $75 or $100 backers: choose from the following perk options and colors. Don't forget, you can order more perks by making more than one contribution!  


Example of Founding Sponsors Listed on Website

story:
+



From my work 
Share if you care

Humanitarian work is the basis of an individual's life


Typical incubation educational establishment is equipped with all the means of security and safety of the children are supervised by a dedicated staff in raising children, especially in this age of the little of what this age of great importance in the formation of the child's personality.

Needed for the project needs Shown in this table:





I pretend Mahmoud Hijazi volunteer work in nursing at Abu Yousef al-Najjar Hospital finished my studies at the university in 2012 Bachelor of Nursing

Also work to help the needy and help the poor and needy, orphans and infirm

By collecting donations in various ways to provide assistance and reduce the spread of disease and provide food, food and drink

Also work to strengthen and provide psychosocial support to children and orphans

Avis general

raising money for

I I collect donations for the establishment of kindergartens to teach children from the age of 4 years to 6 years 

The provision of a typical healthy atmosphere for children of this age, especially in the presence of many of the nurseries where the minimum necessary specifications are not available category.

Contentment working mothers within the Assembly in particular on their children and thus raise the level of achievement in the work.

Provide job opportunities for some housewives who need to work.

Find a new income for the association and a private source that there will be children of the employees is also Assembly.

Provide a safe educational environment for children.

How the money will be used

 

1-Will use the money to set up a kindergarten through which children's education and reducing illiteracy in the Gaza Strip

As the Gaza Strip is suffering from the blockade since 8 years

2- Typical incubation educational establishment is equipped with all the means of security and safety of the children are supervised by a dedicated staff in raising children, especially in this age of the little of what this age of great importance in the formation of the child's personality.

During the months will start to create a project directly

When the amount is complete

I call on everyone to donate


About my project

Physical Development
• have good motor control, generally with large muscles developing before small muscles.
• increase their ability to control and coordinate movements, such as running, jumping, lifting,
carrying, balancing, throwing, catching, and building with blocks and boxes.
• develop the skills required to manipulate small materials such as writing tools, scissors, and shoelaces.
• find sitting still for extended periods of time difficult, and they therefore need a balance of active
and quiet times.

In order to enhance physical development using an integrated kindergarten curriculum, the educator• provides a variety of developmentally appropriate activities, materials, and equipment that support
large muscle development such as obstacle courses, hula-hoops, climbing equipment, balls, parachutes, etc.
• provides activities to develop small muscles at a variety of learning centres, using developmentally
appropriate materials or equipment such as puzzles, string beads, tools (pencils, paint brushes,
crayons, scissors, etc.) play dough, small blocks, cars, etc.
• allows time and opportunities for children to develop self-help skills, such as dressing, zippering,
snapping, tying, etc.

Social/Emotional Development
• need recognition for accomplishments, respond to praise and encouragement, and are anxious to
please.
• find security in routines.
• like to talk, but are learning to listen purposefully to others, to share, and to take turns.
• play best in small groups.
• need to belong and see the friendship of other children.
• will seek adult support and approval to adjust to unfamiliar situations.

In order to enhance social/emotional development using an integrated kindergarten curriculum, the
educator• provides opportunities for children to choose from a variety of individual and small group activities.
• guides and encourages children to take risks such as joining groups, trying something new, participating in group discussions, etc., and supports their efforts.
• observes and acknowledges children’s behaviour and language as they develop their ability to interact
with others in various situations.
• encourages development of independence by providing opportunities to make choices, decisions, and
use problem-solving skills while learning to be a part of a group.

Intellectual DevelopmentMost kindergarten children
• learn at their own rate through active, meaningful, and hands-on exploration as well as through
interaction with other children and adults.
• learn through the five senses by doing, experiencing, observing, questioning, imitating, examining,
exploring, and investigating.
• like to finish what they start, but can carry work over from one day to the next.
• are learning to make choices and follow through, but often think and act in the here-and-now.
• are increasing their memory and attention span.

Language and Literacy DevelopmentMost kindergarten children
• are eager to use language orally and in print.
• demonstrate a rapid growth in language development as they interact with and imitate their peers, the
educator, or other adults.
• enjoy experimenting with different sounds of language as they begin to express ideas through their
pictures and writing.
• ask numerous questions to clarify knowledge.
• are interested in exploring books and being read to.
• are particularly interested in stories/poems that rely heavily on rhyme and rhythm.

In order to enhance language and literacy development using an integrated kindergarten curriculum, the
educator• provides many opportunities for purposeful talk as children work together in pairs, small, or larger
groups.
• prolongs and expands children’s conversations by joining in, asking open-ended questions, and challeng
ing them to extend their conversation.
• interacts frequently with each child on a personal and informal basis.
• provides a variety of media such as audio recordings, educational films, artwork, informative books,
posters, poems, etc.
• provides daily opportunities for children to develop phonological awareness through music and
movement, singing, reading, rhyming, playing with language, etc.
• provides daily opportunities for children to learn about and engage in reading and writing activities
(daily message, read-a-louds, big books, guided reading, shared writing, guided writing, etc.)

Numeracy Development
• react in a positive way when faced with finding solutions.
• problem solve in their own way, not relying on methods/solutions used by others.
• are starting to show an understanding of cause and effect.
• are starting to identify and describe similarities and differences between things/situations in their
environment.
• are naturally curious and imaginative, ready to question, explore, create, and invent

In order to enhance numeracy development using an integrated kindergarten curriculum, the educat• plans learning activities that help children understand that there can exist more than one solution to a
given problem that can be discovered through teamwork and/or cooperation.
• encourages mathematical thinking and reasoning by asking open-ended questions.
• provides children with opportunities to share their knowledge, experiences, and problem-solving
strategies with others.
• observes, supports, and challenges children in their problem-solving process.
• integrates mathematical vocabulary and processes in daily learning centre activities.
• observes children as they choose and use materials and adjusts teaching strategies in order to meet
children’s needs.

I must thank everyone who have a heart and a humanitarian

Thanks to curb illiteracy

thank you

Allah blessed all
