story:
Why & How of Guardian

Systems


    As is growing more evident by the media coverage that most Americans view daily, along with the rest of the world, and is spread through Facebook, Youtube as well as a multitude of other media avenues, there is a need. A need for the ability to hold people, all people, accountable for their actions. How many incidents have been brought to light because someone used video to expose what happened? How many more have been swept under the rug because no one had a video? Videos are only good if there is one. What do you do when you don't have one? What happens when the proof you are recording gets destroyed or deleted? To answer that question we must first answer this...


What is a Guardian?


   Simply put, it is battery powered truth. It is a witness when no one else hears or sees. It is the ability to discern fact from fiction when taking the word of the right side of an argument means the difference between justice and an atrocity against you or a loved one. One of our devices is piece of mind when everything seems to be going haywire.

  That's the cliche answer.

   The more practical answer is a Guardian Device is one of several types of specialized recording and transmitting devices being developed by Praetorian Guardian Systems especially designed to be easily usable on a moments notice, secure from tampering or erasing and concealed from casual observation even when in plain sight.

   Get stopped in any small town in America and see how many rights you have in their local court or how much stock they place in what you know to be truth.

   Stand before any judge in a divorce and see how honest and ethical you're ex and their attorney turn out to be.

   Watch someone fake a fall in your business or crash into your car on the road and see what they really don't have to prove to run you broke in a he said she said contest. The insurance company just wants the cheapest way out. They will have no qualms throwing you under the bus.

   Even eye witnesses who honestly believe they saw an event accurately can easily be mistaken. It happens all the time. But without more potent evidence than just your testimony, what they think they saw IS what happened once it gets to court.
 
   Neighbors, friends or family call the police and lie about the other party? If you have ever had or seen this done then you know how hard such lies are to disprove without evidence.

   Events such as these are in the news every day but only when they are caught in the act.

   You also know how much negative impact such lies have, even if you manage to win in court later. Loosing because you can't prove a lie was told about you is beyond frustrating. It is often a terrible, life changing event.

   Are you willing to trust the city employed police, prosecutor and judge to protect your rights? Do recall how much of every city's yearly budget is provided by their courts collecting fines and court costs from people just like you.
 
   Worse, what if those same cops beat or abuse you, can you prove THEY are the criminal, and not YOU?
   
   These are but a few of the myriad examples of why someone might lie to or about you.

                                                People lie for one main reason.

                                                                   IT WORKS.


   Most people do not go through life prepared to PROVE THEIR INNOCENCE. That is precisely why the presumption of innocence exists. Most people are not able to catch and prove a lie they never saw coming. They only catch it once it is too late to prove it. But with a Guardian unit you can prove the truth. Don't be next.

   The greatest benefit of a Guardian Device is simply this. It can be used on your person, in your home, in your car or anywhere you choose without anyone else ever knowing; and right in front of those who would choose to lie or act in a way that would otherwise be very harmful to you.



Here is What We Need Right Now & What You Get for Contributing


Let us break it down in detail:

Current Goal: Our current funding goal is $25,000 USD. These funds will be used to pay for preparing the utility patent (we currently have a provisional patent in the works), cover testing and required FCC certification as well as provide outside consulting to finalize out aesthetic designs for both the bases, basic peripherals and complete system integration with certified components. There is also a small amount built into this budget to cover additional miscellaneous expenses related to these goals that invariably arise. If you want people to be held accountable as much as we do, we will fly by this funding goal and go In Demand and beyond to make this product commonplace!

     We are hoping through your support to not only expedite our project's completion, but to get you excited about changing how people protect themselves from liars and wrongdoers in addition to gauging just how much you, the Guardian Family, want these products to come to market. If this is something you believe the world needs, give what you can and tell everyone about it. Make some noise!


Stretch Goals: We have a number of stretch goals to implement in the event that this campaign is as successful as we feel it will be. These goals will be lined out in greater detail as we move along with the campaign, but here is the basic plan.

Stretch Goal #1: $75,000 USD. By reaching this goal, will will begin to offer pre-orders on additional styles of Guardian recording systems for planned delivery estimated as summer of 2017. These funds will facilitate production and alpha testing of a DFM model and development of a smartphone and tablet app to control and download our systems remotely.


Stretch Goal #2: $165,000 USD. Once we reach this funding goal, we will begin the production of injection molds and other tooling for mass manufacturing, purchase materials for this purpose, and begin the process of making these available to the public. Delivery is estimated at December 2016.


Stretch Goal #3: $285,000 USD. At this funding goal we will be able to hire additional personnel to speed and expand product development. This will allow for several addition types of peripherals to be included in our first run production and bring the production to a more rapid realization, estimated as summer 2016.


Stretch Goal #4: $450,000 USD. This would be a huge cry for accountability and an unprecedented mandate for our product to become a reality.  Reaching this goal will allow us to expand our efforts in the accountability movement to areas beyond just building an awesome product. At this level of support from you, the Guardian Family, we will open our planned non-profit wing with functions geared toward bringing about new accountability laws, helping our least advantaged clients receive devices at little to no cost, rights and accountability education programs and providing legal support for those facing accountability issues in the courts. We also want to hear from you what actions you would like to see taken in this arena, so email us, or hit us up of Facebook!

    As you can see, the more money we can raise the faster that this becomes a reality. Help us to help you protect yourself and your loved ones faster!

Perks for Now and Later: Our early perks will give you some very useful informational booklets, several unique shirts and other neat tangibles, but more importantly you get all the updates offering new perks and first dibs on upgrades and additional products to pre-order as we reach each goal in our funding! 

As we reach each goal, we will post many new and awesome perks, with a number of them being big discounts or pre-orders on additional peripherals and devices. 

For example, when we reach Stretch Goal #1, we will begin offering perks that give contributors the opportunity to order expanded systems at a discount of 10-15% first. Exact discount numbers will depend on final funding levels. More funding will allow for larger discounts. 

At Stretch Goal #3 we will post another perk giving contributors a wholesale package for extended systems to either use, or resale at any price they set. 


Known Risks and Possible Challenges:  

   
While every endeavor has an element of risk, we are committed to minimizing the risks we ask contributors to bear. There are always possible delays in any manufacturing process, and some regulatory hurdles left to jump. We are using all off the shelf, known to function components and are really not inventing any new technology. It's all stuff that already works, we are just putting it together in a very new and different way than anything available today. This greatly reduces the risk factors because everything we are combining already works in other applications.
   
  We have a very dedicated team of people with a wide range of skills to cover most possible contingencies. They have real world experience as well as the drive to recognize any challenge we may not have the skill set to overcome so we can find the right people to do just that. We have studied many other campaigns and manufacturing stories of technology products to see what challenges they faced and found ways to beat most of those before we will run into them. This being said we have built in extra delivery time to allow us to be on or ahead of schedule in a real world production environment.


If We Don't Reach Our Goal: We feel sure we will reach our goal and well beyond with this campaign. However, we are not clairvoyant and anything is possible, so that may not happen. If we don't reach our initial goal, we will spend first on perk fulfillment, and all remaining funds will go toward the process of bringing our system to market. Our estimated time for perk fulfillment is Dec. 2017. Again, the more money we can raise, the faster this will happen.

     We are dedicated to doing this. We believe in it. This is important to us all personally and we will get it done. Your help by funding us is just going to see that it happens a lot faster. We hope you will agree that this is an awesome idea who's time has come and help make this happen now.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign to make a monumental shift in accountability today! Please use the Indiegogo share tools, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Youtube and any other of the many ways to get the word out!

           Making Everyone Accountable is the

                             Key to Freedom. 

               Turn the Key, Contribute Now!

It can be used on your person, in your home, in your car or anywhere you choose without anyone else ever knowing; and right in front of those who would choose to lie or act in a way that would otherwise be very harmful to you.Here is What We Need Right Now & What You Get for ContributingLet us break it down in detail:Current Goal: Our current funding goal is $25,000 USD. These funds will be used to pay for preparing the utility patent (we currently have a provisional patent in the works), cover testing and required FCC certification as well as provide outside consulting to finalize out aesthetic designs for both the bases, basic peripherals and complete system integration with certified components. There is also a small amount built into this budget to cover additional miscellaneous expenses related to these goals that invariably arise. If you want people to be held accountable as much as we do, we will fly by this funding goal and go In Demand and beyond to make this product commonplace!     We are hoping through your support to not only expedite our project's completion, but to get you excited about changing how people protect themselves from liars and wrongdoers in addition to gauging just how much you, the Guardian Family, want these products to come to market. If this is something you believe the world needs, give what you can and tell everyone about it. Make some noise!Stretch Goals: We have a number of stretch goals to implement in the event that this campaign is as successful as we feel it will be. These goals will be lined out in greater detail as we move along with the campaign, but here is the basic plan.Stretch Goal #1: $75,000 USD. By reaching this goal, will will begin to offer pre-orders on additional styles of Guardian recording systems for planned delivery estimated as summer of 2017. These funds will facilitate production and alpha testing of a DFM model and development of a smartphone and tablet app to control and download our systems remotely.Stretch Goal #2: $165,000 USD. Once we reach this funding goal, we will begin the production of injection molds and other tooling for mass manufacturing, purchase materials for this purpose, and begin the process of making these available to the public. Delivery is estimated at December 2016.Stretch Goal #3: $285,000 USD. At this funding goal we will be able to hire additional personnel to speed and expand product development. This will allow for several addition types of peripherals to be included in our first run production and bring the production to a more rapid realization, estimated as summer 2016.Stretch Goal #4: $450,000 USD. This would be a huge cry for accountability and an unprecedented mandate for our product to become a reality.  Reaching this goal will allow us to expand our efforts in the accountability movement to areas beyond just building an awesome product. At this level of support from you, the Guardian Family, we will open our planned non-profit wing with functions geared toward bringing about new accountability laws, helping our least advantaged clients receive devices at little to no cost, rights and accountability education programs and providing legal support for those facing accountability issues in the courts. We also want to hear from you what actions you would like to see taken in this arena, so email us, or hit us up of Facebook!    As you can see, the more money we can raise the faster that this becomes a reality. Help us to help you protect yourself and your loved ones faster! Perks for Now and Later: Our early perks will give you some very useful informational booklets, several unique shirts and other neat tangibles, but more importantly you get all the updates offering new perks and first dibs on upgrades and additional products to pre-order as we reach each goal in our funding! As we reach each goal, we will post many new and awesome perks, with a number of them being big discounts or pre-orders on additional peripherals and devices. For example, when we reach Stretch Goal #1, we will begin offering perks that give contributors the opportunity to order expanded systems at a discount of 10-15% first. Exact discount numbers will depend on final funding levels. More funding will allow for larger discounts. At Stretch Goal #3 we will post another perk giving contributors a wholesale package for extended systems to either use, or resale at any price they set. Known Risks and Possible Challenges:     While every endeavor has an element of risk, we are committed to minimizing the risks we ask contributors to bear. There are always possible delays in any manufacturing process, and some regulatory hurdles left to jump. We are using all off the shelf, known to function components and are really not inventing any new technology. It's all stuff that already works, we are just putting it together in a very new and different way than anything available today. This greatly reduces the risk factors because everything we are combining already works in other applications.     We have a very dedicated team of people with a wide range of skills to cover most possible contingencies. They have real world experience as well as the drive to recognize any challenge we may not have the skill set to overcome so we can find the right people to do just that. We have studied many other campaigns and manufacturing stories of technology products to see what challenges they faced and found ways to beat most of those before we will run into them. This being said we have built in extra delivery time to allow us to be on or ahead of schedule in a real world production environment.If We Don't Reach Our Goal: We feel sure we will reach our goal and well beyond with this campaign. However, we are not clairvoyant and anything is possible, so that may not happen. If we don't reach our initial goal, we will spend first on perk fulfillment, and all remaining funds will go toward the process of bringing our system to market. Our estimated time for perk fulfillment is Dec. 2017. Again, the more money we can raise, the faster this will happen.     We are dedicated to doing this. We believe in it. This is important to us all personally and we will get it done. Your help by funding us is just going to see that it happens a lot faster. We hope you will agree that this is an awesome idea who's time has come and help make this happen now.Other Ways You Can HelpSome people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign to make a monumental shift in accountability today! Please use the Indiegogo share tools, Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Youtube and any other of the many ways to get the word out!           Making Everyone Accountable is the                             Key to Freedom.                Turn the Key, Contribute Now!

story:
About Us!

Rutvi and I (Sania) are two fifth grade girls living in the Silicon Valley who have a passion for learning about technology, writing and outdoor activities.

We are two fun, music and technology-loving duo! We are open to everything and like everything! Both of us enjoy technology, and not just for the video games. But we realized one traumatizing thing: there are hardly any girls involved in tech, especially girls of color, which we want to change. Our goal is to help girls across the world achieve their dreams in tech.

To support our campaign, you may participate in following ways: 

- become our backers and contribute to Indiegogo campaign (and win great perks including "hard copy" of our latest book "Silicon Valley Butterflies" https://www.amazon.com/dp/B01N0F5BFN/)

- encourage your young girls to create educational videos/slides (on youtube.com and/or slideshare.net) and help them win amazing educational toys

- help us creating awareness of low percentage of girls in tech and how to change this by sharing our campaign on facebook, twitter and more.

Our first step towards our goal is to write the book "SIlicon Valley Butterflies".

About The Book!

Our book, Silicon Valley Butterflies, is about a girl from Afghanistan named Roya who moves to Silicon Valley Bay Area as a host student. She meets her host family there and discovers how technology is changing the world and how far her home country is keeping up. There, she learns about several technologies and how they work (including automated cars, amazon alexa, 3D printing and more). This, sparks her passion and excitement to create something new and creates a community of girls. Thirty four years in the future, Roya wins the Nobel Peace Award for helping girls in tech.

Here is a preview of our book : https://www.amazon.com/dp/B01N0F5BFN/ (Click on Cover for preview!)

The Problem?

Here are some quick facts about women in technology: 

  • How Many female executives we know other than Marissa Mayer from Yahoo? - Only 11% of fortune 500 companies executives are female.
  • How often do we see a Women owned start up? - Only 5% of tech start-ups are owned by women.

  • In college, women make up 57% if undergrads, but only 18% are Computer Science Majors.

There is something seriously wrong with these stats. Why aren't women interested in technology? Because they aren't given enough opportunities at their younger age to understand their contribution to technology.

We want you help in changing that.

Why we need more women in tech

Studies say,

  • Teams that have at least one female member outperform all male groups in collective intelligence tests
  • ROI is 34% higher for tech companies with more women in management

Our Goal

Our goal is simple. We want to help and motivate as many as young girls like us to learn about technology.

How we plan to achieve this?

  • With a story written by young girls, for young girls, we hope that this story can not only bring awareness to this issue, but also provide better representation for girls of color in tech related media
  • By creating awareness about the low percentage of girls in tech and how we can change that from a very young age,
  • Organizing events to encourage young girls to be more interested towards tech,
  • Creating videos/slides about different trends in technology

Think about it... how often have you read an empowering story about an Asian, Middle Eastern, Black, or Latina girl succeeding in tech? Probably not very often. We believe that by writing uplifting stories about girls of color, we can help other young girls envision themselves as leaders in the world of tech. 

We Strongly believe, Dreaming is the first step to achieving.

What We Need?

We need your support in raising funds towards this campaign.With the funds received from this campaign

  • We wish to support creation and promotion of educational youtube videos and other visual materials by young girls across the globe on how technology works (taught by girls, and for girls). 
  • We'll be writing more books about current and future of technology
  • We'll like to take these initiatives to our schools (our current school, Dilworth Elementary has already endorsed our campaign), libraries and beyond by physical and digital means.

You contribution is not only restricted to funding us but there are also other ways you can contribute towards this campaign and win amazing prizes every month.

Steps to contribution are given here: http://tinyurl.com/gq4xsuj

Perks

To thank you for your support, we have some cool perks waiting for you. Take a look at the perks section and claim them before they are gone!

All the qualified videos we receive will receive a wristband and Thank You card from the authors of the book.

Wrist Band:

Greeting Card:

The most liked and viewed video contributions will receive cool educational gadgets/toys, including: 

Amazon Kindle:

LEGO Star Wars Millennium Falcon 75105 Building Kit

Sphero Star Wars BB-8 Droid


WowWee CHiP Robot Toy Dog - White

Challenges

The key to our campaign is awareness, and that's something we need your help with. 

Please spread and share this message to everyone you know! Family, friends, relatives, coworkers, neighbors, anyone! 

Like us on Facebook: SiliconValleySisters | Sania Jain

    Ways You Can Help

    Spread the word out!

    Share our campaign on social media, by liking us on Facebook in the above URL's, by showing support by signing up as a member, make videos to contribute to this campaign, write to us at siliconvalleysisters@gmail.com. No contribution is viewed less in our eyes. Every Like we get and every Share we see will only cheer us up and motivate us towards our goal - Tech For Girls.

    Thank you for contributing to this campaign.

    Please read a sample of our book at: https://www.amazon.com/dp/B01N0F5BFN/ by clicking on book cover.

    More about Sania Jain and Rutvi Pota: 

    Sania Jain

    Sania Jain is a fun, exciting, and music-loving 10-year-old girl. She was born in Texas but she soon moved to California and grew up there. She lives in Cupertino, CA with her parents and her 4-year-old brother, Soham. Since she was just 1-year-old, she loved reading books. She would come home from the library with an armful of books and read nonstop! Sania currently attends Dilworth Elementary School. When she is not writing songs, Sania likes to play with her brother, sing, read, and watch television. Also, she can be found outdoors biking, hiking, or exploring. Sania's favorite singer is Rachel Platen, her favorite color is aquamarine. Her favorite book series are H.I.V.E and The Land of Stories, and she loves Cookies 'n Cream with ice cream. Sania also enjoys traveling and never misses an opportunity to go to an exciting new place! She currently has three published books: Lost in Cyberspace, Painting Your Heart and The Great Forest Adventure that are available on Amazon. She also won “young author” award at Dilworth Elementary. She is currently working on an upcoming book called “The Endangered Animals”. To stay in touch with Sania, please visit: saniajain.com

     

    Rutvi Pota

    Rutvi enjoys not only partaking in many outdoor activities such as biking, hiking and traveling, but also in writing stories about the many places that she visits. Some of these places she has visited are Canada, Mexico, Costa Rica, United Kingdom, Belgium, Germany, Netherlands, Switzerland, and India! Rutvi enjoys Kathak (Indian Classical dance form) and she has performed Bollywood (Hindi Movie Dance form) dances at multiple venues. Rutvi's favorite books are those in the Nancy Drew series by Carolyn Keene, and her favorite food is Malai Paneer (a cottage cheese based Indian delicacy). Rutvi's favorite color is turquoise and her favorite singer is Rachel Platten. Rutvi has written multiple books as part of the Young Author's club at her school, and has won before. She is also currently working on an upcoming book on future adventure travel.

story:
Wildhood Micro-Schools: A Better Future Through Early Childhood Campaign 

Wildhood Micro-Schools' design meets the urgent need for a research-based, whole-child approach to school. The goal of our campaign is to expand our affordable pilot preschool and kindergarten program into a scalable self-sustaining model that serves diverse neighborhoods and communities.

According to research studies, children become significantly healthier, more intelligent and resilient when they have the opportunity to learn and grow outside in natural environments. Resilience, also known as self-regulation or grit, is the best predictor of academic achievement and success later in life.

We spend more than 50% of our school days outdoors, in safe parks and natural green spaces. We partner with city park's departments to provide high-quality outdoor learning spaces.We supplement our outdoor time with leaning at our central basecamp indoor classrooms and weekly trips to museums, libraries, universities and even local farms. 

We do not spend money on excessive large "brick and mortar" facilities like much of the obsolete school landscape in today's society. Instead, we focus on the needs of each child, connecting with rich and meaningful resources within their communities, while providing supports through our basecamp classroom.

We use inquiry and play learning methods that are research-based. We have adopted curricula from the outdoor Forest School movements in the UK, Finland and Sweden. 

It is only with your support that we can grow from one pilot program to a self-sustaining scalable model. 

Please, support a better future with Wildhood

Your support will help in 3 primary ways: 

1. Providing opportunities for diverse families: We offer scholarships and an income-based affordable sliding fee scale as strategic ways to increase diversity and opportunity within each of our classes. At least 40% children enrolled receive reduced tuition or full scholarship. 

2. Investment in high quality learning tools: As a young school, your contribution will go towards essential school supplies for running daily child-based learning engagements. Examples are: books, art supplies, musical instruments and durable math manipulatives. 

3. Engaging New Communities: To grow our micro-school communities and branch into new neighborhoods and diverse locations, our self-sustaining model needs increased capacity for growth and foundational support. 

Donate towards a better future and we will give back to you!

For a $25 contribution, you will receive a natural cotton limited edition tote bag with our Wildhood illustration, designed by artist and author Phoebe Wahl and personalized letter of thanks. 

For a $50 contribution, you will receive a limited edition Wildhood American Apparel organic cotton T-Shirt, designed by artist and author Phoebe Wahl and personalized letter of thanks. 

For a $120 contribution, your support will provide one of our high-need students on scholarship with an Oakiwear full-body rain suit, boots and rain cap. You will receive photos of the rain gear and sponsored child in action, learning outdoors!

For a contribution of $600, you will be able to provide a scholarship to a student from a low-income or disadvantaged background. You will receive updates about your student’s progress throughout the school year.

For a contribution of $2,500, we will be able to expand an existing Wildhood Micro-School by adding an additional class (approximately 5-10 students) in your honor. You will have a special invitation to visit the new class.  

For a contribution of $8,000 or above, we will be able to launch one or more new Wildhood Micro-Schools in a new community in your honor. You will receive a special invitation to the opening celebration and receive regular updates as part of the design team. 

In order to change the course of education, together we must invest in new and innovative early childhood learning approaches that develop the whole-child. Help us to grow personalized, accountable, outdoor-focused and community-based schools for children. 

Thank you from our team,

Ben Scherrer, Co-Founder

Mariam Rashid, Co-Founder

And each of our dedicated teachers and staff

Please like and share us on facebook at www.facebook.com/wildhoodmicroschool and share our website at www.wildhood.us

story:
I have always set myself to be self-funded, I have come to a barrier, that I am needing help with. I have an open design studio located on 4thfloorstudios in Belfast Queen Street. I use the space to hold workshops and teaching classes in textiles, pattern-cutting and fashion design. 

I was advised by other colleagues and funding providers that a crowd funder would be more suited for my studio concept. I have bought a lot of equipment myself, but I need a few more bits and bobs and a studio refurb that will help my studio become a working professional area.

professional pattern cutting table £1500.00

dubied knit machine second hand £3200.00 

3 professional dressmaking models £600-800 (£1800-£2400) 1x full body  1xfemale 1xmale
an Industrial overlocker £1150.00 

Refurb including sink installation £2000.00

As you can see, it's all pretty pricey, but overall I think I can get there. Your donations will help not just myself as a designer but other local designers/costume makers in Belfast. That don't have the space to create their dreams. I currently have 6 studio members who use the space creatively in costume and fashion in Northern Ireland.

You can help, by simply donating anything you can afford, or advice that will help to create my dream of holding a production lab in Belfast city centre. 

4thFloorStudios is a location in Belfast, that is currently a working hub of creatives that balance work and creativity in the heart of the City, this is the location of my studio and the hopefully the new production lab.

Your donations will help not just myself as a designer but other local designers/costume makers in Belfast. That don't have the space to create their dreams. I currently have 6 studio members who use the space creatively in costume and fashion in Northern Ireland.You can help, by simply donating anything you can afford, or advice that will help to create my dream of holding a production lab in Belfast city centre. 4thFloorStudios is a location in Belfast, that is currently a working hub of creatives that balance work and creativity in the heart of the City, this is the location of my studio and the hopefully the new production lab.

story:
Here at the Palestinian Society for Care and Development we pay special attention to the incorporation of handicapped and marginalised children into the local society, by giving the children an opportunity to establish new friendships and obtain various artistic skills. Sports activities, handicrafts classes, drawing, educational trips, dancing and watching educational films with a following discussions, are some of the activities we’re going to offer the children. These activities are provided in a friendly, informal environment, in an otherwise stressful refugee camp, which lacks standard public facilities such as parks or playgrounds. They serve as a psychological and recreational treatment in that we promote relaxation in order to reduce children’s anxiety through socialising and playing games. By including everyone in the summer camp, handicapped or not, the children develop healthy attitudes towards each other. We learned from experience that helping the handicapped to develop their skills in taking care of their own needs helps raise the esteem of all the camp’s inhabitants for the handicapped. This has the positive long-term effect of improving the acceptance of disabled people amongst their families and the local society.

Since most of the families in the camp are in need of financial help this applies even more so to families with disabled children for they receive no substantial medical and social care. The integration summer camp helps reduce the financial burden of families with disabled children and improve the population’s standard of life in general by offering the children daily meals and taking them on field trips.

Last but not least, thanks to our volunteering program, the integration summer camp serves as a connector between Palestinians and foreign volunteers at the Al-Amari refugee camp. People from all over the world come to Al-Amari to stay with us and see how we live here. They contribute to our diversified program and teach the children English, as well as customs from their own countries.

We will conclude the integration summer camp with a festival for everyone where the children can exhibit the learned skills and everyone will have a great time.

If you want to support us here at the Al-Amari refugee camp, we would be grateful for any donation.

story:
Short Summary

Returning Wave and Surf to School join forces to host a youth surf competition for the local kids in Eastern Samar, Philippines.

Entry into the competition is based on student grades and attendance and the prizes are school supplies school scholarship funding.

By making a donation to this campaign you are helping promote the importance of education and of Wahine empowerment encouraging more girls to surf through learning clinics.

What We Need

Scholarship Prize = $670  (for 3 recipients)
Competition Logistics & Hosting Cost = $770

The Impact

Returning Wave has been promoting education through the love of surfing since 2008 by providing surf equipment to southern Philippines communities from surfboard donations in the USA. 

Surf to School has been hosting scholastic youth surf competitions in northern Philippines since 2014 by raising money and gifting school supplies and scholarships.

Since our missions were aligned through promoting the importance of education it seemed natural to combine forces to continue our missions throughout the Philippines.

Risks & Challenges

We are both grassroots organizations heavily dependent on volunteer power and donations from individuals like you. Help us raise the funds needed to host our first joint event which will include a Wahine Surf Clinic and beach clean up activity. Your donation is important to us & helps continue our work in the Philippines. Please inquire about joining us and volunteering for our event in October, 2016.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help by sharing this link to your community of friends and family.

Donations of surf equipment and other prizes such as stickers, t-shirts, school supplies, art supplies are all welcome. 

Thank you so much for your support.

story:
THREESIXTEEN

 

They said it was impossible

 

 
Introduction
 

In 2003, evangelist Clive Cornish and photographer Lathan Ball set out from Cardiff to walk 450 miles around the perimeter of Wales carrying a large wooden cross. The purpose of this walk was to challenge people to think again about the Gospel message. Before leaving home Clive’s family and friends said, “It was impossible”. As they arrived home four weeks later Clive passed under a large billboard carrying the advertising slogan “They said it was impossible.” Reminding Clive and Lathan that what is impossible with men is possible with God.

What is impossible with men is possible with God

Luke 18:27         

Clive, who comes from a broken background, knows that it was God’s love that rescued him from a life of alcohol, drugs, crime, violence and prison. For many people this gruelling expedition was seen as lunacy. But for Clive it provided a unique opportunity to challenge people to think again about the Gospel message and encourage both Christians and non-believers.

 

 

Clive and Lathan have now walked over 5000 miles with the cross. Travelling throughout Wales, from Land’s End to John O’Groats and from Jerusalem to Rome (in the Footsteps of the Apostle Paul). They have run in the London and New York Marathons and climbed Ben Nevis, Britain’s highest mountain, during winter. (Details of these activities and future plans can be seen on their website www.threesixteen.co.uk.)

The sight of the cross has provoked a range of emotions and responses, including anger, ridicule and interest. Viewing the cross forces people to ask "do I believe" and many people have stopped Clive to ask why, what must they do to become a Christian and how do they find out more.

 

The Project

Clive and Lathan would now like to produce a series of Bible studies inspired by events that occurred during these adventures. A short story will be told through film and pictures and relevant Bible verses and passages explored. The Bible studies will be designed for individual and group use and will also be employed as tools by Clive and Lathan during future activities. These exciting and uniquely presented Bible studies will be suitable for young and old alike.

The studies will be available as downloads to a computer, tablet or Smartphone and easily accessible from Threesixteen’s website and through online stores such as Amazon. Discussions have highlighted the accessibility provided by the development of a download or "app" and the provision of a short film, Bible passage, study questions and links to further resources in this easily accessible and popular format. The studies will also be provided on DVD. The Bible study download ("app") and DVD will be readily available to interested churches, groups and individuals around the world.

The first series of four studies has been carefully considered and filming is now underway.

  1. Study 1 – They said it was impossible 
  2. Study 2 – What am I worth
  3. Study 3 – Faith
  4. Study 4 – God's Provision

Draft studies shown to a church home group and in a prison Bible study have been well received. Positive feedback and encouraging suggestions are now being incorporated in to the individual studies.  

It is expected that each Bible study will take 2-3 weeks to complete. This unique and engaging series is been filmed and edited by photographer Lathan Ball and the stories told by Counties evangelist Clive Cornish. Development and production of the four Bible studies will be finished in May 2017.

To support the launch of the Bible studies and facilitate interaction with those who want to know more about Christianity and Threesixteen we would like to develop a responsive website. A responsive websites will adapt to the screen size of the viewing device providing optimum viewing on a laptop, tablet and Smartphone. A responsive website will not only give a positive viewing experience on a mobile device but support social media communication and interaction on the move and during events. Discussions with a web design company have been undertaken. The new website will be ready for launch in May/June 2017.

A small charge will be made for the Bible studies and the income will be employed in new projects helping Threesixteen to become a successful, self-supporting, on-going concern. Future walks and runs are planned for 2017 and 2018 and an art exhibition is under consideration.  Please support Threesixteen and help establish a new, exciting and viable ministry. 

 

 

Financial Requirements, Stretched Goals and Rewards

Threesixteen is now raising £3000 to cover the immediate cost of Bible study production and developing a responsive website.  The costs include support for website development through a professional design agency and the production of artwork to support web and app development, packaging and presentation.The development of an app and responsive website will provide the viewer with  an easily accessible, enjoyable, modern and up to date viewing experience on a Smartphone, tablet or computer.

However, we hope to raise additional funds to support the filming, editing and production of a second series of Bible studies based upon the ascents of Snowdon, Cader Idris and Pen-y-Fan - the Welsh Three Peaks.  The climbs of these mountains with the cross are complete and we excitedly look forward to editing the footage and producing three more Bible studies.

The project costs are shown below:

  • Web development & artwork                          £ 3000
  • Production of Bible study downloads          £ 3000      

                                                           Project Costs  £6000 

 

  •   Project promotion/commission costs        £750 

                                                                  Total Costs  £6750 

Project and promotion costs include the commission payable to Indiegogo and processing fees. 

If you are interested in supporting but are unable to donate please help by praying for this project. You can also support us by sharing our work with your friends and social networks - as all exposure is extremely helpful. Thank you, we are extremely grateful for all the help and support you provide.

 

 

Long term aims and objectives

Over 5000 miles have now been walked, Britain’s highest mountains have been climbed and challenging marathons successfully run. During these unique events many photographs have been taken and film shot under exciting and challenging conditions. The walks, runs and climbs have engaged a large audience of all ages and from all walks of life. The images and the film have been well received at presentations and exhibitions demonstrating that the excitement, adventure and unpredictability of listening to God and following Jesus captured people’s imaginations and interest.  

Under the name Threesixteen new creative projects are being planned and developed. It is hoped that these exciting projects will continue to interest, engage, challenge and inspire.

To support these activities Threesixteen will develop original Bible studies, films and documentaries that bring the bible and its message to life. By supporting this project you will help prepare a unique series of Bible studies and encourage and support the development of a new venture to creatively communicate Christianity.

 

 

 

Threesixteen – Communicating Christianity Creatively

Threesixteen was formed to creatively communicate Christianity:

  • Threesixteen’s unique projects will challenge people to think again about the Gospel message - that Jesus loves them no matter who they are or what they have done.  
  • Threesixteen promotes the Christian message through photography, film and other forms of creative communication.  
  • Threesixteen are different because our work reflects the excitement, adventure and unpredictability of listening to God and following Jesus.
  • Threesixteen aim to produce engaging Bible based studies, films and documentaries for individual and small group use.
  • Threesixteen will support its activities through the production of fresh and original pictures, films, books, Bible studies and presentations.
  • Threesixteen needs your prayers. Please pray for Threesixteen, its projects and the people who are touched by these activities

 

www.threesixteen.org.uk        www.threesixteen.co.uk        

www.threesixteen.tv                www.threesixteen.biz

 

 

Links:

Counties have made Jesus known for over 100 years. 

Clive and Fiona Cornish – Counties biography

http://212.67.220.142/evangelist-directory/cliv...

 

Inspire Magazine article (1) -

http://www.inspiremagazine.org.uk/Stories/National?storyaction=view&storyid=2029

Inspire Magazine article (2) - 

http://www.inspiremagazine.org.uk/articles?arti...

 

YouTube - 

Threesixteen’s first short film was titled “Your Will” and tells the story of an Easter ascent of Ben Nevis by Counties evangelist Clive Cornish.  During this gruelling climb Clive carried a large wooden cross over ice coated rocks and through soft snow. Clive’s cross measures 12ftx6ft and weighs 50lb. View the trailer or download the film to join Clive as he climbs the highest mountain in Great Britain.

http://www.threesixteen.org.uk/christian-films-...

story:
Short Summary

I am Catalin Rudolf, founder and head of the International Festival of Visual Arts VSLO (Vama Sub Lumini de Oscar). I have a 10-year long experience in film making and in photography having worked as a Cameraman. In 2010 I have started the VSLO festival which this year will be in its 7th edition.

This crowdfunding is dedicated to the project of my life which became important to many people in the domain of art.

The festival VSLO also known as "The Woodstock of Photography" does not compare to anything similar in the domain.

It unfolds during 10 days and the participants benefit from 14 different photography workshops, 5 film making workshops, daily classes of film and photography, painting, theater, daily concerts, photographic exhibitions, movies (short and long) screenings and much more. A cultural exchange is taking place among generations, professionals and amator, international and national actors.

VSLO means freedom of expression, a cultural and social melting pot. Participation is totally free of charge. All 400 photographers , film makers and passionate of visual arts (selected upon a portfolio) may take part to any activity at no cost. The build contacts, professional and social, forming a community and exchanging ideas and opinions.

There is a moment in life when each of us is thrilled to offer something that counts to the other people. It is the happiest moment.

Even if the financial part should not intervene in this context, it is essential for the implementation. 

I persevere, against all odds and pressures, to keep it a free of charge event. Nevertheless, its success and its exponential growth (in terms of subjects presented, of hours of courses, of number of lecturers and of participants) have been accompanied by an exponential growth of the production costs.

You can contribute in the development and the continuation of this unique festival. You can support and sponsor talented artists to get a free specialized training which otherwise they wouldn't  be able to afford. You can help young talents to reach out with their art. You can make people extremely happy and be part of this special community

What We Need & What You Get

The festival is unfolding over ten days and comprises several modules: photography, film, theater, painting and concerts.

Partnerships with various equipment manufacturers or other areas greatly help but the amounts are very far from the required value.

The Photo module includes daily theoretical and practical courses. Every day two or more themes are treated. The module over 12 seminars are scheduled on various topics related to photography. In total 14 lecturers from 7 countries will be present (many of them major international prize winners) and 10 special guests. Young artists are encouraged to present their photography and therefore 14 exhibitions are held. They are all dedicated to young artists who have not had the opportunity or did not have financial means to do so.

The Film making module includes theoretical and practical courses. The participants are encouraged to produce, during the 10 days of the festival, a short documentary or a story about the what is happening in the Vama Veche beach (and much is happening). Participants are passionate about this field but generally are people who can not afford expensive equipment or can not afford to attend classes delivered by world famous lecturers (a winner of an Emmy is among them) as these present at the VSLO. Every day there are projections in three different locations each one with its own specific: documentaries, short films and feature films. All these locations are chosen in open areas (beach) to be accessed by as many people as possible (the population in the Vama Veche sums up to many tens of thousands during August).

The Painting module takes place during the whole festival and aims to discover new talents both from Romania and abroad. The two speakers are Romanians making their living form painting in Germany and Finland. They can best express how and what to do in order to pass from an amatorial to a professional status. This year we will introduce also a new module: sculpture. 

The Theater module will be represented with 3 plays interpreted by young actors who are generally not accepted in big stages but they can express themselves freely in VSLO. Also module includes theoretical and practical courses about staging of a puppet show life size.

Outdoor concerts will take place over a period of three days and will be attended by foreign and Romanian groups. Some of them are already famous but some others are new in the Romanian and international music scene.
On music module we will have during of 4 days  drumming classes. The participants are encouraged to produce one show  which will be presented on the final day in front of all participants from all modules.

Funds will be needed to cover all the expenses for the lecturers (flights, general transport, accommodation, food etc). It will also finance the insurance for both the equipment put at the participants' disposal (professional cameras rental, lighting, computers for editing etc.) and the equipment necessary for the implementation of the event (screens, projectors, stage, lighting, etc.)

If this campaign will not raise the necessary funds, I will have to restrict some activities, to remove some modules and/or seek new partners.

Up to now it never happened and I have always collected the necessary financing. Someone up there is watching over me!

The Impact

Have you a talent that no one knows? Have you heard that a photograph of yours is not good? Have you ever wanted to have your own exhibition of paintings? Do you sing in a band but you have not been on a stage as everyone says "you're unknown"?

All these are possible at Vama Sub Lumini de Oscar!

One of the international languages, if not the most important, is art. Without art and culture, the world would be much poorer. Ideas, freedom of expression, talent are characteristics of individuals who can move freely around the world and for which there are no borders. It's incredible how this festival brings together people of art, young talents, open minded people who learn to express themselves. To free their imagination and to unveil what society and everyday life repress! The love for the beauty. The festival is already on the verge of its 6th edition. Over time the number of direct participants increased from a few dozen to a few hundred totaling many thousands. Thousands of friends in dozens of countries. Thousands of people who connected across borders through art.

All this happens in Vama Veche in Romania. Where, regardless where you come, you feel free, you feel important, you feel ... at home.

Risks & Challenges

The project started 7 years ago, at a time when nobody thought it would be possible to implement. A festival in which people interact 24/24 for 10 days it was hard to imagine. From this point of view, funding was a difficult obstacle. However there were few people who liked with the idea and helped me. I am talking about large companies that have sponsored or supported us through various forms (equipment, products ...). Nevertheless, the most important help came from the lecturers (photographers, film makers or visual art artists) who were invited to be part of this event. The were invited to hold a course of one day but in all cases they were present throughout the festival, answering questions, helping with various projects and being active in the community. This happens because they fall in love with the atmosphere of the festival, with Vama Veche, because they share the values of this event and ... of myself. Of my work, my dedication, my passion. I could say that I belong to the group of participants who are free to express their ideas, their wishes, their passion and which can come true. My passion is Vama Sub Lumini de Oscar.

Certainly the most difficult obstacle in achieving this dream is the lack of money. But I'm lucky to be surrounded by great people who helped me overcome the difficulties and helped me to make true this dream of mine and of hundreds other people!

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that many people can not contribute financially. Nevertheless:

- if you feel part of the energy in this festival,

-if you are aware that you can help not one but hundreds of talented young people to fulfill their dream,

-if you realise that you contribute to the success of artists who are visible worldwide,

-if you are among those who want to express themselves freely, to be appreciated for their work, to be part of a huge community recognizing them,

then surely you can help me!

Any article written about this action, any share of the project to friends, friends of friends, any posting on any social network, any good wordsaid, qualifies you to be part of this community. And all the above together, help us to get known, to be present in people's lives, to be strong, to be ourselves.

The best example is Indiegogo, Inc., which helps us to express ourselves and show the world who we are! From now Indiegogo, Inc. is part of our community!
story_txt:
Short Summary
I am Catalin Rudolf, founder and head of the International Festival of Visual Arts VSLO (Vama Sub Lumini de Oscar). I have a 10-year long experience in film making and in photography having worked as a Cameraman. In 2010 I have started the VSLO festival which this year will be in its 7th edition.
This crowdfunding is dedicated to the project of my life which became important to many people in the domain of art.
The festival VSLO also known as "The Woodstock of Photography" does not compare to anything similar in the domain.
It unfolds during 10 days and the participants benefit from 14 different photography workshops, 5 film making workshops, daily classes of film and photography, painting, theater, daily concerts, photographic exhibitions, movies (short and long) screenings and much more. A cultural exchange is taking place among generations, professionals and amator, international and national actors.
VSLO means freedom of expression, a cultural and social melting pot. Participation is totally free of charge. All 400 photographers , film makers and passionate of visual arts (selected upon a portfolio) may take part to any activity at no cost. The build contacts, professional and social, forming a community and exchanging ideas and opinions.
There is a moment in life when each of us is thrilled to offer something that counts to the other people. It is the happiest moment.
Even if the financial part should not intervene in this context, it is essential for the implementation. 
I persevere, against all odds and pressures, to keep it a free of charge event. Nevertheless, its success and its exponential growth (in terms of subjects presented, of hours of courses, of number of lecturers and of participants) have been accompanied by an exponential growth of the production costs.
You can contribute in the development and the continuation of this unique festival. You can support and sponsor talented artists to get a free specialized training which otherwise they wouldn't  be able to afford. You can help young talents to reach out with their art. You can make people extremely happy and be part of this special community

What We Need & What You Get
The festival is unfolding over ten days and comprises several modules: photography, film, theater, painting and concerts.
Partnerships with various equipment manufacturers or other areas greatly help but the amounts are very far from the required value.
The Photo module includes daily theoretical and practical courses. Every day two or more themes are treated. The module over 12 seminars are scheduled on various topics related to photography. In total 14 lecturers from 7 countries will be present (many of them major international prize winners) and 10 special guests. Young artists are encouraged to present their photography and therefore 14 exhibitions are held. They are all dedicated to young artists who have not had the opportunity or did not have financial means to do so.
The Film making module includes theoretical and practical courses. The participants are encouraged to produce, during the 10 days of the festival, a short documentary or a story about the what is happening in the Vama Veche beach (and much is happening). Participants are passionate about this field but generally are people who can not afford expensive equipment or can not afford to attend classes delivered by world famous lecturers (a winner of an Emmy is among them) as these present at the VSLO. Every day there are projections in three different locations each one with its own specific: documentaries, short films and feature films. All these locations are chosen in open areas (beach) to be accessed by as many people as possible (the population in the Vama Veche sums up to many tens of thousands during August).
The Painting module takes place during the whole festival and aims to discover new talents both from Romania and abroad. The two speakers are Romanians making their living form painting in Germany and Finland. They can best express how and what to do in order to pass from an amatorial to a professional status. This year we will introduce also a new module: sculpture. 
The Theater module will be represented with 3 plays interpreted by young actors who are generally not accepted in big stages but they can express themselves freely in VSLO. Also module includes theoretical and practical courses about staging of a puppet show life size.
Outdoor concerts will take place over a period of three days and will be attended by foreign and Romanian groups. Some of them are already famous but some others are new in the Romanian and international music scene.On music module we will have during of 4 days  drumming classes. The participants are encouraged to produce one show  which will be presented on the final day in front of all participants from all modules.
Funds will be needed to cover all the expenses for the lecturers (flights, general transport, accommodation, food etc). It will also finance the insurance for both the equipment put at the participants' disposal (professional cameras rental, lighting, computers for editing etc.) and the equipment necessary for the implementation of the event (screens, projectors, stage, lighting, etc.)
If this campaign will not raise the necessary funds, I will have to restrict some activities, to remove some modules and/or seek new partners.
Up to now it never happened and I have always collected the necessary financing. Someone up there is watching over me!

The Impact
Have you a talent that no one knows? Have you heard that a photograph of yours is not good? Have you ever wanted to have your own exhibition of paintings? Do you sing in a band but you have not been on a stage as everyone says "you're unknown"?
All these are possible at Vama Sub Lumini de Oscar!
One of the international languages, if not the most important, is art. Without art and culture, the world would be much poorer. Ideas, freedom of expression, talent are characteristics of individuals who can move freely around the world and for which there are no borders. It's incredible how this festival brings together people of art, young talents, open minded people who learn to express themselves. To free their imagination and to unveil what society and everyday life repress! The love for the beauty. The festival is already on the verge of its 6th edition. Over time the number of direct participants increased from a few dozen to a few hundred totaling many thousands. Thousands of friends in dozens of countries. Thousands of people who connected across borders through art.
All this happens in Vama Veche in Romania. Where, regardless where you come, you feel free, you feel important, you feel ... at home.

Risks & Challenges
The project started 7 years ago, at a time when nobody thought it would be possible to implement. A festival in which people interact 24/24 for 10 days it was hard to imagine. From this point of view, funding was a difficult obstacle. However there were few people who liked with the idea and helped me. I am talking about large companies that have sponsored or supported us through various forms (equipment, products ...). Nevertheless, the most important help came from the lecturers (photographers, film makers or visual art artists) who were invited to be part of this event. The were invited to hold a course of one day but in all cases they were present throughout the festival, answering questions, helping with various projects and being active in the community. This happens because they fall in love with the atmosphere of the festival, with Vama Veche, because they share the values of this event and ... of myself. Of my work, my dedication, my passion. I could say that I belong to the group of participants who are free to express their ideas, their wishes, their passion and which can come true. My passion is Vama Sub Lumini de Oscar.
Certainly the most difficult obstacle in achieving this dream is the lack of money. But I'm lucky to be surrounded by great people who helped me overcome the difficulties and helped me to make true this dream of mine and of hundreds other people!

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that many people can not contribute financially. Nevertheless:
- if you feel part of the energy in this festival,
-if you are aware that you can help not one but hundreds of talented young people to fulfill their dream,
-if you realise that you contribute to the success of artists who are visible worldwide,
-if you are among those who want to express themselves freely, to be appreciated for their work, to be part of a huge community recognizing them,
then surely you can help me!
Any article written about this action, any share of the project to friends, friends of friends, any posting on any social network, any good wordsaid, qualifies you to be part of this community. And all the above together, help us to get known, to be present in people's lives, to be strong, to be ourselves.
The best example is Indiegogo, Inc., which helps us to express ourselves and show the world who we are! From now Indiegogo, Inc. is part of our community!

story:
You can buy Speakify licenses for refugees in Sweden in this crowd founding. This way you help refugees to learn Swedish and start their life in a new society faster and you´ll provide Speakify with more resources so we can develop our method further. 

Why Speakify?

I came to Sweden to study my master in industrial engineering. Naturally I wanted to learn the language to understand the people around me and get to know them.

It should not take you more than a few weeks before you really start to understand people!
I did a little bit of academic research, talked to people that could speak a few languages, referred to my own experiences of learning English and Swedish and from that I made a new method. My dream is to improve the way people learn a language throughout the world by Speakify´s method™. 

Help us to help refugees!

Help refugees and immigrants build a new life, by integration and reduction of exclusion, thru acceptance by Speakify´s language platform, since the key to integration is the language. Today refugees and immigrants are coming to Europe. In Sweden 60% of the daily conversation is made by only 500 words. Speakify is focusing on those particular and most common words, to get the user integrated in the society as quickly as possible.

Refugees and immigrants are faced with exclusion and isolation while most of them just have the wish to blend in and start building their new life.

With Speakify they can become a part of society, through understanding language and culture. It is vitally important to know how people in the society think and act for a better communication.

"Nobody can do everything but everyone can do something"

We can join together, contribute and help refugees and immigrants to a better life and hope for a brighter future. We can all do something to help and support each other.

Refugees and immigrants come here with almost nothing in their pockets and your donations will make it possible for them to get licenses to use Speakify´s methods and learn the Swedish language.
Your donations will make it possible for us to keep developing our method, grow and be seen by even more people that need our help.

Learning the language is a way to get into the new country's society, with a different culture and different values.

With its methods, Speakify contributes to help refugees and immigrants to a quicker way of getting integrated into the society.

What is Speakify?

Speakify is a low cost private, mobile, reliable and time flexible language mentor, which teaches people a second language.  It is a learning language platform with a high quality standard on graphics, adjusted exercises that are user-friendly based on the user’s native language.  
Speakify reduces the language learning time not by focusing on the grammatical aspects of a language, but on the most important words. Speakify makes immigrants ready to communicate, get integrated and find a job.

The Speakify method is based on the belief that you can use their knowledge of their native language and thus make the process easier, more optimized and faster.

Thru Speakify´s platform the user gets access to everything he or she needs in order to handle different daily situations.
The efficiency comes with the optimized learning of the most essentials words and phrases. 


The most frequent everyday words - "everyday Swedish"

  • Adapts to the level of knowledge
  • Story´s with exercises in several chapters
  • The support of the student's native language
  • Using educational technology for teaching grammar
  • Education and methodology is included


Today Speakify collaborates with the Aphasia association, Karlstad municipality, Hammarö municipality and Region Värmland.

Your donation leads to a license a refugee or an immigrant can use. Speakify´s language platform is helping them to get integrated faster in the Swedish society.
They can begin to see and feel that life here is possible and that they are supported on their journey back to a normal life.

Donating licenses to refugees also makes it possible for us to keep developing our method, grow and be seen by even more people that need our help.

Stretch goals:

Where does you money go? Here is our targets of the campaign and what we are going to do with some of the money we receive.

  • 6500 $
    - New Type of exercises for Advanced level
    - 2 New Advanced chapter with text
    - User Statistics
    - Tutor guide to Speakify 
  • +8,000 $ (14,500 $)
    - Word by Word Translation
    - Audio on native languages (for illiterate and impaired vision)
    - Online Dictionary describing all forms for each word
    - User / Expert Translation tool (to any language) 
  • +10,000 $  (24,500 $)
    - Answers where users can ask questions in their own language
    - Tools for teachers to make own exercises
    - My classroom teachers and students can share file and exercises 
  • +12000 $ (36,500 $)
    - Chatting with Artificial intelligence
    - Smart Ass Language buddy™ in text (Speakify teaches you to speak correctly) 
  • +15000 $ (51,500$)
    -Voice recognition
    -Voice chat with Smart Ass Language buddy™
Together we can contribute, support and help them to a better life and give them a brighter future and their quality of life back. 

Clear reports
We make sure your licenses goes to those who are really in need. We make a periodic report and update you on the user’s progress and Speakify´s development regarding our stretch goals. 


"... In Ethiopia we say that you need two hands to clap, with Speakify I've got two hands" *

* Ahmed, McDonald’s 


Help us work together to do good everywhere

SFI education
Refugee accommodation
Municipality placed
Unaccompanied children


FAQ
Be the first one!


Thank you for your support!
Please visit our website and share our campaign on Facebook.

story:
Who are we?

CDS (Conservation and sustainable development) belong to a small non-governmental organization that facilitates environmental education and research in the Amazonian cloud forest of Peru. Our team is collaboration between international scientists, including three Ph.D. biologists, people from the local town of Oxapampa, students, practitioners and volunteers from around the globe; all of whom are committed to the regeneration the natural environment using clean and sustainable energy.

Where are we?

The CDS center is located in the buffer zone of the Oxapampa, Ashaninka, and Yanesha UNESCO Biosphere Reserve. CDS is surrounded by 15.5 hectares of cloud forest, two streams, riparian forest, a reforested area, and cultivation areas with local fruit crops. The Oxapampa, Ashaninka, Yanesha UNESCO Biosphere Reserve encompasses 18,673.79 hectares (4,614,394 Acres) of primary and secondary forest from 300 – 4500 meters above sea level (984-14,763 feet above sea level).

What do we do?

With the help of our national and international volunteers we are implementing an environmental education center in the high cloud forest of the Amazonian (Conservation and Sustainable Development -CDS), where we are implementing a range of sustainable projects in order to teach and lead by example.

There are a number of projects at the center:

-  Environmental education courses for university students

-  Education and practical training for volunteers

-  Replanting and reforesting native flora

-  Recycling and collecting plastic bottles from local business

-  Production of compost tea to create organic fertilizer

-  Vegetable garden using only organic pesticides

-  Production of non-toxic pesticides using natural ingredients

-  Monitoring water quality using macroinvertebrates, insects, lichens plants etc. as bioindicators

-  Production of energy with a small hydroelectric system

-  Using recycled materials to construct facilities at the center

How can we improve CDS and how can you help?

To maximize the efficiency and sustainability of our efforts at the CDS centre, we need to finish our new building for toilets and bathrooms for our students and volunteers. We will use a solar heater we design this year with an intern and a biodigestor and a grey water system to treat the waters. We already have the metal roof and the grey water system design. The total cost of the building and the implementation of the bathrooms is $3,500 USD. A small amount compared with the invaluable worth of the forest, but unfortunately we need help to reach our funding goal.

Our project budget is:

1.  Picking up bottles in Oxapampa City = $200. Thanks to several shops (restaurants, shops and bars) we collected 3000 plastic bottles. However, to finish our building we need to collect approximately 1500 more bottles.

2.  Buying and installation of the biodigestor = $1,200

3.  4 Toilets and 4 showers $570

4.  Materials for construction with transportation to the center (cement, sand to fill the bottles and wood for the roof) = $780

5. Construction and Implementation of 3 modules of the solar heater we already designed = $ 750

 

With the generosity of our benefactors, our education center has the potential to create a huge positive impact on our unique environment. By Leading and teaching by example, we aim to use sustainable treatments for our waste. This will allow us to be close the loop of our waste and carry out our regeneration activities with minimal detrimental effects on the environment. Our pioneering education center will be the first sustainable project of its kind in the biosphere reserve and in the country.

We are deeply grateful for all the support we receive, without which CDS would be unable to have a positive impact on our much loved environment. Each contribution will help us to preserve the magnificent cloud forest of Peru in a sustainable way, and also allow us to teach the next generation of people how to care for their environment.

 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------

 

¿Quiénes somos?

CDS (conservación y desarrollo sostenible) pertenece a una pequeña organización no gubernamental que facilita la educación ambiental e investigación en el bosque nuboso amazónico del Perú. Nuestro equipo está formado por científicos nacionales y extranjeros incluyendo a tres biólogos de Ph.D., amigos locales de la ciudad de Oxapampa, estudiantes, profesionales y voluntarios de todo el mundo; todos ellos está comprometidos con la regeneración del entorno natural utilizando energía limpia y sostenible. 

 

¿Dónde estamos?

El centro de educación CDS se encuentra en la zona de amortiguamiento de la  reserva de Biosfera Oxapampa, Asháninka Yanesha de la UNESCO. CDS está rodeado de 15,5 hectáreas de bosque nublado, dos arroyos, bosque ribereño, varias áreas reforestadas y áreas de cultivo con frutales locales. La reserva de la Biosfera de la UNESCO de Oxapampa, Ashaninka, Yanesha abarca 18.673,79 hectáreas (4.614.394 Acres) de bosque primario y secundario de 300 – 4500 metros sobre el nivel del mar (984-14.763 pies sobre el nivel del mar).

 

¿Qué hacemos?

Con la ayuda de voluntarios nacionales e internacionales estamos implementando un centro de educación ambiental en el bosque alto nuboso de la Amazonía (Conservación y Desarrollo Sostenible- CDS), donde estamos implementando una variedad de proyectos sostenibles en el fin de enseñar y predicar con el ejemplo.

 

Tenemos una serie de proyectos en el centro:

- huerta orgánica de vegetales

- cursos de educación ambiental para estudiantes de las Universidades

- educación y formación práctica para los voluntarios, practicantes y pasantes

- replantación y reforestación de flora nativa

- reciclaje y recolección de botellas plásticas de locales comerciales

- producción de biol para usar como abono orgánico

- uso de plaguicidas orgánicos

- producción de pesticidas no tóxicos con ingredientes naturales

- monitoreo calidad de agua utilizando macroinvertebrados, insectos , líquenes plantas etc. como bioindicadores

- producción de energía con un sistema hidroeléctrico pequeño

- Utilización de materiales reciclados para construir instalaciones en el centro

 

¿cómo podemos mejorar CDS y cómo puede ayudar?

Para maximizar la eficiencia y sostenibilidad de nuestros esfuerzos en el centro CDS, tenemos que terminar nuestro nuevo edificio de baños y duchas para nuestros estudiantes y voluntarios. Vamos a utilizar un calentador solar que diseñamos este año con una pasante y un biodigestor y un sistema de agua gris para el tratamiento de las aguas. Ya tenemos el techo metálicao y el diseño del sistema de agua gris. El costo total del edificio y la implementación de los baños son de $3.500 USD. Una pequeña cantidad en comparación con el inestimable valor del bosque, pero lamentablemente necesitamos ayuda para alcanzar nuestra meta de financiamiento.

 

El presupuesto del proyecto es:

1. recoger botellas en la ciudad de Oxapampa = $200. Gracias a varios comercios (restaurantes, tiendas y bares) recolectamos 3000 botellas de plástico. Sin embargo, para terminar nuestro edificio tenemos que recoger aproximadamente 1500 botellas más. 

2. compra e instalación del biodigestor = $1.200

3. 4 inodoros y 4 duchas $570

4. Materiales para la construcción con transporte al centro (cemento, arena para llenar las botellas y madera para el techo) = $780

5. Construcción e implementación de 3 módulos del calentador solar que ya diseñamos = $ 750

 

Con la generosidad de nuestros colaboradores, nuestro centro de educación tiene el potencial para crear un gran impacto positivo en nuestro ambiente único. Para liderar y enseñar con el ejemplo, nuestro objetivo es utilizar tratamientos sostenibles para nuestros residuos. Esto nos permite estar cerca del círculo de nuestros residuos y llevar a cabo nuestras actividades de regeneración con efectos perjudiciales mínimos sobre el medio ambiente.

Nuestro centro pionero de la educación será el primer proyecto sostenible de su clase en la reserva de la Biosfera y en el país.  Estamos profundamente agradecidos por todo el apoyo que recibimos, sin la cual CDS sería incapaz de tener un impacto positivo en nuestro entorno tan amado. Cada aporte nos ayuda a preservar el magnífico bosque nuboso del Perú de manera sostenible y también nos permiten enseñar a la próxima generación de personas a cuidar su entorno
