Nuestro equipo está formado por científicos nacionales y extranjeros incluyendo a tres biólogos de Ph.D., amigos locales de la ciudad de Oxapampa, estudiantes, profesionales y voluntarios de todo el mundo; todos ellos está comprometidos con la regeneración del entorno natural utilizando energía limpia y sostenible.  ¿Dónde estamos?El centro de educación CDS se encuentra en la zona de amortiguamiento de la  reserva de Biosfera Oxapampa, Asháninka Yanesha de la UNESCO. CDS está rodeado de 15,5 hectáreas de bosque nublado, dos arroyos, bosque ribereño, varias áreas reforestadas y áreas de cultivo con frutales locales. La reserva de la Biosfera de la UNESCO de Oxapampa, Ashaninka, Yanesha abarca 18.673,79 hectáreas (4.614.394 Acres) de bosque primario y secundario de 300 – 4500 metros sobre el nivel del mar (984-14.763 pies sobre el nivel del mar). ¿Qué hacemos?Con la ayuda de voluntarios nacionales e internacionales estamos implementando un centro de educación ambiental en el bosque alto nuboso de la Amazonía (Conservación y Desarrollo Sostenible- CDS), donde estamos implementando una variedad de proyectos sostenibles en el fin de enseñar y predicar con el ejemplo. Tenemos una serie de proyectos en el centro:- huerta orgánica de vegetales- cursos de educación ambiental para estudiantes de las Universidades- educación y formación práctica para los voluntarios, practicantes y pasantes- replantación y reforestación de flora nativa- reciclaje y recolección de botellas plásticas de locales comerciales- producción de biol para usar como abono orgánico- uso de plaguicidas orgánicos- producción de pesticidas no tóxicos con ingredientes naturales- monitoreo calidad de agua utilizando macroinvertebrados, insectos , líquenes plantas etc. como bioindicadores- producción de energía con un sistema hidroeléctrico pequeño- Utilización de materiales reciclados para construir instalaciones en el centro ¿cómo podemos mejorar CDS y cómo puede ayudar?Para maximizar la eficiencia y sostenibilidad de nuestros esfuerzos en el centro CDS, tenemos que terminar nuestro nuevo edificio de baños y duchas para nuestros estudiantes y voluntarios. Vamos a utilizar un calentador solar que diseñamos este año con una pasante y un biodigestor y un sistema de agua gris para el tratamiento de las aguas. Ya tenemos el techo metálicao y el diseño del sistema de agua gris. El costo total del edificio y la implementación de los baños son de $3.500 USD. Una pequeña cantidad en comparación con el inestimable valor del bosque, pero lamentablemente necesitamos ayuda para alcanzar nuestra meta de financiamiento. El presupuesto del proyecto es:1. recoger botellas en la ciudad de Oxapampa = $200. Gracias a varios comercios (restaurantes, tiendas y bares) recolectamos 3000 botellas de plástico. Sin embargo, para terminar nuestro edificio tenemos que recoger aproximadamente 1500 botellas más. 2. compra e instalación del biodigestor = $1.2003. 4 inodoros y 4 duchas $5704. Materiales para la construcción con transporte al centro (cemento, arena para llenar las botellas y madera para el techo) = $7805. Construcción e implementación de 3 módulos del calentador solar que ya diseñamos = $ 750 Con la generosidad de nuestros colaboradores, nuestro centro de educación tiene el potencial para crear un gran impacto positivo en nuestro ambiente único. Para liderar y enseñar con el ejemplo, nuestro objetivo es utilizar tratamientos sostenibles para nuestros residuos. Esto nos permite estar cerca del círculo de nuestros residuos y llevar a cabo nuestras actividades de regeneración con efectos perjudiciales mínimos sobre el medio ambiente.Nuestro centro pionero de la educación será el primer proyecto sostenible de su clase en la reserva de la Biosfera y en el país.  Estamos profundamente agradecidos por todo el apoyo que recibimos, sin la cual CDS sería incapaz de tener un impacto positivo en nuestro entorno tan amado. Cada aporte nos ayuda a preservar el magnífico bosque nuboso del Perú de manera sostenible y también nos permiten enseñar a la próxima generación de personas a cuidar su entorno

story:
How it works ?

 

 

 

 

Laptop trackpad isn’t the best tools for gaming or working while moving.

So we design the PLAND mouse pad.

A unique mouse pad made to play or work anywhere. Like at home.

 

PLAND Gaming medium

 

PLAND Working small

 

If you have a seat and no space for a mouse or must seat on the ground, if you want a real deal in gaming or working. Use PLAND mouse pad.

Even if you only use your laptop to play solitary or work with notepad, it will be far better to do with PLAND mouse pad.

 

Gaming in the street !

 

From your bed to your sofa, from a pub to ISS, from a polar station to a submarine, in a plane or in a bus, now you can play or work like at home. Left handed people can use it (with keys remap)!

A Game desire or an urge of work when you want, despite of the place with PLAND mouse pad.

The design of the PLAND mouse pad is a unique combination of experience and work. We change the materials, redraw the design and test it as many times as it need to create an almost perfect shape.

PLAND Gaming & Working schematics

 

Moreover, we work on comfort and durability. Tests and pre-design units where created in the process and we spent hundreds hours of testing it, working and playing to be almost sure that our design is the best fitted to you.

 

PLAND Evolution

 

Thickness selection was a hard choice, 4 mm for the gaming series, 3 mm for the working series. We try thicker and less tick but at the end, these heights are the best for flexibility and comfort.

 

PLAND Close-up

 

We compared many products to be sure that PLAND mouse pad provides a high quality comfort, an accurate pointing experience and a great durability and most of all, a unique experience.

We start now our Indiegogo campaign as a worldwide test bed to perfect our product and be able to finance the first mass production. We work hard to offer you something different but, even if we make as many tests as we can in many locations, we think that you can help us to make our product better.

We are ready to send our prototypes, you will not spend your money for nothing.

Light, easily storable, comfortable, resistant, clever, simple...PLAND mouse pad.

 

PLAND Gaming medium

 

PLAND Working small

 

To reach our goals, we wish 20 000 €:

 

  • New batch of PLAND mouse pad
  • New size (XS)
  • and more things you will like...

 

Thanks for your support, have a great PLAND experience.

 

 

Visit us ! For far more details…

story:
Hello everyone,

My name is Akin Yildiz. I am an inventor/entrepreneur. Just over two years ago I started an online plants & electronics research project,  the Plant Doctor - Plant Care Instruments.

facebook.com/theplantdoctor2014

instructables.com/member/Akin+Yildiz/

Our page has over 1 million views and +1000 followers and continuously growing. We currently offer DIY kits and online consultation worldwide.  However the funds raised during this campaign will help further develop this project and bring more awareness to smart plant technology around the world. We will also be able to reach more families across the world by offering cheaper kits. 

 

Plants & Electronics are two very important fields of human life yet most of us know so little about them. I believe to truly solve this problem, we need a game like environment where the end user learns as they complete it. Most adults have little time to learn new skills like programming to pass onto their children. This educational kit was designed to be suitable for any age group (non-toxic, solder free). DIY electronics kits have created a brand new industry and a giant "arduino making" market. Yet to this day there is still no kit that focuses primarly on plants & electronics. We have changed that two years ago. Our vision has gained attention over the last year resulting in many conversations around the globe across DIY greenhouse farmers and total beginners both in plants & electronics including programming.

Imagine receiving a box. Inside you have electronic components that can communicate with plants. You put together these color coded components, like a puzzle. Once completed, you activate the computer and learn how to program it. You are now left with an instrument that can teach you how to garden; instructables.com/id/the-Plant-Doctor-family/

All of our instruments are open source hardware & software - no previous experience is necessary to assemble, program, or garden - just plug and play.  We have been offering in-person and online workshops to ages between 6 to 60+. People who have never programmed or built circuits are now able to walk away from a 2 hour long class knowing enough to automate their homes, greenhouses, workshops - experiencing programming and circuit building first hand.  

Please check out the links above to learn more about our organization.  With YOUR help we will be able to teach the world how to program, build circuits and garden. Please donate what you can, like and share this post. 

 

Thank you very much

the Plant Doctor team,

 

plantpop.com/blog/2016/3/30/the-plant-doctor-smart-plant-pots

story:
There is an old saying in China,

"A drop of water shall be returned with a burst of spring."

”滴水之恩当涌泉相报“

-----------------www.indacube.com-----------------

Who I am

Before telling you who I am, I would like to tell you a story.

One day, I was on a train to work, and there was an old Chinese lady sitting next to me. She saw me reading a Chinese book then started a conversation with me. (The conversation was in Chinese.)

"You're learning Chinese?", asked the lady.

"No, I'm teaching Chinese," said me.  

"Oh...that's not good. Teachers don't make money." She was so serious that I didn't know what to answer, so I just smiled. 

"You should be a lawyer or a doctor. They make a lot of money. You're young. Don't waste time on teaching." The lady continued. 

After our short conversation, the lady left the train and her kind career proposals to me. I could tell she was deeply concerned about my future and I really appreciated that. She wasn't the first person trying to talk me out of the education field. Because of their words, I hesitated and staggered. However, my hesitation didn't stop me from marching forward to what I love to do: teaching. Last winter, I started this language school on my own.

Why the Campaign Is Important to Me

The campaign is important not only because it's for me but it will benefit other people. Students need better classes. Teachers need better benefits. Other institutions need to see there are people who really care about their students. The society needs to see how important education is. Everyone is talking how important education is, but no one tells their children to be a teacher.  And that's why I'm here, and that's why this campaign is important.

The Magnitude You Can Help Me Achieve

Two scenarios. If the campaign is fully funded, we will be very likely to have further investments, which may give the business a very prosperous future. If the campaign is underfunded, we might encounter greater challenges in dealing with financial situations. However, we will not easily give up and will try our best to continue chasing our dreams.

What We Need

To get the business on the ground, we need an initial funding to start out. Some of the major expenses include but not limited to, rent, teachers' salary, legal and accounting services, insurance, company registration fees, business line, textbooks, website and domain, business software, office supplies and advertisements. 

We're asking for a little bit over $7,000 for starting out the business. It's a rather small number compared to many other projects on Indiegogo. With your help, we hope this little amount of money will keep our dreams alive in 2017. 

How You Can Help

It's actually quite simple to help. You just need to choose one of the perks from the right side; then you're contributing. By selecting a perk, you will also receive our different types of services (Everything About China and Self-learning Start Kit will be delivered to your email address) depending on the level of your contribution. 

What You Get

By backing us, you will get various perks. Depending on the level of your contribution, you will gain access and insight into Chinese food, culture, and other fun stuff at only $6; immediate access to learning Chinese by utilizing our self-starter kit at merely $29; and Chinese classes for all level of students at different prices. 

Why Are We So Different

Accessible Location

Indacube is conveniently located and easily accessible in the heart of the Financial District, New York. We're based in a WeWork location (85 Broad Street, 16th Floor, New York, NY 10004).

Flexible Schedule 

Indacube is not only opening early in the morning but also late at night. The office is running from 10 am to 10 pm every day. Same hours for weekends. Once you select a perk containing instructional classes, we will contact you within 24 hours to learn the best times for you. Time is all you got now.

Unique Learning Experience

Learning in the CUBE has never been like learning in other places. We're trying to build the most student-friendly and individualized learning environment by adapting our curriculum to students, constantly receiving students' feedback, minimizing students' pressure and periodically evaluating teachers' performance. 

Experiential Learning Events

We call it "experiential" because students' future experience in learning Chinese should be based on their interests and feedbacks. We have been trying to make our classes more culturally meaningful, physically interactive, verbally communicative, and adaptively responsive to the current world. For instance, students may have their class in Museum of Chinese Americans to get a glimpse of Chinese history and culture. Students may go to a restaurant to practice conversations for ordering foods. Other events will be arranged according to students' needs. 

Our Teachers Care

Yes, we care. That's the reason why we chose to be teachers. We believe teachers are the most important resource that we have so that we put tremendous attention on teachers through our consistent support. The CUBE cares for its teachers and the teachers care for their students in return.

Complimentary Beverages

There's nothing much to say. This is IMPORTANT.

How We Impact

Learning should just happen. Yet, there're so many unsatisfying factors that potentially hinder people's learning. We're here to change that. 

  • Once again, we care, even though we know it's cliche to say. We truly care about our students' progress and teachers' benefits. It's not only a business for us but also it's a school for people. 
  • We believe money should never be an issue for people who wants to learn. To make learning more affordable, we're offering different discounts for educators, college students, and people who come in our less busy hours.

Risks & Challenges

Although Indacube is well-prepared and strongly competitive in its industry, it's hard to avoid risks and challenges as a new business. Two major conceivable challenges could be the lack of clients and financial pressure. Thanks to crowdfunding, with your help, we can overcome these challenges at the same time. The mechanism is quite simple: once you have invested in us, you're not only a benefactor but also a client. 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can always share this campaign with your friends and family.Next time you see them, they’ll be greeting you with Nihao (hello) and ordering Chinese takeout in Chinese!

Don't forget to check out our website for more information. 

-----------------www.indacube.com-----------------

LET'S MAKE IT HAPPEN!

story:
***Update***  

Thank you soo much to all who contributed!  It was a great and interesting experience.  All the promoting lead to reconnecting with some great friends and reviving these social relationships was the most valuable part of the crowdfunder, so Thank you for that as well! 

We managed to raise $1085 and it will definitely help with the fees.  I will be deciding on my PhD & education plans for the next year soon, but it's looking like I may need to defer by yet another year.  Thanks again to all! =)  Perks should be shipping out this week

story:
STORY :

When I was 21 years old, I had a dream to go to the United States. I was the first one in my family to go somewhere abroad and I did not have any support from my school.

Most of the agencies that were offering a service to help students to find an internship abroad were charging an unreasonable amount of fees that I could not afford! I realized at this point that there was a gap in the market that needed to be filled.

 

Lors de mes 21 ans, j'ai eu le rêve de partir aux USA. J'étais la première de ma famille à partir et mon école n'avait aucun réseau sur place. Fou ! Les agences me proposaient des prix exorbitants que je ne pouvais pas me permettre. Je me suis rendue compte qu'il y avait quelque chose à faire. 

 

WHY?

This project is important as it allows each student to make its dreams true and get a real experience abroad with our support. 

Ce projet est important car il permet à tous étudiants de réaliser son rêve et de profitez d'une vrai expérience à l'étranger avec notre support.

Vous avez pouvoir nous aider à continuer notre chemin et toujours vous proposer des expériences de qualité avec notre support. C'est VOTRE projet et nous le faisons pour VOUS.

Joignez nous maintenant !

You will be able to help us to keep going and being able to bring you great experiences abroad. This is YOUR project and we are doing it for YOU.

Join us Now!

 

WE NEED YOU !

Nous avons besoin d'un fond de 5000€ afin de rajouter des applications sur notre site ainsi que de démarcher des entreprises ou des organisation grâce à un marketing ciblé. La plateforme est en ligne ici - nous devons maintenant nous faire connaitre !

 

We need 5000€ of funding as we want to add more features on our platform but also to spread our message to companies and organisations thanks to an online marketing. You can see the plateform here - we need you NOW to make us know.

 

 GIFTS ^^

Everyone loves gifts. I love it so much. Thanks to your donation, you will be able to choose a gift you love on Amazon. Of course, if you don't have idea, we will help you on this :)

Tout le monde aime les cadeaux c'est pourquoi en échange de vos contribution, vous pouvez choisir le cadeau qui vous plait sur Amazon. Si vous n'avez pas d'idée, nous vous aiderons , vous pouvez compter sur nous !!

 

GOOD FOR THE WORLD

 

We are partnership with Children of Mekong. In order to help their education, we will donate 5% on each service we are selling ! 

Nous sommes en partenariat avec Children of Mekong. Afin de les aider dans leur éducation, nous donnons 5% de chacun des services que nous vendons!

 

L'objectif principal est de nous faire connaitre et nous avons besoin de vous afin d'établir une belle campagne marketing de lancement. On compte sur vous !

Our first objective is to spread our word and we need you to build an amazing launch marketing campaign. We believe in you !

 

PARTAGER NOTRE PROJET - SHARE OUR PROJECT

Ce projet est important car il permet à tous étudiants de réaliser son rêve et de profitez d'une vrai expérience à l'étranger avec notre support.
Vous avez pouvoir nous aider à continuer notre chemin et toujours vous proposer des expériences de qualité avec notre support. C'est VOTRE projet et nous le faisons pour VOUS.
Joignez nous maintenant !
You will be able to help us to keep going and being able to bring you great experiences abroad. This is YOUR project and we are doing it for YOU.
Join us Now!
 
WE NEED YOU !
Nous avons besoin d'un fond de 5000€ afin de rajouter des applications sur notre site ainsi que de démarcher des entreprises ou des organisation grâce à un marketing ciblé. La plateforme est en ligne ici - nous devons maintenant nous faire connaitre !
 
We need 5000€ of funding as we want to add more features on our platform but also to spread our message to companies and organisations thanks to an online marketing. You can see the plateform here - we need you NOW to make us know.
 

 GIFTS ^^
Everyone loves gifts. I love it so much. Thanks to your donation, you will be able to choose a gift you love on Amazon. Of course, if you don't have idea, we will help you on this :)
Tout le monde aime les cadeaux c'est pourquoi en échange de vos contribution, vous pouvez choisir le cadeau qui vous plait sur Amazon. Si vous n'avez pas d'idée, nous vous aiderons , vous pouvez compter sur nous !!
 
GOOD FOR THE WORLD
 
We are partnership with Children of Mekong. In order to help their education, we will donate 5% on each service we are selling ! 
Nous sommes en partenariat avec Children of Mekong. Afin de les aider dans leur éducation, nous donnons 5% de chacun des services que nous vendons!
 
L'objectif principal est de nous faire connaitre et nous avons besoin de vous afin d'établir une belle campagne marketing de lancement. On compte sur vous !
Our first objective is to spread our word and we need you to build an amazing launch marketing campaign. We believe in you !
 
PARTAGER NOTRE PROJET - SHARE OUR PROJECT

story:
Hello. I’m Van Parkman, the editor-in-chief of this fledgling bi-monthly magazine. I am a Mississippian with a B.A. in History from William Carey University and an M.Phil. in Classics (specialising in Classical and Enlightenment philosophy and ancient Athenian politics) from Trinity College Dublin. The majority of our writers are Mississippians: we are teachers, professors, nurses, students, doctors, philosophers, and concerned citizens. We differ in political and cultural opinion, yet are unified in our solid and sober-minded presentation of news and cultural analysis. We also have a growing number contributors from other regions in the U.S., as well as Europe.

        One of our most distinguishing characteristics is the format of our magazine which actually gives readers a reason to pick up a physical copy or flip through our digital edition and read it from cover to cover. The internet era trend of reading articles divorced from their traditionally edited format within a magazine or newspaper is pragmatic and seemingly time efficient even if it reeks of radical individualism. The vision we have for our magazine is to give our readers a reason to read from cover to cover. What we offer is an experience…a journey that puts the past two months of world events in fresh perspective. To achieve this we offer more than traditional sections and columns. From the front cover through to the rolling of the credits we use a director’s vision to present our various magazine stages, filled with insight, irony, judgement, and joshing, to illuminate a defining and meaningful period of both your life and the world, the past two months. By the time you lay our magazine down we hope you are ready to walk away with a renewed zeal for a life of possibilities and a renewed sober, yet hopeful, conviction that our actions as humans matter.

        The idea for this magazine initially sprung from The Salisbury Review, a conservative British magazine founded during the Cold War. Its namesake, the 3rd Marquis of Salisbury, Robert Gascoyne-Cecil, served three terms as prime minister of the United Kingdom in the late 19th century and was renowned for his relaxed government. Likewise, The Coolidge Review is named after the most notable yet humble U.S. president of the 1920s, Calvin Coolidge. Under his gentle hand, America prospered greatly and grew in creativity, although not altogether without negative consequence. Much of our current cultural consciousness, lifestyle, technology, societal merits and faults, and even precursors to our modern American spirit are derived from 1920s era manifestations. Questions commonly thought but seldom asked concerning this era include, "What did people have in the '20s that we don't today?" "What is the relationship of traditional elegance and high culture to all that is modern and risqué?" "How do we achieve a balance between tradition and that which is distinctly new or modern?" These questions are to be explored and answered not through prescriptive abstract language crafted to ideologically enslave the most minds for the cheapest price, but through creative and stubborn practical application and argument. The best way out of any puzzle is usually the most creative; however, first one must recognise limitations and the tools at one's disposal. The approach of The Coolidge Review employs all these elements, especially the stubbornness.  

        The basic intent of this magazine is fundamentally twofold. First, the intent is to demonstrate the dependent and complementary status of all that is modern, classy, and genuinely progressive to traditional aesthetic styles, values, and moral and societal principles. Secondly, it is to expand the applicability of those traditional guidelines to as many areas as possible to demonstrate what true activism and creativity is capable of when judgement is allowed to guide the proverbial potter's hand. This way what is traditional will always be challenging and constructive rather than stale and irrelevant.

       Perhaps counterintuitively, studies show that creativity occurs most prominently and effectively under certain helpful restrictions and guidelines. Our writers believe this applies to politics and activism as well. Creativity should not be banned from the public square in favour of quick fixes or lazy thinking; likewise creativity, humour, and irony shouldn't be banned from cultural and political criticism. We hope to demonstrate what purpose-driven creativity looks like when applied to the biggest issues of our day – whether those issues have escaped unnoticed under sensationalist radars, or are well known and mainstream.

       This vision of a sober-minded yet intensely imaginative magazine will feature much more than mere analytical articles and cultural commentary. From start to finish, it will be a refreshing respite from the superficial and superfluous in the format, style, content, and presentation of more than 10 diverse and insightful sections. The layout of the magazine will cut through the fog of commercial distraction, and bestow a clarity on the world that can only be seen when you choose to keep cool with The Coolidge Review. Even the style of the magazine, which will be reminiscent of the Art Deco style of the '20s and '30s, fits into the magazine's philosophical consistency. Art Deco featured an undeniably modern, classy, and edgy style. Essentially, however, it was little more than a gloss-over, or an update and revival of, classical designs, styles, and architecture. Originally Art Deco was employed to help the modern man and woman, both in Europe and the United States, find a fresh identity and a way of psychological escape after the preternatural trauma of the Great War. Nonetheless, it was unmistakably dependent upon the timeless aesthetic and existential needs of human beings, and cleanly expressed these needs. This function parallels the literary and philosophical aims of the magazine nicely.

       Please help us achieve the vision of bringing this magazine to life and spreading our voices throughout the world. Planet Earth deserves to hear more than frantic white noise. This is therefore an environmental concern of the gravest magnitude.

       Most magazines fail before they even publish their second issue. Our writer base is derived of a community of visionary friends who will cling to a common conviction and vision. However, even with that advantage we have many practical concerns, and require initial monetary assistance.

       Our strategy is to begin primarily as a digital magazine, using a prolific online digital magazine distributer (which we have already chosen) to minimise initial fees. However, we can't be the cat's meow without physical copies, and we can't capture the hearts and minds of real people without the aesthetics and acoustics of paper. Therefore, we will initially print a small supply of bulk copies to be distributed by hand, on demand, and through subscription. However, low-end printing is not conducive to low subscription prices; nor is printing in general, without purchasing our own printing equipment. To be competitive we need equipment, and we currently have the physical space necessary to do our own printing. We also need initial funds to cover that crucial initial marketing period. Our graphic artists, designers, writers, and editors also would like to get paid, and to know that they are making a good investment of time and energy. We also need to see that others share our vision and are prepared to vicariously achieve that vision through us for what the citizens of Sandford in the cult movie Hot Fuzz would call, "the greater good." We are inspired by your enthusiasm. Even if we don't meet our financial goal, the magazine will continue as long as possible (probably forever) so any amount of funding will help.

       By contributing through the perk system you can subscribe early to our magazine. If you contribute ten dollars you will get a year’s digital subscription. Twenty dollars will purchase the digital subscription, plus the first print copy (expected mid-February 2017). With thirty dollars you can buy both subscriptions, print and digital, for a full year. In addition, all contributions will help us achieve more competitive pricing, as well as a higher-quality product aesthetically and substantively. Needless to say, you will also be helping to expose untold numbers of readers to a fresh and challenging way of thinking. Whether or not you contribute financially, please spread the word! Indiegogo makes it easy to share our story with their share tools. This magazine is going to be the bee's knees!

       Our writers are committed to this project. Your money will not be wasted; trust us to make your investment worthwhile. I for one have always wanted to be a writer. I have always been a writer; in fact it's the only thing that I can commit to doing full-heartedly. This is our passion.  

       We will employ judgement, humour, compassion, irony, classiness, and imagination to slash through hype, ideological distraction, and commercial trappings. With your help, we will vibrantly illustrate why the things that really matter do not always get the media or attention they deserve.

 

Be cool. Read The Coolidge Review.

Thanks so much,
Van and friends

story:
Too often, girls are unable to continue their secondary education (grades 7-12) due to the circumstances they face when living in extreme poverty.

In the communities we serve in central Uganda, adolescent girls are extremely vulnerable to early school dropout, rape, forced child marriage, and early pregnancy. In the Luwero district where Just Like My Child Foundation (JLMC) works:

  • Nearly 50% of girls drop out of school by age 15
  • And 31% of girls aged 15-19 have been pregnant or have had a child.

We’re committed to helping adolescent girls tackle the obstacles they face in the developing world. Through our Girl Power Project, we’re working closely with bright girls who are performing at the top of their class but their families are like most that we serve in Uganda's Luwero District: They are rural farmers who live off the land with small monthly incomes (less than $100 per month).

We have a shortlist of 10 brilliant girls whose families lack the funds to continue their secondary education and will be forced to drop out next year, after graduating from the sixth grade. 

___________________________________________________________________________

Meet Perathy

Perathy is one of the brightest and highest performing students in her community. Last year, she graduated from primary school with the highest scores of all the students in the 48 villages of her sub-county. Her high marks gained her acceptance into the best boarding school in the district where she could continue to excel in her studies in grades 7-12. 

But Perathy's family lives off $2.75 per month -- an income that could hardly support her new school fees.

Support from change-makers like you helped us keep Perathy in school -- along with three other brilliant girls -- through our Mandela Project, a program that removes the financial barrier to higher education and lets girls learn.

This year, Perathy started the 7th grade and continued to perform at the top of her class. Her favourite subject is Science and she wants to become a nurse.

We have a shortlist of 10 more brilliant girls, just like Perathy, whose families lack the funds to continue their secondary education and they'll be forced to drop out next year, after graduating from the sixth grade.

We're fundraising to keep them in school. Join us.

___________________________________________________________________________

Our Goal = $25,000

Keep 10 Girls in School Next Year.

 

It costs $2500 per year to send a girl to one of the best secondary schools in Uganda. This covers:

  • Her School Application Fees
  • Her Tuition & Fees, as well as Room, Board, and Basic Supplies
  • Transportation to/from School and Her Home Village
  • Medical & Preventative Health Care for your Student and Her Family 
  • School Uniform & Scholastic Materials (Pencils, Textbooks, Paper, etc)

___________________________________________________________________________

Perks When You Contribute:

$10,000

Have a Direct Relationship with the Girl you Sponsor

When you cover the school fees for all 4 years of a girl's secondary education, you'll be personally introduced and connected with the girl who's future you've invested in. We'll send you a photo and handwritten letter from your student, as well as annual updates about her progress in school. You'll also have the opportunity to correspond with your student throughout the year, by exchanging letters and photos. Connect your family to another through this empowering cultural exchange!

You'll also receive:

  • Handmade Paper Journal from Uganda
  • Basket of Crafts Handmade in Uganda
  • PLUS an invitation in 2017 to Skype with all of the Mandela Project Students who are sponsored with your support.

​

Pictured above: At our 10th Anniversary Gala this year, girls in Uganda chatted via Skype with Global Humanitarian Award recipient Jada Pinkett Smith and Mistress of Ceremonies, Regina Hall to share what they've learned through the Girl Power Project.

___________________________________________________________________________

$5,000

Sponsor a Girl + Meet Her in Uganda in 2017

Join us for the trip of a lifetime! Your contribution at this level will cover one year of a girl's secondary school fees AND you'll be invited to take a trip to Uganda to personally meet the girl who's future you've invested in. Trip Dates (including travel time) are November 16-23, 2017.

You'll also receive:

  • Photo + Handwritten Letter from Your Student
  • Update in December 2017 of her progress in school
  • Handmade Paper Journal from Uganda
  • Basket of Crafts Handmade in Uganda
  • PLUS an invitation in 2017 to Skype with the Mandela Project Student(s) who are sponsored with your support.

Airfare not included. For more information about this contribution level and the 2017 Trip to Uganda, please contact Cristina@justlikemychild.org.

__________________________________________________________________________

$2,500

Sponsor a Girl + Ignite Her Potential

Spark lightning in one girl and ignite the fire of her potential! Cover one year of a girl's secondary school fees and you'll be introduced to the girl who's future you've invested in. You'll receive a photo and handwritten letter from your student, in addition an update in December 2017 about her progress in school. You'll also receive:

  • Handmade Paper Journal from Uganda
  • Basket of Crafts Handmade in Uganda
  • PLUS an invitation in 2017 to Skype with the Mandela Project Student(s) who are sponsored with your support.

___________________________________________________________________________

$1,000

Handmade Basket of Gifts from Uganda

Contribute to the sponsorship fund and you'll receive a Photo and Profile of the Girl who is directly benefitting from your support. Include this with the Basket of Handmade Gifts from Uganda that you'll also receive, and you've got the perfect gift for a loved one this holiday -- one that is making a difference! You'll also receive:

  • Handmade Paper Journal from Uganda
  • PLUS an invitation in 2017 to Skype with the Mandela Project Students who are sponsored with your support!

___________________________________________________________________________

$500

Receive a Photo of the Girl You Sponsor

Pass on the Power of Education and help a girl on our waiting list afford the opportunity to stay in school next year. When you contribute to our sponsorship fund, you'll receive:

  • Photo + Profile of the Girl who is directly benefitting from your support
  • Handmade Paper Journal from Uganda
  • PLUS an Invitation in 2017 to Skype with all of the Girls who are sponsored with your support!

___________________________________________________________________________

$250     Handmade Paper Journal from Uganda

Help a girl on our waiting list afford the opportunity to stay in school next year and we'll send you a Handmade Paper Journal from Uganda PLUS you'll also receive a Handwritten Note from a Girl in Uganda.

___________________________________________________________________________

$100     Handwritten Note from a Girl in Uganda

No amount is too small when it comes to providing the greatest gift that no one can take from a girl: Education. Contribute at this level and you'll receive a handwritten note from one of the girls we serve in Uganda, East Africa.

___________________________________________________________________________

$50     Holiday E-Card

Every dollar counts for a girl who's family lives on less than $2 of them per day. Contribute to our Sponsorship Fund and receive a heartwarming E-Card of the girls we serve. Share it with a loved one this Holiday Season!

___________________________________________________________________________

About the Mandela Project:

Just Like My Child Foundation's Mandela Project is a sponsorship fund that removes the financial barrier to higher education, ensuring high-performing yet vulnerable students receive a high quality education as well as mentoring and career planning. Individual students are matched with a donor, or "sponsor", fostering a connection that in several cases has lasted years and enabled students (and their families) to overcome numerous obstacles.

___________________________________________________________________________

About Just Like My Child Foundation:

Our mission is to empower vulnerable adolescent girls by enabling them to create healthy, self-sustaining families who prosper without further aid. 

For the past 10 years, Just Like My Child Foundation (JLMC) has developed deep partnerships with rural communities in Africa to deliver programs which address health care, education, microenterprise, social justice, and girls’ empowerment — a holistic approach to ending the cycle of poverty.

Our Girl Power Project® was created to empower adolescent girls and designed to reduce barriers that prevent them from completing secondary school. It addresses the complex needs of vulnerable adolescent girls’ aged 10-15, equipping them with a network of support in their community to live healthy lives by avoiding forced child marriage, HIV transmission, early pregnancy, rape and disease. 

We have a shortlist of 10 brilliant girls whose families lack the funds to continue their secondary education and will be forced to drop out next year, after the sixth grade. That's what this campaign is all about. We're committed to keeping them in school.

___________________________________________________________________________

Other Ways You Can Help:

  • Help Us Spread the Word! Sharing this campaign with others is just as valuable as making a contribution, because it means more people have the opportunity to help us make a difference. 
  • Double Your Impact by making a contribution and using the buttons above to share this campaign with your friends and family!

Pass on the Power of Education and help a girl on our waiting list afford the opportunity to stay in school next year. When you contribute to our sponsorship fund, you'll receive:

Photo + Profile of the Girl who is directly benefitting from your support
Handmade Paper Journal from Uganda

PLUS an Invitation in 2017 to Skype with all of the Girls who are sponsored with your support!

___________________________________________________________________________

$250     Handmade Paper Journal from Uganda
Help a girl on our waiting list afford the opportunity to stay in school next year and we'll send you a Handmade Paper Journal from Uganda PLUS you'll also receive a Handwritten Note from a Girl in Uganda.
___________________________________________________________________________
$100     Handwritten Note from a Girl in Uganda
No amount is too small when it comes to providing the greatest gift that no one can take from a girl: Education. Contribute at this level and you'll receive a handwritten note from one of the girls we serve in Uganda, East Africa.
___________________________________________________________________________
$50     Holiday E-Card
Every dollar counts for a girl who's family lives on less than $2 of them per day. Contribute to our Sponsorship Fund and receive a heartwarming E-Card of the girls we serve. Share it with a loved one this Holiday Season!
___________________________________________________________________________
About the Mandela Project:
Just Like My Child Foundation's Mandela Project is a sponsorship fund that removes the financial barrier to higher education, ensuring high-performing yet vulnerable students receive a high quality education as well as mentoring and career planning. Individual students are matched with a donor, or "sponsor", fostering a connection that in several cases has lasted years and enabled students (and their families) to overcome numerous obstacles.
___________________________________________________________________________
About Just Like My Child Foundation:
Our mission is to empower vulnerable adolescent girls by enabling them to create healthy, self-sustaining families who prosper without further aid. 
For the past 10 years, Just Like My Child Foundation (JLMC) has developed deep partnerships with rural communities in Africa to deliver programs which address health care, education, microenterprise, social justice, and girls’ empowerment — a holistic approach to ending the cycle of poverty.
Our Girl Power Project® was created to empower adolescent girls and designed to reduce barriers that prevent them from completing secondary school. It addresses the complex needs of vulnerable adolescent girls’ aged 10-15, equipping them with a network of support in their community to live healthy lives by avoiding forced child marriage, HIV transmission, early pregnancy, rape and disease. 
We have a shortlist of 10 brilliant girls whose families lack the funds to continue their secondary education and will be forced to drop out next year, after the sixth grade. That's what this campaign is all about. We're committed to keeping them in school.
___________________________________________________________________________

Other Ways You Can Help:


Help Us Spread the Word! Sharing this campaign with others is just as valuable as making a contribution, because it means more people have the opportunity to help us make a difference. 

Double Your Impact by making a contribution and using the buttons above to share this campaign with your friends and family!

story:
Life is beautiful & waiting just for you. Join us at our Alternative Studies and Retreat Center!

 

“The bright future of Mankind is determined when the Youth can stand on the shoulders of Giants to see the way clear.” ... Norman Brown

 

The Vision

I am so pleased to extend to you for your consideration an invitation to unite with Imagine Thailand Alternative Studies and Retreat Center.

Imagine Thailand is the evolution of Monte Vista a beautiful retreat center that was located on Koh Phangan, Thailand. Monte Vista was a 12 year success proving my vision to serve humanity by helping over 6,000 people make positive life changes. I am now manifesting that vision with conviction of creating alternative studies and retreat centers worldwide to broaden the impact of love and healing. Imagine Thailand is the first of many to come on my journey to help heal the world.

After Monte Vista I realized I could positively affect so many more by creating the Imagine Thailand Alternative Studies center where teachers of progressive disciplines from all over the world could come together and teach their much needed skills and healing knowledge. Their students would then go and teach and heal others thus creating a ripple effect of beautiful energy and creation that continues to grow and influence others the further it emanates from the source.

 

 

Be a part of something magical from the very beginning.

 

"One should see any opportunity to serve as a rare and precious gift...and never waste such an opportunity.” ... Amma

 

Your contribution will help Imagine Thailand bring balance and peace to the world. My heartfelt intention is to begin breaking ground on the island of Koh Samui Thailand in January 2017. As a founding contributor you will bring Imagine Thailand and all the future Centers to become a reality.

My fullest intention is to have founding contributors like you help us raise $250,000. The effect of positivity, healing and light Imagine Thailand will have on individuals, communities and the world is profound and intangible as the rippling swell of its effect flows throughout the world.

The tangible benefits include the perks associated with the level of your contribution but more importantly the healing of many, the bringing of joy back into lives, and the remembering of our magic.

 

 

Feel the healing by reading just a few testimonials of those who have been on this path with me.

 

“This is the beginning of my journey and I will be back soon to join it again. My eyes, heart and soul have been awakened and I finally feel that I am ready to find peace and happiness. Thank you Norman!”

“Thank you all for your kindness and your guidance. I never expected to let go of so much in such a short time but I am leaving here inspired to continue my healing process. Namaste.”

 

 

“To all the angels at Monte Vista- Thank you for loving me and taking such good care of me and for always being there for me. You’ve helped me change my life! Wishing you all the love in the world!”

“Thank you so much for creating such a perfect welcoming and healing place in such a beautiful location. The perfect inspiration for our entire trip! You’ve changed my life for the better and I will never forget the experience!”

 

 

"Your work is to discover your world, and then with all your heart give yourself to it."... Buddha

 

Thailand

A place of beauty and innocence. Not only a place that has a garden, but a place that IS a beautiful garden. Koh Samui is one of the three most popular beach destinations in Thailand and is an island in the Thai Peninsula that stretches from the west side of the Gulf from Thailand to Maylasia. The island is diverse, from the hustle and bustle of the white sandy beach at Chaweng to the laid back privacy of Lip Noi. With sandy beaches and rocky shorelines, Koh Samiu offers a lush tropical climate of an island in the Thai Peninsula. It is also part of the AngThong Marine Park known for some of the best diving in the world.

 

 

“I am not a teacher, but an awakener.”  ... Robert Frost​

 

Your Contributions 

The generous funds raised will be used to build the alternative studies and retreat center including classrooms, bungalows, common areas, treatment rooms, yoga deck, pool and kitchen. 

I will bring in practitioners, healers and teachers of all disciplines from all over the world to practice within these divine and serene spaces. The opportunity to share divine gifts with others is also, a gift.

 

 

"Your work is to discover your world, and then with all your heart give yourself to it."... Buddha

 

In Gratitude

I have had a vision of creating a momentous opportunity for anyone wanting to learn to help others which now presents itself.

For years and from thousands of people just like you and me, I have been asked: How can I be of service to myself, others and the world?

Imagine Thailand is the answer.

Thank you for your contribution and helping change the world.

 

 

"If your actions inspire others to dream more, learn more, do more, and become more, you are a leader."  ... John Quincy Adams

I am Norman Brown

I am an international speaker, spiritual teacher, business owner and life coach with decades of experience in coaching and guiding people through transformational phases in their lives. I am the founder of Monte Vista Retreat Center, in Koh Phangan, Thailand,  and created the Life Transformation Course (LTC), a holistic program dedicated to awakening, healing and living a fulfilled and happy life.

Born in Iowa, I was raised by my Cherokee grandmother who passed on ancient wisdom about mankind and nature to me. Elfie was always in service to others and she taught by example and her generosity and compassion naturally got the people around her to understand how they could live life in a way that was of a loving nature to themselves and everyone around them.

At the age of 27, I was introduced to meditation, which accelerated my spiritual progress and pointed me towards my teachers, such as Maharishi Mahesh Yogi, Amritanandamayi Devi, Ramesh Balsekar, Sri Karunamayi.

In 1994, while in the ashram of Amritanadamayi I had a profound spiritual revelation that lead to a total transformation of my own life. The following years were devoted to solidifying and integrating this new way of life. After spending time with spiritual teachers I was drawn to fulfill a vision of building a retreat center in Thailand, Monte Vista Retreat Center. Here I spent 12 years dedicated to helping others to transform their lives.

Imagine Thailand and the future Centers around the world have been a dream whose time has now come.

 

"If we have been able to give happiness to a soul-even for a minute-it makes our life blessed."  ... Amma 

 

With special thanks

This campaign and the creation of Imagine Thailand would not be possible without my Tribe including Donna L. Busse who is all things to me as well as all things to the development and operations of Imagine Thailand and all future endeavors. Thanks to Josh Jensen, Kenji Kumara, Theresa Weston-Morris, Socrates Smith, Nora Szabo, Francine Bogran, Chelsea Cohen and all who generously give their time, support and belief in helping create Imagine Thailand. Special thanks to SmartGal Consulting Services, Studio 5 USA, Digital Edge Video Production.

We invite you to become part of the tribe. Join us and change the world today.

 

 

FAQ’s

 

  • When will scheduling my visit/vacation be available?
    1. Scheduling will be available approx. May 1st, 2017 via our website booking page at Imagine Thailand (http://imagine-thailand.com/).
  • When will Alternative Studies courses and schedules be available?
    1. Courses and schedules will be available in April 2017, enrollment will begin approx. May 1st, 2017 via our website Studies page at Imagine Thailand. (http://imagine-thailand.com/)
  • Are certificates provided at completion of courses?
    1. Certification will be provided on a teacher by teacher, course basis.
  • What is required to become a teacher?
    1. Please inquire at info@imagine-thailand.com for more details.
  • Are pets allowed/Service animals?
    1. While we love your pets, we ask that you not bring “Buttercup” to the Retreat Center to help all guests enjoy a peaceful and relaxing stay.
  • What should I expect traveling to Thailand?
    1. Beautiful tropics and life changing experiences! It is also recommended that you research Thailand Custom Laws and the weather for the time of your visit, to be prepared on what to pack.
  • Is there an age requirement?
    1. 18+ is required, although we’re excited to offer throughout the year special family packages as well as open enrollment for courses designed for children under the age of 18.
  • What accommodations are available for students?
    1. Comfortable options are available for you to choose from. You can enroll in a course program including a dorm room & meals or you may upgrade to a bungalow. You also may choose accommodations off property.

story:
We need your help to produce a small run of voiceboxes for our educational pilot program addressing the needs of refugee pre-school children in Lebanon, Jordan and the Netherlands. Your contribution will help us take these next critical steps:
  1. Determine best production methods,
  2. Source materials,
  3. Produce, assemble and ship within six months the necessary voiceboxes to run our pilot program.
I began this project alone in 2012, when my horror and outrage at the devastation and chaos unfolding in Syria turned to determination to find some way to help kids who’d become refugees overnight. I spent the next 10 months creating a functional prototype of The Voicebox. I’m a single mother, and at the time, I was a nanny for a family with baby triplets and an older sister. Some days I’d watch over six kids under the age of 7 including my youngest daughter. I would stop by the fabric or hardware store on my way home from work to get supplies to build the prototype. I remember taking an ordinary household saw, using it to cut a metal dry erase board in half, and thinking how on earth am I going to do this? I didn’t have all the answers, but truthfully, no one ever does. I pushed all doubts aside and focused on each next step. 
I invented The Voicebox to deliver hope.  

"I learned about The Voicebox when its use was demonstrated to me by Katrina van Pelt, when I visited her sometime ago. Immediately I was interested, because also in the Netherlands we have a large number of refugees and among them many children. The importance of The Voicebox is that it gives children the chance to mix fantasy and reality, offering them a chance to process the nightmares of war as they play and learn. Please support this campaign so we can bring The Voicebox to refugee children in the Netherlands.” Immy Nieboer, Public Health Consultant
Millions of refugee children around the world have been displaced and are in limbo as they wait. The internet is awash with this tragedy, unfolding in real-time.The images are heartbreaking, I know you’ve seen them too. Young children, bewildered, searching for context in the pebbles near the water jugs that are now the family’s new water source.  Some stay huddled close to a parent, perhaps wondering whether the camera they see is really some sort of weapon. Displacement itself is devastating, when it’s the result of violence that claims family members and possessions, we’re talking about trauma. These children need to keep learning, they need help dealing with the effects of what they’ve witnessed.  

“As CEO of Vision Hope International I have been working in the Middle East since 2002. Trauma therapy for children is much needed in the countries we work in: Yemen, Jordan, Syria and Lebanon. I have seen children in our Trauma kindergartens in Jordan, using The Voicebox. We are grateful that The Voicebox will be available soon in our day to day, play-based therapy with 200 children. Your support is more than welcome.” Matthias Leibbrand, CEO Vision Hope International e.V.
    

The Voicebox equips preschoolers with materials and experiences that:
  • encourage collaborative play
  • challenge young minds to think creatively
  • present 3D and 2D ways to acquire language
  • engage fine motor skill development
  • foster spatial awareness
  • aid in developing agency and a sense of self
I firmly believe that we can make a difference.  If there is one thing that has stood out as astounding in this project, it is the overwhelming show of support from all those who have stepped forward to help. Friends and family, professors and teachers, mentors and strangers, all have proven that there is an immense undercurrent of compassion and love for humanity. We can forget this when we are watching the news of babies being washed up on shore, whole villages being blown up. But, there is incredible power in that undercurrent, and if we go with it, we are infinite in our capacity to help. 
We can deliver hope where it is needed most.  

“We would like to use The Voicebox at our schools as it is a great fun learning toy that will help us teach vocabulary to the students. When they are able to see and touch they will learn faster. In addition, we are trying to add more creativity in our program and The Voicebox will surely do that!.“ Suha Tutunji, Jusoor Program Director  

I can not tell you how amazing it feels to be this close to The Voicebox being in the hands of the children it was designed to help.This project has been a way for me to channel my outrage and frustration into a positive solution. Please contribute in any way you can. It’s amazing what we can accomplish together. 

p.s. We are Patent-Pending and ready to go.....Let's do this!  

Meet Our Team 

Katrina van Pelt 
I have been an educator of preschool-aged children for over twenty years. Professionally I have been a teacher, licensed daycare provider and nanny, and on a more personal level, I'm a proud mother of three amazing kids. Most of my experience has been within a progressive "free school" teaching model and over the course of my career I have helped guide more than 100 children within a context of social learning. It is my belief that early childhood experiences help to set the foundations for the type of learner a student will become. I have always been interested in how and why we become driven to learn new skills and understand new ideas, so I find this work highly rewarding.   

Jose Perez
After 10 years working with a great variety of industries as an industrial engineer consultant I shifted my focus toward the IT field. In 2000, I returned to college and earned a second degree, a Master's in Open Information Systems, then worked as a Project Manager in IT projects for seven years. In 2011, I established my own company developing custom database applications. Recently, I moved with my family to Amherst, MA, where I met Katrina and became engaged in the design for manufacturing of her humanitarian project: The Voicebox.  An unexpected return to my original career and passion as an industrial engineer.  
 

Amanda Judd
I’m a lifelong learner, artist and an educator. Willing to bushwhack, I created my own Digital Arts major as an undergrad because, believe it or not, there was no such thing at the University then. I went on to get my Master’s in Learning, Media and Technology, where I boldly ventured off into MBA-land to study because I was curious about marketing, social media and how to get real results. Since then I’ve consulted with small business owners about marketing, built some websites, and last year, co-wrote and published a book about collaboration and art making.     

Our Partners
Matthias Leibbrand, CEO Vision Hope International e.V
Vision-Hope.org  

 
Immy Nieboer, Public Health Consultant
Robert Kochlaan 590
2035 BT Haarlem
The Netherlands
       
 
Suha Tutunji, Program Director Jusoor Syria
JusoorSyria.com 
facebook.com/Jusoor.Syria

story:
It's been 10 years!

21inc was founded in 2006 after 21 young leaders took a bus around New Brunswick for a week, meeting with leaders from across sectors: government, private, not-for-profit and the arts. What they realized is that all great organizations have one thing in common - great leadership. They knew they wanted others to have this transformational experience too, so they incorporated 21inc. 10 years later, 21inc is 300 people strong across Atlantic Canada with members from diverse perspectives and sectors.

April 29th, 2016 marks the exact 10-year anniversary since 21inc was incorporated! Accelerating leadership throughout Atlantic Canada is as important today as it was 10 years ago.  We've all heard a lot about the challenges of our region and 21inc wants to continue lead positive change and the creation of the future that we all know is possible.  


What we're asking for

2016 is the year of focusing on connecting with our network of the 300 uniquely awesome people in our network, as well as our community supporters and the pipeline of leaders in the region.  We have exciting plans for Canada's 150th in 2017 - we'll be asking our network and supporters to get involved in the coming months.  To achieve these goals, we need the financial support of our network and community supporters to get there.

This campaign will help 21inc build a solid base from which to grow.  We are seeking $45,000 to support core operations.  Modest donations from many will help us to achieve this goal - as an example:

  • $200 contributions from 225 people, representing 75% of our network, or a portion of our network + community supporters, will achieve our target.

Contributions up to $40,000 will be matched by '21inc angels' who have committed funds to help build a robust 21inc - so in effect, every dollar you contribute is worth $2 to 21inc!

All funds that are raised will go towards ensuring a solid base for engagement in 2016 - both with our network and community.

We encourage you to donate and share that you’ve made a contribution via social networks using the hashtags #LeadTheFuture and #10Yearsof21inc.

This campaign will be open until April 30th, 2016.


The Impact

These funds will help build our legacy of a fully engaged network, and building a pipeline of interconnected, empathetic and creative leaders from across sectors in Atlantic Canada.  Specifically, the impact will be:

  • Helping 21inc build a solid foundation as we celebrate our 10-year anniversary

  • Allowing us to focus on engaging our network of 300 members, and further engaging our community across Atlantic Canada

  • Building a solid foundation for excellence for our Canada 150th program in 2017


Risks & Challenges

We've tried to mitigate our risk before asking our community and network for financial support.  Funds up to $40,000 will be matched by 21inc 'angels' if we achieve our goal.  All funds raised will be used to build a solid base for 21inc.  The 21inc team believes in what we can do together - please reach out to our executive director, Vanessa Paesani (vanessa@21inc.ca) if you have any questions or comments.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, it would be a fantastic if you'd consider:

  • Sharing this campaign with your networks

  • Using our hashtag #LeadTheFuture #10Years21inc

  • Make a short video on what 21inc has meant for you, or why you believe it and share it using our hashtags

  • Share memories of your experience with 21inc using the hashtags above!  If you tag @21inc on Twitter, we’ll retweet and share.

Thanks for reading this, for contributing, for supporting 21inc and building a resilient, strong and interconnected Atlantic Canada!

story:
What kind of Educational Resources?

The lack of educational materials for children aged 4-10 that teach about Black Canadian and diasporic history is glaring, so we need to make it!  In 2016 we worked with Amber Williams-King and others to produce an animation about the Haitian Revolution.  We worked with Melisse Watson to create a Freedom Fighters Memory Matching Game.  We worked with Alex McLeod to create a 360 video about the #BlackLivesMatter Movement.  #BLMTOFreedomSchool will be working with Black Artists and allies to develop new resources from Virtual Reality to Claymations to colouring books and beyond, covering topics like Oromo Resistance to the Soweto Uprisings.  We intend to pay Black artists for their labour, while creating engaging and relevant new resources for students at Freedom School.

$25 will pay for the production of 1 Freedom School Workbook

$50 will pay for the materials to make a BlackLivesMatter board game

$150 will pay for the Black liberation advent calendar production

$300 will pay for an art piece about a historical event for a Black liberation timeline

$1000 will pay for translating our video resources to ASL

$2000 will pay material costs for a short video about the Soweto Uprisings

 

PROGRAMMING

$10 will pay for lunch and snacks for one young freedom fighter for one day

$50 will pay for 2 books for our Black liberation library 

$250 will pay for bussing for one young Freedom fighter for the duration of freedom school

$1000 will pay for space rental for FreedomSchool for 1 week 

 

***ALL FREEDOM SCHOOL COSTS ARE FULLY SUBSIDIZED FOR PARTICIPANTS 

More about #BlackLivesMatter Freedom School

#BlackLivesMatter Freedom School is in year 2 of our annual 3 week long summer program proposed for the summer of 2017 for children aged 4-10.  The purpose of the project is to respond to a lack of humanizing, self-affirming, queer positive educational opportunities for Black children in the GTA.  Freedom school will provide an alternative setting for parents who do not feel that our children are being taught self-love, and a passion for justice and liberation through their formal education.  The program is designed to teach children about Black Canadian and diasporic history, to engage children in political resistance to anti-Black racism and state violence through a trans-feminist lens, and to offer children an entry point into the #BlackLivesMatter movement.  #BlackLivesMatter Freedom School is designed to support children and families living and growing in a reality of witnessing police violence in our communities.  It is designed to support parent and youth voice through the development of a parent and youth advisory boards, that will help to guide the project.  

Through offering access to free childcare for young children, hot meals and bussing, #BlackLivesMatter freedom school will be geared towards families from working class neighbourhoods/contexts.  This is an acknowledgement that anti-Black racism and police violence and intrinsically connected to classism and poverty.  

Through collaborating with visual artists and musicians, freedom school with explore art and technology as tools of resistance.  It will provide access for children who may not otherwise have access to materials and skills such as printmaking, and child friendly design apps.  Children will be exposed to artists such as Elizabeth Catlett and Emory Douglas who were a part of the Black Arts Movement- the artistic branch of the Black Power Movement in the 1960s.  The project will culminate in political action to be determined and designed by the participants.  It will also conclude with a street gallery, which with amplify childrens’ voices as they forge their entry into the #BlackLivesMatter Movement.

story:
My name's Tamas Voros, I'm a physics and mathematics teacher working at the same high school for lots of years, in Budapest,Hungary. This is the school, where I work at: http://www.semmelweis-bp.sulinet.hu. Some words from me you can find here: http://trip2science.com.

 

In 2013 I got a chance to show the interesting features of the liquid nitrogen to my students. The liquid nitrogen - named LN2 - is a very cool fluid, its temperature's -196 Celsius. Because, it's so cool, we can store in a special tank, named Dewar flask (high tech thermos flask, in what the hot tea will be hot for weeks :) There is a flask, what I need:

From the company, that produces the LN2, until 2014 anybody could rent such flask for the carriage, but last year, and the one before,not anymore. In 2015 I got a Dewar flask for lend from the ELTE Unversity - I upload parts of the experiments to Youtube in hungarian, and in english with the help of my little FullMoon. ( youtube.com/trip2science) -, but last year I couldn't  stage the LN2 party for my students.

 

The LN2 isn't an expensive material, but the Dewar flask is very costly. I didn't get financial help until today,the day I started this crowdfounding. I hope, in this year I can stage the LN2 party for my students with thelp of the founders.

 

I asked a proposition from a websíte of a company, from that I can buy a good quality product. There's the result:

That's, what I need help for.

story:
One Planet International School in Addis Ababa, Ethiopia was started with only 15 kids as a social enterprise in 2006.  The idea was to build a school which would balance academic excellence with character education.   The mission of the school is “to unravel the unique potential hidden in every child and to foster in him/her a desire to serve humanity.”   The school also has a longer-term vision to impact the quality of education on a broader scale:  to provide a model of education for the country, to improve the quality of learning, and to ultimately raise a society dedicated to serving humanity.   

 

Over Ten Years of Experience and Social Impact

The school has now been self-sustaining for more than 10 years with nearly 500 students from age 3 through high school.  After adding one grade per year, the school will celebrate its first graduating class in June 2018.   

The school has created a model to extend its quality education to children who could not otherwise afford it.  15 girls from an orphan / street children's program have been offered full scholarships.  In addition, full or partial scholarships are provided to many other children in need.    In total, One Planet currently provides $86,000 worth of scholarships per year to 55 students.   Twenty-nine students receive 100% scholarships.   Seventeen students receive 50% scholarships or more, and nine students receive scholarships ranging from 15 to 35%. Currently 40% of students receiving scholarships are girls, but we plan to increase the percentage to at least 65%.

In addition, the school is committed to building the capacity of local teachers through its teacher training program. Its curriculum and quality control unit helps to monitor quality teaching, while at the same time providing mentorship to develop the capacity of the teachers. Providing quality education in Addis Ababa helps the country to attract international organizations, foreign investors, and returning diaspora. At the same time, the school assists in meeting the demands of the growing middle class, and encourages Ethiopia’s most-educated to stay and help the country to grow.

Building a Permanent Facility for One Planet

Currently the school is on rented property and it is spending over $150,000 a year on rent.    The school is under constant threat of losing its lease as high rises are going up all over the city and on every side of the school.    In November 2017, the school lost half of its high school and middle school playground due to a road expansion in front of the school.

Over the past few years the school has been trying to find a way to build a permanent facility for One Planet.   Earlier this year, Zelalem and Gail sold nearly everything they own in order to buy land for the school.   The school now owns 2,500 square meters of land in the heart of the CMC Summit area of Addis Ababa, where most of One Planet’s students live.  

The Design

One of the parents of the school and renowned architect, worked with the students, parents, teachers and staff of One Planet through a participatory process to design the school. 

The architect has prepared two designs.  The first design, estimated to cost 3,8 million US dollars translates the vision of One Planet and the input from students, parents, teachers and staff into an ideal purpose-built facility.  The second design, estimated to cost 1.8 million US dollars, is a scaled down version of the first design.    The design we implement will depend on the amount we are able to raise to build the foundation. 

Over the years, friends and family have asked, how can we help?  We have always said, some day we will need your help.  Now is that time.

The Campaign -- Many Ways to Help

Now that we have purchased the land and completed the design, the next challenge is to raise the funds needed to build the facility.   We are looking to our friends and family to help us get a jump start on building the foundation so we can work towards qualifying for a bank loan.   While we need at least 40% of the total project cost for the loan, we’re kicking this off with a campaign to raise $50,000 or more from our friends and family.  If we are not able to reach our goal, whatever funds are raised will still go towards the foundation of the building. If we exceed our Indiegogo goal, it will help us to get that much closer to our ultimate goal.     Yes, US$50,000 is just a drop in the bucket of what we ultimately need,   But we believe in the miracle of universal participation.  Every little bit will help whether it is $5 or $10,000 -- so please help us to spread the word. 

Help us Fund our Scholarship Program

As previously mentioned, One Planet is providing $86,000 worth of scholarships per year to 55 students.  One way to help One Planet would be to help us to cover the cost of these existing scholarships.  This would allow One Planet to use more of its own funds to cover the cost of construction.    Tuition and material fees vary by grade level, but on average, the total cost of supporting one student with tuition, fees, uniform, school trips and counseling support is US$3,000 per year.    A single student can be with One Planet up to 15 years, but students join us at varying ages.   

If you would like to fund a scholarship, you can choose a 50% or 100% scholarship as a perk from the right column.   If you would like to pay for multiple years you can purchase more than one.

Dedicate a Brick, a Reading Corner, Classroom, Garden, Laboratory or even a Library

You may contribute any amount you wish, or you may decide to contribute towards one of the goals mentioned in the right column.    For example, you may wish to dedicate a classroom or library in honor of a loved one or in the name of your community.     You or the children in your community may enjoy submitting artwork which will be printed on a ceramic tile and permanently installed in the school.   

If you are interested in helping One Planet, you can contribute, host a fund raiser, and tell your friends and family about this campaign. You may enjoy working together with your local community, your book club, your extended family or co-workers to raise funds to build a classroom, science lab, library or other feature listed under the perks.      You may even wish to check if you employer has corporate responsibility funds to make available.  If you are interested in hosting a fund raiser, we can share ideas for your event. 

Beyond Contributions

Even though our initial campaign is for US$50,000, our ultimate goal is much higher.  If you or someone you know is interested in helping One Planet with a larger sum, in the form of a gift, a no- or low-interest loan, or as a social impact investor, please contact Zelalem and Gail at info@OnePlanetSchool.com.  

The Back Story...

When Zelalem and Gail were married in 1996, they made a promise to one another.   Once they finished their education, they’d go to Africa and do something to be of service. 

Ten years later, after they finished their education, got good jobs, had children and bought a house in the suburbs of Washington, DC, they nearly forgot about their promise.   After consulting, they decided to quit their jobs, sell their house, pack up everything they own and move to Ethiopia.  The family arrived in Addis Ababa on New Year’s Eve of 2005. 

Just a few months later they opened One Planet International School with only 15 kids as a social enterprise.  

The One Planet Story...
