story:
What we need and what we offer

What we need?

We need 20,000 USD to purchase 1000 micro:bit devices to distribute among Sri Lankan School Children, specially disadvantaged ones. All proceeds from the campaign will be used exclusively to buy and send micro:bit devices to schools all around the country. 

What we offer?

Anyone who takes part in our campaign becomes part of the changes - key changes not only to the lives of many young people, but also to change the mind-set of society: instead of being focused on the past and negative - orientation towards the future, positives, achievements and vision. Our target is to distribute 1000 micro:bit devices among children free of charge. 

 

What we have done so far

 

What is micro:bit?

The Micro Bit itself is a circuit board measuring just 50x40mm with two buttons and an array of 25 red LEDs in a 5×5 arrangement. It will come in various colours, including green and blue. Kids can program the board via a web-based interface to do many things, including flashing up numbers, letters and scrolling messages on the LEDs. Plus, since there’s a built-in accelerometer and compass, it can detect movement and tell which way it’s pointing.

Why micro:bit?

 

 

What is micro:bit SLUG?

micro:bit Sri Lanka User Group is a countrywide initiative which consists of young volunteers who are from professional organizations and universities. Our mission is to increase computer programming capabilities and empower every child in Sri Lanka. 

 

Our Team

Our team is consisted of young volunteers who are from professional organizations and universities. we have 150+ registered volunteers who are from all around the country.

 

Our Mission

Simply it is “Helping Future Innovators”. Our mission is to increase computer programming capabilities and empower every child in Sri Lanka. With the help of micro:bit, we can lay the foundation of programming to enrich their lives.

 

Introducing micro:bit to Sri Lanka and micro:bit Sri Lanka User Group Launch

Our first task was to host an event to launch micro:bit SLUG and introduce micro:bits to Sri Lanka officially. After few team discussions, we finalized the location. Normally these kind of launch events are happening based on our capital, Colombo. But we decided to change that practice. We organized it in Nenasala Center, Udubaddawa which is located 100 miles away from Colombo.

 

Nisala Nenasala is the best Nenasala Center in North Western Province. More than 80 students are having ICT education there.  There were two main parts of this event. First, we had the ceremony at main hall. And then we held the first micro:bit based Hour of Code in Sri Lanka. 2o students got hands on experience same time. Their feedback was amazing.

 

Awareness Sessions

Most important thing is increasing the awareness of Kids, Parents and Teachers on the value of micro:bits.

As a team we identified that reaching them physically is ideal. So in addition to our social media awareness campaigns our volunteer team is organizing holding sessions on various Schools and Institutes. You can find sessions we have conducted so far via our web site. We are distributing micro:bit devices among kids in every awareness session we do. We have already done more than 50 awareness sessions all around the country including medium and large scale events. To view them, please visit our web site (http://microbitslug.org/event)

Apart from those things our team is always trying to reach more kids. To do that we have to translate English contents to local languages. For now we have translated micro:bit global web site in to Sinhala and Tamil.(http://microbit.org/si, http://microbit.org/ta)

Sinhala Version

Tamil Version

micro:bit can be programmed through web interfaces. PXT editor is the best editor. It is also now available in Sinhala.(https://pxt.microbit.org/?lang=si-LK)

Not only that currently we are working on developing a video tutorial series for kids in local languages.

 

Why we need your support?

Our program totally depends on micro:bit devices. Using micro:bit kids can learn programming in an interesting way. As this is a non profit initiative, we need your support to continue this program. 

 

For more information about our program, Please visit:

http://microbitslug.org

http://microbit.org/ecosystem-bycountry

 

 

Our goal is to distribute 1000 micro:bit devices among Sri Lankan kids by the end of this year(2017)

 

 

 

For more information and verification,

Philip Meitiner (philip@microbit.org)

Prabhath Mannapperuma (prabhath@microbitslug.org)

Indika Dalugama (indika@microbitslug.org)

Avishka Laknath (avishka@microbitslug.org)

 

Contact Us,

micro:bit Sri Lanka User Group, Nattandiya Rd, Udubaddawa, North West, 60250, Sri Lanka

info@microbitslug.org

+94 767 482 482

Follow us on Social Networks: Facebook, Twitter

Our target is to distribute 1000 micro:bit devices among children free of charge.  What we have done so far What is micro:bit?The Micro Bit itself is a circuit board measuring just 50x40mm with two buttons and an array of 25 red LEDs in a 5×5 arrangement. It will come in various colours, including green and blue. Kids can program the board via a web-based interface to do many things, including flashing up numbers, letters and scrolling messages on the LEDs. Plus, since there’s a built-in accelerometer and compass, it can detect movement and tell which way it’s pointing.Why micro:bit?  What is micro:bit SLUG?micro:bit Sri Lanka User Group is a countrywide initiative which consists of young volunteers who are from professional organizations and universities. story:
Our Mission

Empowering children and families to thrive globally; through healthy, fun, positive education and entertainment. 

History

Take a huge risk, or sit back and do nothing? These were the thoughts in the back of my mind for many years. As an internationally renowned health expert and nutritionist, one thing became painfully clear: Our children have little chance of growing into healthy, caring and happy adults, unless someone stepped up and offered a solution.

I was committed to creating a global company and fan base to provide healthy, educational and inspirational alternatives, instead of just the traditional health information and fantasy role models available to kids and parents today.  

The next step became clear overnight. It was time to dedicate 100% of my time to develop my vision. Pauli Broccoli & Friends were on the way to become global health heroes and educators! 

It was time to make Green The New Cool!

After my first book "The Adventures of Pauli Broccoli” became an absolute hit, I knew  what I had to do next. I had to pursue exactly what the world is in dire need of; empowering children and families through healthy, fun, positive education and entertainment.

All that’s needed is your generous support to bring this book to life through animation, apps, games, and other educational products, which, as you can imagine, is a very resource-demanding process.

But most of all, I need your support to make my vision a reality; to spread this message around the world. But before you decide whether or not to support my dream, consider this: What is more important than protecting our most valuable resource; our children?

 

Book Testimonials

"Brilliant! Mealtime has always been a chore with my 3 kids, as they refused to eat anything healthy / green. I bought the book after reading the positive reviews and WOW! Someone has finally figured out how to get my kids to eat their greens and LOVE them! Thank YOU for making our dinners fun again!" Jannine M.

"Pauli is a delightful story that takes your child on a wonderful journey. Not only are they learning about where healthy food comes from, but they are transported to different countries around the world. The fun and light-hearted dialogue is teaching our children how to eat properly and with recipes!. This is a wonderful read for children and their families! My grand-daughter (6 years old) was excited and engaged while we read of Pauli's adventures. We purchased a copy for her younger cousin as well. This is a fun way to share why eating healthy is so important."  E. Moore, Seattle

"This a great read! The storyline and vibrant illustrations do a beautiful job at keeping kids engaged! Characters are really personable and "cool". It is also a fun entertaining book to read to children from an adult perspective. Definitely worth it!" Amazon Customer

"This is a wonderful story! It's both engaging, entertaining and educational! Using animated plants and animals to teach children about healthy eating and exposing them to the diversity of our world at the same time is brilliant! I would highly recommend this book.​" Jim M, Atlanta

"WONDERFUL BOOK!!!!! My kids now love vegetables!! The whole family gathers around to listen to Pauli's story EVERY night! The only problem is how much I have to read ha ha. All around great book would love to see more of Birgit's work in the future!​" Amazon Customer

"Beautiful book my kids love all of the pictures and now love veggies too!! Thanks keep up the good work!" Amazon Customer

It was then time to bring Pauli Broccoli & Friends to life through animation by hiring the most amazing talent from all over the globe.  

The Team

Birgit (Kuehn) Waites, M.S.  Founder & CEO

When Birgit realized the serious nutritional problems facing children today, she discovered her passion.  As an internationally renowned  Health Expert, Celebrity Nutritionist, Master Herbalist, Life Coach, Environmental Health Expert, Speaker and Author, promoting healthy living, natural medicine, and good nutrition has long been her life's work.

Birgit’s exposure into the natural health field started at the young age of 4 in Germany, where her grandpa taught her everything he knew about nutrition and herbalism. She then lived in Africa and Asia, and all over the US, where she continued her journey of learning.

Birgit has worked with a well known health clinic, high level companies, exclusive country clubs, and celebrity/high end private clients worldwide, to promote better, more mindful, and most importantly, sustainable lifestyles. She accomplishes this through lectures, wellness programs, one-on-one consultations and comprehensive nutritional therapies.

Birgit's new mission is to devote 100% of her time to Pauli Broccoli & Friends. 

Rainer Simon - Famous illustrator and artist - Germany

Yes----he paints everything by hand! You will not find anything like it anywhere else. 

Ibsen Rios - Talented music producer - Venezuela

An unbelievable talent, producing cool music that both kids and adults love. No earplugs needed while your kids watch their new favorite show. You'll be dancing with them. (Ibsen is also the voice of Fernando Avocado in our "Green Is The New Cool" music video!)

Heiko Volz - A celebrity in his own right, working on Pauli's German translation - Germany

If you're German, you probably know him. I am absolutely honored to have him on my German Pauli Broccoli team!        

Rostik Balash - Animator, Italy

Daniel Viau - Creative screenwriter - Canada

Katabelle - The amazing voice of Pauli Broccoli - USA

Where are we now?

As our fan base kept growing, corporations and investors started contacting me. At this point it became clear: We created something the world wants and needs desperately.

And this is where we really need your help. This healthy and positive message is without limits, and needs to be spread to kids and families around the world. We have no competition. Experts are telling us we are the healthy, educational and more inspirational choice to the traditional fantasy role models and options available to kids and parents today.  

Our goal is making the world a better and healthier place, while also giving back and donating to communities and kids around the globe. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Due to our rapid growth, our goal is $500,000.  Even if we don't hit our goal, everything will be spent on:

  • Attorney Fees (IP, business)
  • Business Advisor
  • Salaries
  • Web Designer
  • Voiceover actors 
  • Animator
  • Artist & Illustrator 
  • Public Relations
  • Marketing Experts 
  • Advertising
  • Music Production
  • New Book Releases 
  • New Product Lines
  • App and Game Development

We have some amazing perks for you!

Personalized autographed books. You tell us who to dedicate the book to, and we take care of the rest - shipping included!

  • Unique Pauli Broccoli merchandise!

​

  • Our characters in pictures with you! Send us a picture and we will add the characters of your choice! 

  • Our top contributor will be able to decide what country we will feature next, along with a new fruit/veggie!
  • Stay tuned for more exciting perks arriving soon!

The Impact

Let's look at some staggering facts we can address with our brand:

The percentage of children with obesity in the United States has more than tripled since the 1970s. As the rest of the world becomes more westernized, other countries are not far behind. Today, about one in five school-aged children (ages 6–19) is obese. 

Childhood obesity has immediate and long-term impacts on physical, social, and emotional health. For example:

Children with obesity are at higher risk for having other chronic health conditions and diseases that impact physical health, such as asthma, sleep apnea, bone and joint problems, type 2 diabetes, and risk factors for heart disease.

Children with obesity are bullied and teased more than their normal weight peers, and are more likely to suffer from social isolation, depression, and lower self-esteem.

In the long term, childhood obesity also is associated with having obesity as an adult,  which is linked to serious conditions and diseases such as heart disease, type 2 diabetes, metabolic syndrome, and several types of cancer.

We need to do something FAST! There is no other brand that addresses the childhood obesity issue, along with other modern day dilemmas our kids face.  

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand not everyone can contribute financially, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

  • You can still get the word out and make some noise about Pauli Broccoli's campaign.
  • Shop for fun Pauli Broccoli merchandise on our website. All proceeds will go towards our mission.  https://pauli-broccoli.myshopify.com/collections 
  • Purchase Pauli Broccoli books and songs. Available worldwide, for the USA click here:https://www.amazon.com/s/ref=nb_sb_ss_rsis_1_5?...
  • You can also use the share tools on this site.

We are so grateful for all of you! 

Sending you Peas, Love & Broccoli

Birgit

story:
The Global Guardian Project is a digital learning magazine (we call them capsules) that teach children about caring for the earth and its inhabitants. Our mission to help raise more ecologically conscious and compassionate children who will become guardians of our planet AND OUR PEOPLE.

Our mission is to inspire and empower families to make simple, sustainable changes starting at home. How do we do this? By teaching the following

  • how to create new patterns of behavior and thinking in order to make positive changes for the health of the world.
  • how to be ecologically conscious so that living sustainably will be second nature to them.
  • to understand how their immediate actions are connected to overall environmental health.

What’s inside our digital magazines?

 

Each interactive issue will focus on a different area of the world, and will be chock full of  geographical projects, stories, DIY projects, a book club, inspiring videos and podcasts for you and your little global guardian.  By design, each magazine will have ongoing, interactive projects and challenges for you and your family to help take steps to become  global changemakers.

 

There are two ways you can purchase our digital magazines.  Either through our a la carte option, where you can choose the magazines you’d like to receive immediately.

The second option is to become a member by subscribing to our monthly program. As a subscriber, you’ll receive our digital magazine at a discounted rate in your inbox each month.

 

We’ve spent the past year in beta mode, testing and tweaking our content.  We’ve had a core group of subscribers who have given us consistent feedback on what they like, what should change and how we can do better.  Now we’re ready to scale our project. We’re ready to start creating a serious impact on the world. Through your contribution, the Global Guardian Project will be able to inspire, educate and unite children across the planet.

Global Guardian Project's stakeholders literally encompass the entire world.  It starts with you and me, flows to our children, schools, our community, natural environment, all living beings, and finally the Earth itself. There is no being or living thing that couldn't be positively affected by Global Guardian Project's work.

 

Raising our kids to care deeply and passionately about the health of our planet should be one of our top priorities as parents. But sometimes the amount of issues seem so huge that it’s hard to know where to begin.

That’s where we come in.

Our project helps families change their actions in everyday life. These are actions aid in the overall health of the world.  And we’re targeting the entire family, so those new behaviors will create a generational shift, meaning that what we teach a 5 year old will stick with him or her through adulthood.  That child will have new opportunities to learn, and then in return, teach these new behaviors to those around him or her. This causes a ripple effect of change.

Investing in our family’s future by educating and inspiring our children is the foundation to homeschooling. Our curriculum teaches children to care for our environment, and in turn, becoming future global contributors. Global Guardian Project gives you the tools to get you started and makes it easy to learn at your own pace. Each month we build on what you learn, helping you to make permanent, sustainable positive changes in the home.  

Global Guardian Project focuses on providing global education, inspiring everyday activism, and bringing these together through monthly STEAM based (Science, Technology, Engineering, Art, Math) lessons and learning activities. We believe this is a robust approach to educating the 21st century child. For example, we help children see how they can pair ideas with technology skills so they can actualize solutions. Our goal is to inspire change and give young global guardians tools to make it happen.

We are creating a space, both online and off, called the Young Changemaker Community,  where children will be empowered to take what they've learned and pitch ideas on projects, actions or inventions that would make a positive shift toward sustainability and ecosystem health. There they can connect with each other to coordinate their own Global Guardian offline events and meet-ups. We’d be creating a space for kids to connect and develop their own ideas on how to change the world.

GGP helps to prevent extinction on this planet by teaching how we are all interconnected and interdependent; which is what makes our approach unique.

In each digital issue we teach about intrinsic value, which means that something or someone has inherent worth, and that their value does not only come from how useful they are to humans. It is more important than ever to protect each creature and its unique role on the planet. 

We believe that if we want to heal humanity, it is just as important that we need to heal our relationships with animals.

It is imperative that we protect our Earth's ecosystems. To do that, we must educate our children on how nature works, how everything is interconnected and interdependent.  This will teach us that we are a small part of a whole, not separate, but inclusive of a much bigger picture.  That we depend on each other and the Earth, and the health of the Earth ultimately depends on us.

Our home.  We only have one.  And we're facing huge challenges that we'll eventually have to hand off to our children and our grandchildren.  Unless, we can teach children NOW how to be global stewards, so that in the future caring for the Earth and it's inhabitants becomes second nature. Not an overwhelming issue as we treat it today, but a right and responsibility that's born at the core and ingrained in the soul. 

 

We chose our goal of $15,000 to expand our efforts to produce more content, begin translating into other languages and further sustain our work. For the past year we have been building this initiative all pro bono, now we want to expand operations and we need this 15k to grow our content writing and marketing efforts.  

“As an artist and social entrepreneur, global education and environmental awareness has always been the subject of my work.  I used art to tell stories of global struggles and the power of educating children for social change.

As my own children grew, I started to see that there was a huge disconnect when it came to educating children on how to care for the Earth.  There was no place for me to turn to that teaches my children how the world is interconnected. How we all depend on each other.

Through my art and global travels, somewhere along the line a seed was planted.  It grew deep inside me.  I knew I had to create a way to take my pairing of art and global education to create an interactive learning tool.  That seed sprouted into the Global Guardian Project.

It was then that I really realized my calling in life is to create ideas, opportunities and solutions for global minded parents so they can teach their own children how to care for the Earth. This is how I contribute to the world- by using my art + passion for global awareness to create a ripple effect for global good." -Rebecca Lane, Founder

Danielle Chassin

Known as Hippie in Disguise to the many who follow her blog and Instagram account, Danielle is a policy strategist for the Canadian government by day, urban adventurer and simplicity seeker by night. Mother of two spirited children, Danielle is passionate about creative and sustainable living, eco-minimalism and living the practice of kindness. Danielle’s photography and writing focus on and elevate the simple things that make life beautiful and inspiring. Read more from Danielle at www.hippieindisguise.com and find her on Instagram @hippieindisguise.

 

Natalie Crane

Natalie is a full time photographer living near Los Angeles, California. she recently graduated with a BFA in fine art, & started her own photography business so that she could travel often. she shoots weddings & families throughout the year all over the united states. one of her biggest passions is discovering new places through photography. she loves hiking, backpacking, and spontaneously buying plane tickets to new countries. you can find her work at www.likemorningsun.com & instagram.com/natalieecrane.

 

Molly Fisher

Molly is a former educator, founder and CEO with over sixteen years of experience working in Mexico in senior management and education roles. She has a B.S. in Biology and a graduate certificate in Science Education from Indiana University and is passionate about social innovation, impact, education and outdoor recreation.

 

Coleen Hodges

Coleen is a lifestyle photographer based in Phoenix, AZ. She is the mother of two children, ages 3 and 4. In addition to photography, Coleen is an Emergency Room nurse and is married to a Phoenix Firefighter. She is always looking to document raw, everyday moments and prefers to express herself with emotive imagery. One of her main objectives as a mother and as an artist is to show her children that beauty can be found everywhere, and she takes them adventuring every chance she gets.

 

Rebecca Lane

Rebecca Lane founder of Global Guardian Project, is an artist and social entrepreneur whose passion for global education has sparked each of her art brand creations, all focused on environmental and social responsibility. A gypsy at heart, she created Global Guardian Project as a way to educate her children first hand, and to offer her family’s experience to parents who are raising their own global guardians.

 

Matt Surch

Matt is an avid car-free cyclist, blogger and public servant in Ottawa, Ontario. Matt brings a philosophy, communications, and environmental studies background to his writing on cycling culture and technology, melding interests in sustainable development, neuroscience, social construction of technology, and ecology. Find his writings on www.teknecycling.com

 

Jenny PoonJenny Poon is a serial entrepreneur and founder of CO+HOOTS, Phoenix’s #1 coworking space and small business incubator. She is also the founder of eeko studio, a boutique design and advertising agency focused on fresh designs for impactful companies large and small. Her background as an award-winning designer and entrepreneurial leader paired with her fascination with education for young minds led her to Global Guardian Project. 

 

Sheriden VanHoy

Sheriden is a designer and illustrator from Arizona. She currently works at Jenny Poon's design company eeko studio and while simultaneously working on too many personal projects on the side. She loves comic books, video games, succulents, and painting (when she finds the time). She is also an advocate for the LGBT+ community and strives to help create a better world for the community through design and illustration. You can find her on instagram @sheringsnippets and her portfolio website on sheringcreations.com.
 

 

Stragetic Growth

We plan to create more content for our readers to evolve with,  doubling our digital learning capsules from 20 to 40 capsule issues by April of 2018. And we plan to have a learning capsule created on each of the 195 countries in the world by the end of 2019. That's a very hefty goal, but one we're confident we can achieve.  We also plan to translate our digital capsules into various languages, starting with Spanish. This can be started immediately with funding.

Global Guardian Jr., a digital subscription for younger learners, ages 3-6, is scheduled to launch June, 2018. 

NPO + School Collaborations

To date we've partnered with a dozen online schools to offer our subscriptions, as well as National Parks organizations in the USA to develop content for their parks and to help promote learning about and visits to national parks. We would like to expand our reach to online, charter and public schools nationwide and eventually globally. We also wish to partner with environmental NPOs, who have missions aligned  to ours.

Young Changemaker Community

Along with our model of educating online, we want to affect change in the real world.

Our next move is to build our online community to engage your little activists. This is where the real magic happens, when they SHARE. Sharing is a key part of our program to help children themselves  become interconnected, forward-thinking young individuals.  We're essentially creating an ecosystem of little global activists. We'd like to organize kid-driven on-the-ground events like beach clean-ups, local fundraisers and other environmental volunteer events, which help inspire and cultivate budding changemakers.  We will empower them to lead their own events and share ideas of their own.

Our Young Changemaker community is organizing the GGP Global Beach Clean Up Day, our very first on the ground community event.  We have organizations + families from the US, Canada, Mexico, Australia and Sweden participating in a two part, kid run clean up event.  The first part includes a DIY project included in our ocean capsule called a “sand sifter” project.  Together, families will craft their own sand sifter using a wooden frame and screen.  On the day of the event, families around the world will take the sifter to the beach, clean up an area and document the hidden plastics they find in the sand.  We’ll collect the data and create an educational piece on our findings that will inspire more families to become involved in the project.  Our goal is for this event to gain momentum, so we can host global clean up events like this throughout the year.  It’s also intended to help educate families on the impact of plastics in the ocean and how each individual can do their part to help, both by using less or no plastics, and also by being active in local clean-ups in their communities.   This is a perfect example of what our Young Changemaker community is capable of. 

Risks and Challenges

Because we've been active for over a year, we've established a very strong foundation.  We have build a small community of subscribers and followers and have consistently produced our promised high quality content on time, every month. 

Yet there are challenges we have to overcome in order to launch on a global scale.

Our primary challenge is funding for our content writers, as the paid-content model we currently use is not sufficient to allow our contributors to leave full-time jobs and commit to the GGP. 

Outreach is also an ongoing challenge. We all know how consuming and fast paced the world runs on social media.  It's at the very least a full time job. 

To solve our funding challenges, we chose a financial goal to give us the initial boost we need to secure 4 months operating costs, which we believe is enough time to promote and grow our monthly subscription base, so that we can become financially sustainable through our subscription based model.  

We’re a team entrepreneurs, social activists, non profit founders, educators and writers.  Collectively, we have the ability to anticipate and troubleshoot challenges.  We’ve all poured our hearts into projects and businesses, have celebrated successes and survived failures.  We know when a project is worth our time and energy.  And we believe full-heartedly this one is worthy. 

 

 

All the ways you can help

There are other ways you can help us reach our goals.  Here are a few:

Share our story with others.  Parents, teachers, organizations, museums, educational organizations. If you know of an adult who cares about taking better care of the earth, please share.

Sign up for our newsletter.  Click above to sign up for our newsletter and get exclusive access to a free capsule sample. Each week, we’ll also send you an inspiring email with stories of others taking action in the world + ideas on how you can too.

Go viral-  share our work on Instagram, Facebook and Twitter.  You think Al Gore needs to know what we’re up to?  So do we.  Let him know.  Use Indiegogo’s awesome share tools to spread the word.
story_txt:
The Global Guardian Project is a digital learning magazine (we call them capsules) that teach children about caring for the earth and its inhabitants. Our mission to help raise more ecologically conscious and compassionate children who will become guardians of our planet AND OUR PEOPLE.Our mission is to inspire and empower families to make simple, sustainable changes starting at home. How do we do this? By teaching the following
how to create new patterns of behavior and thinking in order to make positive changes for the health of the world.
how to be ecologically conscious so that living sustainably will be second nature to them.
to understand how their immediate actions are connected to overall environmental health.
What’s inside our digital magazines? Each interactive issue will focus on a different area of the world, and will be chock full of  geographical projects, stories, DIY projects, a book club, inspiring videos and podcasts for you and your little global guardian.  By design, each magazine will have ongoing, interactive projects and challenges for you and your family to help take steps to become  global changemakers. There are two ways you can purchase our digital magazines.  Either through our a la carte option, where you can choose the magazines you’d like to receive immediately.The second option is to become a member by subscribing to our monthly program. As a subscriber, you’ll receive our digital magazine at a discounted rate in your inbox each month. We’ve spent the past year in beta mode, testing and tweaking our content.  We’ve had a core group of subscribers who have given us consistent feedback on what they like, what should change and how we can do better.  Now we’re ready to scale our project. We’re ready to start creating a serious impact on the world. Through your contribution, the Global Guardian Project will be able to inspire, educate and unite children across the planet.Global Guardian Project's stakeholders literally encompass the entire world.  It starts with you and me, flows to our children, schools, our community, natural environment, all living beings, and finally the Earth itself. There is no being or living thing that couldn't be positively affected by Global Guardian Project's work. Raising our kids to care deeply and passionately about the health of our planet should be one of our top priorities as parents. But sometimes the amount of issues seem so huge that it’s hard to know where to begin.That’s where we come in.Our project helps families change their actions in everyday life. These are actions aid in the overall health of the world.  And we’re targeting the entire family, so those new behaviors will create a generational shift, meaning that what we teach a 5 year old will stick with him or her through adulthood.  That child will have new opportunities to learn, and then in return, teach these new behaviors to those around him or her. This causes a ripple effect of change.Investing in our family’s future by educating and inspiring our children is the foundation to homeschooling. Our curriculum teaches children to care for our environment, and in turn, becoming future global contributors. Global Guardian Project gives you the tools to get you started and makes it easy to learn at your own pace. Each month we build on what you learn, helping you to make permanent, sustainable positive changes in the home.  Global Guardian Project focuses on providing global education, inspiring everyday activism, and bringing these together through monthly STEAM based (Science, Technology, Engineering, Art, Math) lessons and learning activities. We believe this is a robust approach to educating the 21st century child. For example, we help children see how they can pair ideas with technology skills so they can actualize solutions. Our goal is to inspire change and give young global guardians tools to make it happen.We are creating a space, both online and off, called the Young Changemaker Community,  where children will be empowered to take what they've learned and pitch ideas on projects, actions or inventions that would make a positive shift toward sustainability and ecosystem health. There they can connect with each other to coordinate their own Global Guardian offline events and meet-ups. We’d be creating a space for kids to connect and develop their own ideas on how to change the world.GGP helps to prevent extinction on this planet by teaching how we are all interconnected and interdependent; which is what makes our approach unique.In each digital issue we teach about intrinsic value, which means that something or someone has inherent worth, and that their value does not only come from how useful they are to humans. It is more important than ever to protect each creature and its unique role on the planet. We believe that if we want to heal humanity, it is just as important that we need to heal our relationships with animals.It is imperative that we protect our Earth's ecosystems. To do that, we must educate our children on how nature works, how everything is interconnected and interdependent.  This will teach us that we are a small part of a whole, not separate, but inclusive of a much bigger picture.  That we depend on each other and the Earth, and the health of the Earth ultimately depends on us.Our home.  We only have one.  And we're facing huge challenges that we'll eventually have to hand off to our children and our grandchildren.  Unless, we can teach children NOW how to be global stewards, so that in the future caring for the Earth and it's inhabitants becomes second nature. Not an overwhelming issue as we treat it today, but a right and responsibility that's born at the core and ingrained in the soul.  We chose our goal of $15,000 to expand our efforts to produce more content, begin translating into other languages and further sustain our work. For the past year we have been building this initiative all pro bono, now we want to expand operations and we need this 15k to grow our content writing and marketing efforts.  “As an artist and social entrepreneur, global education and environmental awareness has always been the subject of my work.  I used art to tell stories of global struggles and the power of educating children for social change.As my own children grew, I started to see that there was a huge disconnect when it came to educating children on how to care for the Earth.  There was no place for me to turn to that teaches my children how the world is interconnected. How we all depend on each other.Through my art and global travels, somewhere along the line a seed was planted.  It grew deep inside me.  I knew I had to create a way to take my pairing of art and global education to create an interactive learning tool.  That seed sprouted into the Global Guardian Project.It was then that I really realized my calling in life is to create ideas, opportunities and solutions for global minded parents so they can teach their own children how to care for the Earth. This is how I contribute to the world- by using my art + passion for global awareness to create a ripple effect for global good." -Rebecca Lane, FounderDanielle Chassin Known as Hippie in Disguise to the many who follow her blog and Instagram account, Danielle is a policy strategist for the Canadian government by day, urban adventurer and simplicity seeker by night. Mother of two spirited children, Danielle is passionate about creative and sustainable living, eco-minimalism and living the practice of kindness. Danielle’s photography and writing focus on and elevate the simple things that make life beautiful and inspiring. Read more from Danielle at www.hippieindisguise.com and find her on Instagram @hippieindisguise. Natalie CraneNatalie is a full time photographer living near Los Angeles, California. she recently graduated with a BFA in fine art, & started her own photography business so that she could travel often. she shoots weddings & families throughout the year all over the united states. one of her biggest passions is discovering new places through photography. she loves hiking, backpacking, and spontaneously buying plane tickets to new countries. you can find her work at www.likemorningsun.com & instagram.com/natalieecrane. Molly FisherMolly is a former educator, founder and CEO with over sixteen years of experience working in Mexico in senior management and education roles. She has a B.S. in Biology and a graduate certificate in Science Education from Indiana University and is passionate about social innovation, impact, education and outdoor recreation. Coleen HodgesColeen is a lifestyle photographer based in Phoenix, AZ. She is the mother of two children, ages 3 and 4. In addition to photography, Coleen is an Emergency Room nurse and is married to a Phoenix Firefighter. She is always looking to document raw, everyday moments and prefers to express herself with emotive imagery. One of her main objectives as a mother and as an artist is to show her children that beauty can be found everywhere, and she takes them adventuring every chance she gets. Rebecca LaneRebecca Lane founder of Global Guardian Project, is an artist and social entrepreneur whose passion for global education has sparked each of her art brand creations, all focused on environmental and social responsibility. A gypsy at heart, she created Global Guardian Project as a way to educate her children first hand, and to offer her family’s experience to parents who are raising their own global guardians.  Matt SurchMatt is an avid car-free cyclist, blogger and public servant in Ottawa, Ontario. Matt brings a philosophy, communications, and environmental studies background to his writing on cycling culture and technology, melding interests in sustainable development, neuroscience, social construction of technology, and ecology. Find his writings on www.teknecycling.com Jenny PoonJenny Poon is a serial entrepreneur and founder of CO+HOOTS, Phoenix’s #1 coworking space and small business incubator. She is also the founder of eeko studio, a boutique design and advertising agency focused on fresh designs for impactful companies large and small. Her background as an award-winning designer and entrepreneurial leader paired with her fascination with education for young minds led her to Global Guardian Project.  
Sheriden VanHoySheriden is a designer and illustrator from Arizona. She currently works at Jenny Poon's design company eeko studio and while simultaneously working on too many personal projects on the side. She loves comic books, video games, succulents, and painting (when she finds the time). She is also an advocate for the LGBT+ community and strives to help create a better world for the community through design and illustration. You can find her on instagram @sheringsnippets and her portfolio website on sheringcreations.com.

story:
English Version below.

Vinge Lilleskole er baseret på visionen om at skabe en bedre verden gennem at fostre en ny generation af hele, lykkeligere børn, der med tiden bliver morgendagens kærlige bevidste og fællesskabsorienterede og mere lykkelige voksne.
Vi vil skabe en skole, der støtter børn i at frigøre deres fulde unikke potentiale, både for sig selv, for deres kammerater, samfund og for verden.

Dette sker ved at give børnene et stærkt og nærende fællesskab, som sammen praktiserer og omsætter, værdier, metoder, erfaringer, som vi ser mest optimalt vil opfylde dette mål. Det vil bla. være ved brug af værktøjer fra fx HeartMath, Way of Council, Yoga, Entrepreneurship, innovative undervisningsmetoder og “best practice” fra både uddannelsessystemet og erhvervslivet. Skolen bliver selvfølgelig også holistisk dvs. at børnene hver dag skal næres både, fysisk, mentalt, følelsesmæssigt og åndeligt.

Skolens bygninger og beliggenhed vil afspejle skolens værdier med fokus på natur, ved at have fri adgang til masser af natur, drivhus og permakulturel dyrkning af både frugt og grøntsager. Lokalerne skal støtte op om vores indsats om at imødekomme børns unikke behov og forskellige læringstyper.

Bygninger, materiale, kost mv vil alt sammen blive så bæredygtigt som muligt og vi vil arbejde på at optimere dette år for år.

Alt sammen det der skal til for at vores børn trives, udlever hver deres unikke potentiale og får en skolegang der både beriger deres barndom og skaber et stærkt fundament for resten af livet. Vi skaber en ny generation der vil og kan forandre verden.

Vil du/I være med til at gøre dette til virkelighed?

Vi har brug for din hurtige indsats. Senest den 15. august skal vi indbetale beløbet kr. 20.000 i depositum for at være berettiget til statsstøtte som fri/lilleskole for næste skoleår, august 2018.

Så giv hvad du har lyst til. - Hvert et tilskud gør forskellen.

TAK <3 <3 <3
I kan læse mere om skolen på www.vingelilleskole.dk

English

Vinge Lilleskole is based on the vision of creating a better world by fostering a new generation of whole and happier children, who will become tomorrow's loving conscious and community-oriented, happier adults.
We want to create a school that supports children in unlocking their full unique potential, for themselves, for their comrades, communities and the world.

This will be done by giving the children a strong and nourishing community that together practices and translates values, methods, experiences, which we see most optimally will fulfill this goal. It will for example be using tools from HeartMath, Way of Council, Yoga, Entrepreneurship, innovative teaching methods and best practices from both the education system and the business community. The school is of course also holistic. Which means that the children must be nurtured both physically, mentally, emotionally and spiritually every day.

The school's buildings and location will reflect the school's values, having free access to lots of nature, greenhouses and permacultural cultivation of fruits and vegetables. The premises will support our efforts to meet the children's unique needs and different types of learning style.
Buildings, materials, food, etc. will all be as sustainable as possible.


Everything that is needed for our children to enjoy school time, opening and nourishing  their unique potential in a school that both enriches their childhood and creates a strong foundation for the rest of their lives. We create a new generation which both desires and can change the world.

Do you want to help make this happen?

We need your quick support. By the 15th of August, we will have to pay the amount of DKK 20,000 to be eligible for state aid as a free / lill school for the next school year, August 2018.

So give whatever you desire, so that we can change the future together by focusing on our children. THANK YOU <3 <3 <3

You can read more about the school at www.vingelilleskole.dk

story:
Our Story

In 2014 Daphne and I serendipitously sat next to each other on an airplane. I found myself telling her of my fantastic experience at Mpopongi Primary School in Kenya. While I listened to her experience of exploring Kenya as a 12 year old, I explained how I wanted to help the children at Mpopongi School. From this one amazing conversation a friendship and this website was created! Together we can make a difference, we can improve the quality of these Maasai students lives.

The Problem

The problem begins with a lack of funding for education. Almost every day, these Maasai children have to deal with overcrowded classrooms, unsanitary kitchens, extremely poor bathroom conditions, and a lack of clean, filtered water. All classes need; New floors, paint and windows. The toilets are unusable and must be replaced. There are over 550 students in the school and as many as six share one desk, therefore new desks are essential.

Mpopongi Primary School is stability for most of the children who attend and a means for them to achieve a goal, we in the developed world take for granted. Students who finish primary school are more likely to continue school through secondary grades and have the opportunity to study at university. 

Education is a key step out of poverty. Your support will make a valuable difference and will benefit the entire community! Your donation will go far no matter how small. You will greatly improve the academic experience of these students.

*Please view our image gallery for more pictures

Our Goal

The goal of this fundraiser is to raise money to build infrastructure. 

The school already has it’s foundation, but the necessities are; a new kitchen, bathrooms with proper plumbing, an additional classroom, a more stable and reinforced dining hall, and a filter for the water supply.

With over 550 children in attendance and classroom sizes ranging from 70-100 students per classroom it is imperative that these children receive education not only to help lift them out of poverty, but to give them the tools they need to make a difference in their community, country, and world. 

We must help to make Mpopongi Primary School’s dreams a reality. Please pick a perk, whichever touches your heart.

Where your money goes:

Our team  consists of Daphne Pariser, Angela Austin, Lynn Novatt, and David Kasura, who have donated their time and efforts over the past year.  Other than what Indiegogo takes for their administrative purposes (5%), 100% of your donation goes toward improving and developing both infrastructure and the academic quality of the students. Thank you so very much for helping to make this a reality.

Everything Helps!

If you aren’t able to help financially, we would truly appreciate your help in passing this campaign on to people you know. Use the awesome Indiegogo share tools or just forward the link to your friends. 

Together, let's be the difference!



Our Team:

The Problem
The
problem begins with a lack of funding for education. Almost every day, these
Maasai children have to deal with overcrowded classrooms, unsanitary kitchens, extremely
poor bathroom conditions, and a lack of clean, filtered water. All classes need; New floors, paint and windows. The toilets are unusable and must be replaced. There are over 550 students in the school and as many as six share one desk, therefore new desks are essential.
Mpopongi
Primary School is stability for most of the children who attend and a means
for them to achieve a goal, we in the developed world take for granted. Students who
finish primary school are more likely to continue school through secondary grades and have the opportunity to study at university. 
Education is a key step out of poverty. Your support will make a valuable difference and will benefit the entire community! Your donation will go far no matter how small. You will greatly improve the academic experience of these students.*Please view our image gallery for more picturesOur Goal
The goal of this fundraiser is to raise money to
build infrastructure. 
The school already has it’s foundation, but the
necessities are; a new kitchen, bathrooms with proper plumbing, an additional
classroom, a more stable and reinforced dining hall, and a filter for the water supply.
With over 550 children in attendance and classroom
sizes ranging from 70-100 students per classroom it is imperative that these
children receive education not only to help lift them out of poverty, but to
give them the tools they need to make a difference in their community, country,
and world. 
We must help to make Mpopongi Primary School’s dreams
a reality. Please pick a perk, whichever touches your heart.
Where your money goes:
Our team  consists of Daphne Pariser, Angela Austin, Lynn Novatt, and David Kasura, who have donated their time and efforts over the past year.  Other than what Indiegogo takes for their administrative purposes (5%), 100% of your donation goes toward improving and developing both infrastructure and the academic quality of the students. Thank you so very much for helping to make this a reality.
Everything Helps!
If you aren’t able to help financially, we would truly appreciate your help in passing this campaign on to people you know. Use the awesome Indiegogo share tools or just forward the link to your friends. Together, let's be the difference!Our Team:

story:
Mission:

To forever remove driving as the number one cause of death for teenagers in America.

Goal: 

2015: to fund operation expenses for 2015

Long-term:to take Teen Driving Solutions School nation-wide so that every teen and their parents have the opportunity to arrive alive every time they drive.

We’re Making a Difference:

Life Matters and the lives of today’s teen drivers holds tremendous value, not just to their families and friends but to their communities and our country as a whole.  This belief is the core foundation supporting our mission to forever remove driving as the number one cause of death for teenagers in America and we intend to achieve this with the present generation of teen drivers.

The Staggering Realities:

·  Every 90 minutes a teenager is killed in a car crash.  That’s the equivalent of one Jumbo Jet crashing every month in America.

·  Every 90 seconds a teenager is injured in an automobile crash.  That’s the equivalent of 3 Jumbo Jets crashing every day in America.

·  Teen crashes cost our nation over $40 billion dollars per year. 

These Lives CAN be Saved:

·  The root cause of nearly 80% of teenage vehicle fatalities (according to all government statistics) is simple “Driver Error”. 

·  Preventing these errors (mistakes) will save lives and remove driving from being the number one cause of death for teenagers in America.

The Solution--Skill based Education and Training;

·  Founded on the principle that Life Matters and lives can be saved

·  Focused on providing the Mental Skills required for safe driving

·  Familiarizing a driver with vehicle dynamics in ever changing environments

·  Fortifying a mental/physical connection between the driver and vehicle

·  Forming the basis to promote skills above confidence

The Process:

·  We must change the way we “think” about driving and the responsibility we have

·  We must recognize that “Awareness” doesn’t produce skills

·  We must understand that being “Distracted” is a choice

·  We must acknowledge that “Experience” without education/training simply perfects bad habits

·  We must refuse to view “Crashing” as a legitimate form of learning

·  We must place a higher value on the lives of our teen drivers.

Our Story:

Driving is a privilege, safe driving is a responsibility and Arriving Alive is a choice.  When a driver fully understands the scope of their responsibility, the limitations of their driving skill, the limitations of the vehicles they drive and what actually enables them to safely control a vehicle in any driving environment, they will be able to use sound judgment to make good decisions and Arrive Alive every time they drive.  These are the types of drivers our program creates.

We see every teen driver as someone’s child, sibling, family member or friend; like Mikayla (the girl in our video), a life that is simply too precious to lose. The Mikayla’s in our country can only be saved when the focus of our entire solution to driving begins by treasuring that life and centering the education and training directly on protecting and preserving its value.  Today’s teens are tomorrow’s leaders.  Let’s teach them what leadership looks like by ending the epidemic that is killing them today.

Join Us in Making a Difference:

Our Parent-Teen Training program is entering its 5th year and our methods have proven to be successful by enabling every graduating student to continually Arrive Alive!  Your donations will allow us to sustain the operation of the current program which functions at the Virginia International Raceway and begin marketing to other geographic locations where we hope to operate new schools.

How the Funds from this campaign will be used:

·  Operational Sustainability (2015):$85,000.00

Includes: Insurance; classroom rental, track rental, skid pad rental, water fees; vehicle and equipment storage; vehicle maintenance and fuel; meals for students, parents and volunteers; classroom and track supplies, and miscellaneous.

The Future, Growing and saving more lives

Our long-term goal is to expand our program into other regions. We plan to hold another funding campaign for our expansion.  Funds permitting, we will hold a pilot session in late 2015 and add new sessions to be held in other areas in 2016.

story: Bugarama, Rwanda: The picture above shows a meeting of the guardians of 200 students at St Paul Muko school who are not able to pay their lunch fees. In most cases this is because they are orphans or have parents who are too ill or elderly to work long hours. We have received a grant to cover the cost of lunch for half of those students, but 100 remain unable to eat at the lunch hour. This has enormous consequences on their ability to focus and succeed in school. We want to provide scholarships for these young people for this term-- about 14 USD per student. We appreciate your help in achieving this goal!

story:
We are working with Hetauda Chamber of Commerce & Jhapa Chamber of Commerce. They are helping us locally to reach & help the victims. 

All the funds contributed from you will be transferred to Yaman's Father, Navin Agarwal's bank a/c.

As of 12th May, taking note of the collected funds we have ordered 300 Double Blankets. 

We will increase the number of blankets as the funds goes up. 

We are currently travelling to Mukwanpur, Nepal via road to donate the needy. 

We were informed by Bhuwan ji(President, Hetauda COC) that more than food, there is a necessity of blankets. As food is being contributed from round the globe. As the affected area gets extremely cold in the nights. 

With that, I hope there is transparency in the campaign about how the funds are going in.

Quakes measured at 7.9 ritcher scale shook Nepal shattering people's lives & home need your help now.

We're working with Jhapa Chamber of Commerce & Industry to help the survivor victims of the natural calamity in the villages of Nepal.

We shall be releasing a video, of the relief program by the end of this month..

We are here from  CookingShooking, a cooking channel on Youtube.

Recently, an earthquake of 7.9 magnitude had shattered entire Nepal. Leaving thousands of people homeless, with no food to eat and water to drink. It is a saddening fact that one might have worked entire life for building a house and live with their loved ones. No one can compensate the loss they have suffered. Children have lost their parents in the debris , mothers are left helpless, children are shattered by their parents loss, adventurers show no sign of return.

In this event of crisis, we pray for the well-being of the survivor victims of the earthquake. What has happened wasn’t really in our hands, as no one can compete with nature’s destiny. But, what is in our hands NOW at this moment is more important.

Helping someone wouldn’t decrease your wealth, instead will add thousands of well-wishes from the beneficiaries. An amount doesn’t matter; it can be even a single penny, as it can buy a piece of bread.

Need of the hour is that we do as much as relief programs as possible. Or else, even survival for the survivor victims would be impossible.

We would request you to please contribute as much as you can, and don’t judge it as a meager amount, as even a single penny from large sources could bring an ocean of funds.

This funding is going to be used entirely for the welfare of the survivor victims in the villages in the rural areas of Nepal. The more funds, the more we can help.

We would be going to the rural parts of Nepal, helping & providing Relief Packages Directly to them which would consist of all the necessary items like Food, Blankets & so on.

Seeking your valuable response.

Jai Nepal! 

__

In case you want to transfer to our bank account directly, you could contact us: cookingshooking@gmail.com

story:
Public broadcasting stations have been on the front lines of history for more than 60 years. Help public media professionals gain the skills necessary to preserve this audiovisual historic record for posterity by supporting the American Archive of Public Broadcasting Public Broadcasting Preservation Scholarship. This scholarship will fund 7 public media professionals to gain digital preservation skills through a week-long training event taught by esteemed leaders in audiovisual digital preservation. The event itself will be recorded, preserved, and made available to the public in the American Archive of Public Broadcasting.


 

The Time is Now

The American Archive of Public Broadcasting (AAPB) has embarked on a project to preserve for posterity significant public television and radio programs of the past 60 years. A collaboration between WGBH Educational Foundation and the Library of Congress, the AAPB has digitized 40,000 hours of material from more than 100 public media organizations across the country. These materials are preserved at the Library of Congress and made available to researchers online at americanarchive.org. 

But the 40,000 hours is only a drop in the bucket.

Right now, analog video and audio content is deteriorating before our eyes. Stored on obsolete magnetic media formats such as 2" and 1" videotape, this audiovisual documentation of our 20th century is at risk of being lost forever. Experts in the field of moving image and sound preservation are in consensus that we have no more than 12 years, and likely less, to digitally preserve analog recordings before they are lost forever.

Just as vulnerable as analog media are new productions that are created digitally. Managing content that is "born digital" is expensive and requires specific training in digital preservation. By providing training, we can prevent the loss of current productions in the future. The time to intervene is now.

Public broadcasting has managed to establish itself as a national treasure. . . . Millions now watch and hear, applaud, and criticize a unique public institution which daily enters their homes with programs that inform, engage, enlighten, and delight.

--A Public Trust: The Report of the Carnegie Commission on the Future of Public Broadcasting (1979)

Training public media professionals in digital preservation is key to ensuring that this rich source for American political, social, and cultural history and creativity will be saved and made available once again to future generations. To this end, WGBH is asking for funds to support the Public Broadcasting Preservation Scholarship.


The Institute of Museum and Library Services has generously funded the American Archive of Public Broadcasting National Digital Stewardship Residency (NDSR) which supports seven 10-month post-master's residencies at public media organizations. The Public Broadcasting Preservation Scholarships will enable us to train staff at the host organizations alongside NDSR residents, ensuring the long-term sustainability of knowledge at host organizations beyond the term of the residencies.

In February, we announced that after some very difficult decision-making among 24 project proposals, we selected the Host Institutions for the NDSR project.

The seven public media organizations that will be hosting residents for the 2016-17 Residency are:

More information about each host is available on our website:

  • CUNY TV - New York, New York
  • Louisiana Public Broadcasting - Baton Rouge, Louisiana
  • Minnesota Public Radio - Saint Paul, Minnesota
  • Pacifica Radio Archives - North Hollywood, California
  • Howard University Television (WHUT) - Washington, D.C.
  • Wisconsin Public Television - Madison, Wisconsin
  • WYSO - Yellow Springs, Ohio

Spanning the country from New York to California, each of these organizations has designed an impactful and engaging archival project for the resident to complete over the ten-month residency that will allow the residents to gain valuable skills in their archival careers, while also providing a long-term benefit to the host institution. The projects encompass analog digitization, digital media migration, metadata management, workflow design, coding and perceptual hashing, and more.

To learn more about the organizations and their projects, visit theAAPB NDSR Hosts page on the NDSR project website.

The Public Broadcasting Preservation Scholarship will enable seven public media organizations to participate in a week-long immersion training to improve knowledge and build capacity for stations to effectively preserve their collections for future generations of public media fans. WGBH will coordinate with leaders in the community to host a week-long in-person training event and a variety of webinars over the course of 10 months focusing on specific skills and tools, all of which will be recorded and made freely available to the larger community.

Education, Training and Advocacy

If the project is funded, seven representatives from public media organizations will receive hands-on training and educational opportunities focused on audiovisual digital preservation, building a network of knowledge and capacity to digitally preserve stations' production archives. Recordings of these events will be made available to the broader public media community.

Through the Scholarship, we will:

  • Bring passionate public media professionals to a week-long training event in Boston, taught by esteemed leaders in the field of digital preservation
  • Provide continuing education through webinars focusing on specific skills and tools related to audiovisual preservation, which will be made freely available to the community and funders.

Project Costs

We think that educating public media professionals is key to ensuring the long-term preservation and access of the history documented by public media. We're committed to putting in the time and resources to make sure it's done right. The $16,275 will be spent on airfare and accommodations for the scholarship recipients. WGBH and IMLS funds will cover the the instructors, instructor travel, project management and event coordination, as well as the training venue.

The Perks of Funding the Scholarship

Of course, the biggest perk of helping us educate public media professionals in the best practices of digital preservation is knowing that the knowledge gained through the project will contribute to the assurance that local history is preserved and made available for generations to come. But we'd like to give you more than that.

In exchange for your support, we want to give you an opportunity to become personally involved in the project and benefit from the educational opportunities. Needless to say, everyone needs to be able to personally manage and preserve their own archival materials -- from home movies to digital photographs and personal records. Check out the perks to see how you might gain skills in personal digital archiving. You could also get a personal archiving consultation with a professional moving image archivist on staff at WGBH or have your home movies digitized by WGBH. There are other cool perks, too. Check out the full list and decide what best fits your budget.

Experts in the Field

The event will be taught by leading experts in the field of digital moving image and sound preservation, including:

Nancy McGovern
Nancy Y. McGovern is responsible for digital preservation at MIT Libraries and directs the Digital Preservation Management (DPM) workshop series. She has almost thirty years of experience with preserving digital content, including senior positions at ICPSR; Cornell University Library; the Open Society Archives; and the Center for Electronic Records of the U.S. National Archives. In 2015, she was elected Vice President/President-elect of SAA. 


Rachel Curtis
Rachel Curtis works as a Digital Conversion Specialist at the Library of Congress coordinating the American Archive of Public Broadcasting for the Library. She previously worked at the Harley-Davidson Corporate Archives, where she worked as a project manager to digitize their audiovisual materials.

Kathryn Gronsbell
Kathryn Gronsbell is the Digital Asset Manager at Carnegie Hall Archives, where she provides administrative oversight for the digital asset management system and maintains the digital preservation, sustainability, and access strategies. 

Jacob Nadal
Jacob Nadal is the Executive Director of ReCAP, a partnership among Columbia University, The New York Public Library, and Princeton University that provides preservation storage and shared collection services for its members. 

Stephanie Sapienza
Stephanie Sapienza is a Project Manager at Maryland Institute for Technology in the Humanities (MITH) at the University of Maryland, where she coordinates and implements digital humanities research and development projects, public programs and communications. Previously she was the Project Manager for the AAPB at the Corporation for Public Broadcasting. 



At WGBH, we have a great track record of producing and distributing high quality content both locally and nationwide. Beyond the broadcast, our nationally recognized Media Library and Archives staff manages, preserves and provides access to historic content produced by the station.

WGBH Educational Foundation is America's preeminent public broadcasting producer, the source of fully one-third of PBS's prime-time lineup, along with some of public television's best-known lifestyle shows and children's programs and many public radio favorites. Its production menu is diverse, including Nova, Frontline, American Experience, Antiques Roadshow, Masterpiece Theatre, Arthur, and Postcards from Buster on PBS and The World and Sound & Spirit on public radio. WGBH is the number one producer of Web sites on pbs.org, the most-visited dot-org on the Internet. WGBH is a pioneer in educational multimedia and in technologies and services that make media accessible to the 36 million Americans who rely on captioning or video descriptions. WGBH has been recognized with hundreds of honors: Emmys, Peabodys, duPont- Columbia Awards...even two Oscars. In 2002, WGBH was honored with a special institutional Peabody Award for 50 years of excellence. For more information visit www.wgbh.org.


The WGBH Media Library and Archives (MLA) establishes the policies and procedures for access, acquisition, intellectual control, and preservation of WGBH’s physical media and digital media production and administrative resources. Today’s MLA collection constitutes over three quarters of a million production and administrative assets including film, video, audio, computer, stills and print media. The collection is extensively used by WGBH television, radio, and educational projects. The Media Library and Archives maintains collection and shot level content databases, including copyright and source details, of originally produced and acquired footage and stills. The MLA is open weekdays to academic scholars and students by appointment. Annually, between 20 to 30 scholars, students, and others arrange visits to the MLA. Currently at least 20 scholars are using the MLA collection for their scholarly work. The MLA maintains a public facing website called Open Vault (http://openvault.wgbh.org) which has had over 1 million visits since launching in 2007.

In August 2013, the Corporation for Public Broadcasting selected WGBH in collaboration with the Library of Congress as the permanent stewards of the American Archive of Public Broadcasting (AAPB), an initiative with a mission to identify, preserve, and make accessible as much as possible the historical record of public television and radio; and to coordinate a national effort to preserve at risk public media before its content is lost to posterity. To date, the American Archive team has worked with 120 stations to create 2.5 million inventory records, digitizing 40,000 hours of content from the collection, which will be preserved for future audiences at the Library of Congress. The AAPB's vision is to become a platform for developing a consortium of public media organizations focused on preserving public media's history and legacy.


Other Ways You Can Help #PreservePubMedia

We realize that not everyone can give. But you can help us spread the word! Do you think your friends might be able to support us? Or do you know a great community organization that might be willing to spread the word? Tell your friends and colleagues on Facebook or Twitter tagging #PreservePubMedia. Use the share tools on this campaign to help us meet our goal.


Tell us which PBS/NPR member stations you support!

When you make your pledge, we'd love to know which PBS/NPR member stations are in your community and which you support. If you choose to provide this information, simply add it in a comment on your pledge form. Pledgers who share this information with us agree to let AAPB share your contact info with the station(s) you list.


Is my pledge tax-deductible?

Generally speaking, Indiegogo pledges aren’t tax-deductible. (This is one reason it’s called a PLEDGE instead of a DONATION.) Since IndieGoGo projects offers reward packages in exchange for pledges, your pledge is considered to be a transaction, rather than a donation. But we hope that won’t keep you from getting involved -- even if you just pledge $5!
