and more.

To learn more about the
organizations and their projects, visit theAAPB NDSR Hosts page on the NDSR project
website.The Public Broadcasting Preservation Scholarship will enable seven public media organizations to participate in a week-long immersion training to improve knowledge and build capacity for stations to effectively preserve their collections for future generations of public media fans. WGBH will coordinate with leaders in the community to host a week-long in-person training event and a variety of webinars over the course of 10 months focusing on specific skills and tools, all of which will be recorded and made freely available to the larger community.

 
Education, Training and Advocacy

If the project is funded, seven representatives from public media organizations will receive hands-on training and educational opportunities focused on audiovisual digital preservation, building a network of knowledge and capacity to digitally preserve stations' production archives. Recordings of these events will be made available to the broader public media community.
Through the Scholarship, we will:

Bring passionate public media professionals to a week-long training event in Boston, taught by esteemed leaders in the field of digital preservation
Provide continuing education through webinars focusing on specific skills and tools related to audiovisual preservation, which will be made freely available to the community and funders.

   Project Costs
We think that educating public media professionals is key to ensuring the long-term preservation and access of the history documented by public media. We're committed to putting in the time and resources to make sure it's done right. The $16,275 will be spent on airfare and accommodations for the scholarship recipients. WGBH and IMLS funds will cover the the instructors, instructor travel, project management and event coordination, as well as the training venue.


The Perks of Funding the Scholarship

Of course, the biggest perk of helping us educate public media professionals in the best practices of digital preservation is knowing that the knowledge gained through the project will contribute to the assurance that local history is preserved and made available for generations to come. But we'd like to give you more than that.In exchange for your support, we want to give you an opportunity to become personally involved in the project and benefit from the educational opportunities. Needless to say, everyone needs to be able to personally manage and preserve their own archival materials -- from home movies to digital photographs and personal records. Check out the perks to see how you might gain skills in personal digital archiving. You could also get a personal archiving consultation with a professional moving image archivist on staff at WGBH or have your home movies digitized by WGBH. There are other cool perks, too. Check out the full list and decide what best fits your budget.    Experts in the Field
The event will be taught by leading experts in the field of digital moving image and sound preservation, including:


Nancy McGovernNancy Y. McGovern is responsible for digital preservation at MIT Libraries and directs the Digital Preservation Management (DPM) workshop series. She has almost thirty years of experience with preserving digital content, including senior positions at ICPSR; Cornell University Library; the Open Society Archives; and the Center for Electronic Records of the U.S. National Archives. In 2015, she was elected Vice President/President-elect of SAA. 


Rachel CurtisRachel Curtis works as a Digital Conversion Specialist at the Library of Congress coordinating the American Archive of Public Broadcasting for the Library. She previously worked at the Harley-Davidson Corporate Archives, where she worked as a project manager to digitize their audiovisual materials.
Kathryn GronsbellKathryn Gronsbell is the Digital Asset Manager at Carnegie Hall Archives, where she provides administrative oversight for the digital asset management system and maintains the digital preservation, sustainability, and access strategies. 
Jacob NadalJacob Nadal is the Executive Director of ReCAP, a partnership among Columbia University, The New York Public Library, and Princeton University that provides preservation storage and shared collection services for its members. 
Stephanie SapienzaStephanie Sapienza is a Project Manager at Maryland Institute for Technology in the Humanities (MITH) at the University of Maryland, where she coordinates and implements digital humanities research and development projects, public programs and communications. Previously she was the Project Manager for the AAPB at the Corporation for Public Broadcasting. 


At WGBH, we have a great track record of producing and distributing high quality content both locally and nationwide. Beyond the broadcast, our nationally recognized Media Library and Archives staff manages, preserves and provides access to historic content produced by the station.WGBH
Educational Foundation is
America's preeminent public broadcasting producer, the source of fully
one-third of PBS's prime-time lineup, along with some of public television's
best-known lifestyle shows and children's programs and many public radio
favorites. Its production menu is diverse, including Nova, Frontline, American
Experience, Antiques Roadshow, Masterpiece Theatre, Arthur, and Postcards from
Buster on PBS and The World and Sound & Spirit on public radio. WGBH is the
number one producer of Web sites on pbs.org, the most-visited dot-org on the
Internet. WGBH is a pioneer in educational multimedia and in technologies and
services that make media accessible to the 36 million Americans who rely on
captioning or video descriptions. WGBH has been recognized with hundreds of honors:
Emmys, Peabodys, duPont- Columbia Awards...even two Oscars. In 2002, WGBH was
honored with a special institutional Peabody Award for 50 years of excellence.
For more information visit www.wgbh.org.
The
WGBH Media Library and Archives (MLA) establishes
the policies and procedures for access, acquisition, intellectual control, and
preservation of WGBH’s physical media and digital media production and
administrative resources. Today’s MLA collection constitutes over three
quarters of a million production and administrative assets including film,
video, audio, computer, stills and print media. The collection is extensively
used by WGBH television, radio, and educational projects. The Media Library and
Archives maintains collection and shot level content databases, including
copyright and source details, of originally produced and acquired footage and
stills. The MLA is open weekdays to academic scholars and students by
appointment. Annually, between 20 to 30 scholars, students, and others arrange
visits to the MLA. Currently at least 20 scholars are using the MLA collection
for their scholarly work. The MLA maintains a public facing website called Open
Vault (http://openvault.wgbh.org) which has had
over 1 million visits since launching in 2007.


In August 2013,
the Corporation for Public Broadcasting selected WGBH in collaboration with the
Library of Congress as the permanent stewards of the American Archive of
Public Broadcasting (AAPB), an initiative with a mission to identify,
preserve, and make accessible as much as possible the historical record of
public television and radio; and to coordinate a national effort to preserve at
risk public media before its content is lost to posterity. To date, the
American Archive team has worked with 120 stations to create 2.5 million
inventory records, digitizing 40,000 hours of content from the collection,
which will be preserved for future audiences at the Library of Congress. The AAPB's vision is to become a
platform for developing a consortium of public media organizations focused on
preserving public media's history and legacy. 

  
Other Ways You Can Help #PreservePubMedia
We realize that not everyone can give. But you can help us spread the word! Do you think your friends might be able to support us? Or do you know a great community organization that might be willing to spread the word? Tell your friends and colleagues on Facebook or Twitter tagging #PreservePubMedia. Use the share tools on this campaign to help us meet our goal.



Tell us which PBS/NPR member stations
you support!
When
you make your pledge, we'd love to know which PBS/NPR member stations are in
your community and which you support. If you choose to provide this
information, simply add it in a comment on your pledge form. Pledgers who share
this information with us agree to let AAPB share your contact info with the
station(s) you list.


Is my pledge tax-deductible?
Generally speaking, Indiegogo pledges aren’t
tax-deductible. (This is one reason it’s called a PLEDGE instead of a DONATION.)
Since IndieGoGo projects offers reward packages in exchange for pledges, your
pledge is considered to be a transaction, rather than a donation. But we hope
that won’t keep you from getting involved -- even if you just pledge $5!

story:
The purpose of this insightful publication is to supply hospitals, hospices and special care medical facilities around the world with thought-provoking observations that flips the deadly script on devastating diseases into compassionate possibilities to love more meaningfully, based on the once-in-a-lifetime beauty of being present in the remaining moments - be it only days, or for the next few enduring decades.

This enlightening new book by nationally recognized poet/educator Erik Cork is a non-stop series of positive ambers of affirmations birthed from the flames of blazing agony, burning anguish and bright hope.

The Healing Hope of Cancer celebrates minor and major miracles along someone's journey of pain and life-defining discoveries.  It is uniquely designed from cover-to-cover to inspire and speak directly to family and friends challenged by the calamities caused by cancer and other debilitating diseases.  Each page is a pillar of hope for those who are emotionally impacted as they are patiently and prayerfully surrounding those who are presently suffering.  This book is a refreshing reminder and a soothing testament to those who continue to triumphantly thrive and victoriously survive.  Each new day is always the best time to give, as well as to inhale, the sweet aroma of fresh flowers while everyone is still very much alive to appreciate the process of sharing and caring in the here and now.

story:
Former Peace Corps volunteers Tarché Collins and Johnice Moore welcome you to their fundraiser for the Anne Fowler Bilingual School (www.annefowlerbilingualschool.weebly.com) . They met the school’s founder, Iris Carranza, during our Honduran assignment and are excited to have an opportunity to support this amazing woman and the growth of her school. 

The Anne Fowler Bilingual School’s program evolved from a true passion to empower the youth of Honduras by providing an opportunity for a quality education. The Honduran public school system is overcrowded, lacking in basic supplies, and plagued by frequent lengthy teacher’s strikes. 

To continue our mission for quality education, we will use your donation to build a reading room equipped with books, e-readers, and downloaded educational games. In addition, a culinary center will be created where students can learn the importance of nutrition and how to cook basic meals and snacks, incorporating food they’ve grown in the school garden.

Tarché and Johnice will actively oversee this fund raising project both online and on the ground in Honduras. Parents and the community will be engaged to help with construction-involvement that is important to sustaining the school’s future. 

                        

Our Need & Our Appreciation

In the spirit of transparency, here is a breakdown of what your donation will provide. All donations will be collected by Tarché.  This site is secured  through Better Business Bureau and Trust-e, you can find out more on their services by clicking on their icon below.  There are two ways you can donate: via credit card or paypal. 

Tarché and Johnice will head to La Union in August to hand-deliver the funds to Iris. All donors (if you provide your email) will receive a video showing the presentation of the check to Iris, staff, and students. Tarché will remain in Honduras to help build the Reading Room and the Culinary Center.

 The Reading Room Goal: $1,500

This donation will go towards developing a reading room equipped with Wi-Fi which will provide continuous access to updated reading books and educational games for the students at their respective grade levels. Although we love book donations they are costly to ship, and sometimes they are not grade appropriate or current for the students.

 The Culinary Center Goal: $3,500

This donation will go towards constructing a culinary center and garden that will provide an opportunity for students to learn about good nutrition and how to incorporate the vegetables they have grown into healthy meals. The culinary center will also double as a cafeteria where students will be provided with nutritious snacks and meals.

We appreciate all of your support for our projects. You will be helping 38+ students reach their potential to become whatever they want to be and not be stifled by inadequate education and lack of opportunities.

The Impact

We are all VERY passionate about this project and its potential to change the lives of the students, their families, the community,  and the country of Honduras.

As we grow, there will be additional opportunities to service more children in the community. We started with a dream, donated land, and eager kindergartners. Now those eager kindergartners are going into the third grade this fall. Their continued development has caught the attention of every parent in the community looking to provide a better future for their children. We are growing, and with your help we will be able to continue to provide opportunities for all our youth in the community.

Other Ways You Can Help

We recognize that some people just can’t contribute monetarily, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help! Spread the word about our project and make some noise about our campaign. If you have a Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, or LinkedIn account, you can post our link and encourage people to donate.

  • Peace Corps Volunteers. Please spread the word across our networks to friends and family!!!!
  • Please check out Indiegogo share tools located on this page to share on Facebook, Twitter, etc!!!

                                                                             

                                                  


Meet the team


Iris Carranza

Born in Honduras, upon completion of high school Iris moved to the city of San Pedro Sula where she worked as a bilingual secretary. Always goal-oriented she finished her university certification to teach English and began English instruction for members of the La Union community. Iris also taught high school English and was instrumental in establishing a free English program for El Porvenir’s elementary school students. But her dream was to establish an affordable government-certified bilingual school for the children of La Union. In 2012, she opened the Anne Fowler Bilingual School with 12 kindergarten students and the school has since grown a grade each year. Iris is an outstanding educator and to her 9 year old daughter Andrea, she is  a wonderful parental role model.


Anne Fowler

Canadian Anne Fowler has lived in Honduras since retiring in 2000 from the Toronto based human resources firm that she founded. During a medical mission trip to Honduras in 1993, Anne fell in love with both the country and its people. She vowed to return and try to “make a difference.” Since moving there she has developed many community programs such as health education, small business development for women, building a school library, and establishing a free program teaching English to both children and adults. To see the scope of her work, please go to www.anne.honduranhope.net.


Tarché Collins

From 2007-2009, I served as a Business Development volunteer in San Francisco, Atlántida, Honduras. I worked with women’s cooperative groups, youth empowerment groups, and the mayor’s office on economic development projects. As part of our work, we partnered with nearby Peace Corp volunteers to give support on their projects. I met Iris Carranza and Anne Fowler, Johnice’s Peace Corps partner, while assisting Johnice with a Healthy Living Education project in La Union Atlántida (next community north of San Francisco). Since my departure, Iris and Anne have made strides in developing projects to inspire and promote economic self-sufficiency despite the barriers of violence, lack of economic opportunity, and reliable funding.  I often return to Honduras to support new projects and following up on projects that I worked on during my Peace Corps service.


Johnice Moore

My name is Johnice Moore, and from 2006-2008 I was a Peace Corps Municipal Development volunteer in the Honduran municipality of El Porvenir, Atlántida. I am from Durham, NC and moved to Anderson, SC after I married my wonderful husband, Marcus. Tarché Collins is a fellow returned Peace Corp volunteer I had the pleasure of meeting when she was posted in San Francisco. I was introduced to Anne Fowler at the municipality office after a co–worker asked me to translate for them. I met Iris Carranza during a Healthy Living Education puppet presentation at a local elementary school. We soon became good friends and I was often welcomed into her family’s home where she had set up a room to hold English classes. At one point, I lived in Iris’ El Porvenir house. Anne Fowler and Iris Carranza are an unstoppable duo who through education are changing lives on the north coast and I am happy to call them my friends!

story:
Short Summary

Hello, citizens of the world! We are a group of international culture enthusiasts here at The KORUS Foundation - San Francisco. KORUS (Korea - US) is a pending non-profit that promotes the exchange of art, ideas, and culture between Korea and America. Our mission is to foster mutual understanding and enhanced cultural cooperation between the two nations. We'll do this every Summer by hosting a free Korean culture festival! Mark your calendars for July 11th, 2015... Our first KFest event is just around the corner! We are here on Indiegogo because we want to make this event free and open to the public.

With the support of the Consulate General of South Korea and varying sponsors, we have the means of hosting the preliminaries to the international KPOP World Festival competition, with later rounds publicized on KBS TV. This international competition is The Korean Ministry of Foreign Affair's event that brings finalists to compete in Changwon, South Korea in October. But with a little extra help from supporters like you, we can turn this KPOP competition into a full fledged Korean music, media, & culture festival with street food, a variety of bands, and more! 


Where Funds Go

Read the perks on the right of the page! With the funds we receive on Indiegogo, we will be able to hire more local bands, rent quality audio-visual gear, draw more eateries, rent more photobooths, and make the culture booths more comfortable.

If we DO NOT reach our entire goal, the festival will still exist, but at a smaller scale....Better luck next year! If we DO reach our goal, Golden Gate Park will be filled with scents of Kalbi BBQ and other Korean street foods that you crave, miss, or have never experienced before. We will fill the air with music of a soulful and rapidly-developing nation, ranging from Korean traditional, to indie, to KPOP. Learn to write in Korean and make kimchi. See Taekwondo demonstrations, and enjoy Hanbok photobooths. While the kids enjoy the festivities, check out the Business Convergence tent for idea sharing and networking with some of the Bay Area's foremost thinkers and entrepreneurs.


The Impact

San Francisco is one of the most historic American cities for the Korean Community, as the first Korean-American diplomatic project, first Korean-American newsletter, and first Korean-American monument were all established in SF. Now that many other American cities have KFest events, we feel that KFest San Francisco will bring the journey full circle. 

As Korea increasingly permeates popular TV/film, music, technology, and food, we can ride this "Hallyu: Korean Wave" toward learning more about this ancient yet leading edge country. It is important for us to get familiar with Korean culture, its artists, thinkers and people not only because Korea has opened itself to the world more recently than other Asian countries, but also because Korean society, policy & economics are increasingly influential, affecting us here in America. We'd like to shine a light on the mystery that surrounds Korea, in a celebratory and interactive way. So on July 11th, come KFest with us!

Risks & Challenges

We are a small organization and we wear many hats. On top of that, time is ticking. However, we already have the means to creating a satisfactory event! So the aim of this Indiegogo is take KFest SF to a whole other level! ...And for that we need you! We are passionate to making this event something San Francisco and neighboring cities can enjoy together. In the warm SF spirit of cultural sharing, acceptance and respect, PLEASE JOIN US!

story:
Hello  Everyone,  We are back with our new campaign. We appreciate the contributions you made towards our last campaign .https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/helping-orphans-with-school-desks/x/7449235.We will very much appreciate that you share and support in this campaign as well. Thank you very much!

Helping Orphans with New Uniforms and School Bags..

Launching a new campaign for needed funds for providing new uniforms and school bags and other needs for the kids  for the academic year 2015-16 for our orphanage, Sharon Children Home in India.  Sharon Children Home is not supported by grants or governmental aid.  They are solely dependent on donations from compassionate organizations and individuals like you and me.  The home exists to care for abandoned children who have no recourse but to live in the streets and survive from the refuls of trash dumps.  Sharon strives to mentor these children and educate them to be productive citizens of society. This orphanage houses and cares for 60 children who have an immediate need for New uniforms and school bags   $1500 is the total needed for the requirement.   Your donations would be appreciated in helping these children to grow in knowledge for their roles in society. 

Sharon Children Home is  not supported from the government or any other organizations and we  have to rely on ourselves in getting support to improve the orphanage.We are solely dependent on donations from compassionate organizations and individuals like you.Thank you Very Much !
story_txt: Hello  Everyone,  We are back with our new campaign. We appreciate the contributions you made towards our last campaign .https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/helping-orphans-with-school-desks/x/7449235.We will very much appreciate that you share and support in this campaign as well. Thank you very much!Helping Orphans with New Uniforms and School Bags..Launching a new campaign for needed funds for providing new uniforms and school bags and other needs for the kids  for the academic year 2015-16 for our orphanage, Sharon Children Home in India.  Sharon Children Home is not supported by grants or governmental aid.  They are solely dependent on donations from compassionate organizations and individuals like you and me.  The home exists to care for abandoned children who have no recourse but to live in the streets and survive from the refuls of trash dumps.  Sharon strives to mentor these children and educate them to be productive citizens of society. This orphanage houses and cares for 60 children who have an immediate need for New uniforms and school bags   $1500 is the total needed for the requirement.   Your donations would be appreciated in helping these children to grow in knowledge for their roles in society. Sharon Children Home is  not supported from the government or any other organizations and we  have to rely on ourselves in getting support to improve the orphanage.We are solely dependent on donations from compassionate organizations and individuals like you.Thank you Very Much !

story:
The Oregon Electric Railway Museum , the largest Trolley Museum in the Pacific Northwest, has received a collection of nine Brussels Trams (#BelgiumTrams). These cars need temporary protection from the elements until a new Carbarn can be built to permanently house this impressive collection. The Tram cars range in age from 63-80+ years old. They include passenger trams as well trams used to maintain the system.

The following video gives an idea of trams in Brussels, including their tram museum:


As you may know, Oregon is noted for rain for most of the year. Anything left outside needs to be covered to protect it. Tarps, however, can cause more damage long term keeping moisture in. The solution is what we call a Trolley Koozie. Basically it is all-weather protection that will drape around the car to protect them form the rain, and allow them to"breathe". The trucking industry calls them "Toaster Covers". This will prevent further deterioration until a suitable building is built within the next 5 years. Here is an example of what it looks like:

The material we are considering is made of Armorlon. It is a lower cost alternative that will help protect the cars long enough for us to build the new carbarn. We will build a structure around the car and place the Armorlon over the structure. This will allow the car to breath and keep moisture from accumulating under the tarp.

What We Need & What You Get

The Museum is looking at a full project cost of about $15,000. This crowd sourcing fundraiser is looking to raise $6,000 so we can go after matching grants and other more traditional sources of fundraising. For $6,000 we can cover about 3-4 cars.

We want to be able to cover as many cars as possible before the Oregon world renowned rains start in October. So this is time critical. These are the cars we are working to save:

More information can be found about these cars on our website.
 

To encourage you donations to this project we are offering various rewards based on contribution levels

Ticket Agent: Your name will go on our website as a thank you for contributing to protecting our Brussels Collections from the weather.

Track Worker: Your name will appear on the OERHS website as well as on a list of contributors on a Car Card that will be placed inside our operating Trolley Cars at the museum

Conductor:  You will receive your name listed as stated in the previous awards. In addition your name will be added onto a Brick Paver on our Trolley Platform in front of the Museum's Interpretive Center, also called Hopmere Station. You will also receive an honorary one year Active Membership to the museum.

Motorman: All the above perks, plus your choice of an additional Brick Paver, maybe with your place of business, or free advertising car cards in each of our operating streetcars at the Museum and the Willamette Shore Trolley. You will also receive an honorary one year Family Membership to the Museum.

Traction Mogul: This level would allow the building of a permanent carbarn to house the Brussels tram collection. The carbarn would be named in your honor. You will also receive a lifetime membership to the OERHS.

Challenges

As with anything there are challenges, if we do not get the car covered before the rains start in late October, we will need to leave the cars un-covered for the winter due to fear of trapping too much moisture before covering them. The covers will then need to be installed next season. If we do not raise enough money, the alternative plan is to simply tarp the cars, but obviously that is not ideal.

OERHS History with Major Projects

The OERHS does have a track record of taking on major projects. The group was founded in 1957, We built a museum in Glenwood, Oregon in the Coast Range mountains outside of Portland. In 1995 the museum needed to move due to a land sale. The entire trolley collection was moved to Antique Powerland. We had to build a new museum from scratch. We completed building 2 miles of track and overhead, a carbarn and have recently completed a Interpretive Center, called Hopemere Station.  

The following Youtube Playlist was made for the OERHS 50th anniversary showing the old museum, the move and building the new museum. Since this video we have built Hopmere station.


Here is our latest project we recently completed, our new Interpretive Center we have named Hopmere Station:

Hopmere Station is built based on actual blueprints of a Southern Pacific standard 2 level station with attached freight house. The Freight House will house interpretive exhibits. The main downstairs portion houses a ticket office, gift shop and library. The upstairs is a caretakers apartment. The name Hopmere is taken from the Oregon Electric Station that was just down the road from Antique Powerland.
So we aren't afraid of doing big projects, we just need funding and volunteers to help make them come to fruition.
We believe we were chosen to receive these cars because of our track record. We are also the largest trolley museum in the Pacific Northwest, which is close to were they were being stored. Therefore our museum offers a real chance for these cars to operate again on our trolley line.
Our museum as stated is located on the grounds of Antique Powerland. It contains several other museums from steam tractors to antique trucks and automobiles. There is an Annual Steam-Up held two weekends a year that brings in nearly 30,000 guests to the facility, and it is a major revenue driver not just for Powerland, but also our trolley line.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help donate funds there are other opportunities.  First off, share this funding campaign on Facebook, and other social media websites. Use the hashtag #Belgiumtrams if possible on any social media platform you use. Also consider forwarding this to friends who you know love trains, trolleys, or have an attachment to Belgium. 

If you are in Portland or the Willamette Valley, consider volunteering at the museum or on the Willamette Shore Trolley. We are always in need of Operators, Conductors, mechanics, restorers, etc....

Thanks for considering our campaign.

story:
Take a step on the path of empathy today.

Donate your coffee, bus ticket or whatever you can spare today and help Huika build a school in Tanzania. Huika is a charity organization started in Denmark by two young people with a passion to spread global empathy. 


Tumaini Mission Trust School

Huika is an organization based upon deep philosophical thoughts about acknowledging reality and global empathy. We work with this term both in Denmark and in Tanzania where we are currently fundraising for the completion of the idealistic nursery and primary school Tumaini Mission Trust School representing a role model for other school institutions in Tanzania. The school is located a little north of Arusha in a small village with 200 pupils of which 50% consists of children from families at risk, whose school are payed for through sponsors. The education level on the school is high, with english medium, the teacher team is loving, caring and engaged and the female principal has a big heart, pumping for the future of the children and their role in the future of the country.

Check out the website we made for the school, when we visited and worked their for a couple of months on:


 www.tumainimissiontrustschool.com


What we need & what you get

 By helping us completing this school YOU can change the life of others, helping Tanzania to become a self sustainable, peaceful country filled with an educated youth generation ready to establish a safe fundament for generations to come. 

We are currently missing 4 class rooms on the school, with a new class already being without a classroom in august, so every single coin counts! We will start the construction as soon as the funds make it possible. Every single donation will go directly to the construction, with no administration fees since we have big hearted volunteer co-operators in Tanzania and Huika is a 100 % non-profit charity organisation, run solely by volunteer manpower. We will build as much as we can, and we will not give up fundraising, until the whole school stands complete as a light in the dark.
You can be engaged in our Huika community where you can play a part in trying to create a world with humanity. You can also read the magazine connected to Huika called Regnfang, where young people write about subjects with substance in the attempt to increase the reality for other young people, making everyone embrace more of the world and the people in it. Find the magazine online on:

www.regnfang.com 

The Impact

Once completed we will:
Be able to give access for 200 children of the small village to attend a high level english medium nursery and primary school, giving them the best possible backpack to meet the challenges of their own country in the future. 
Half of these children's school fees will be sponsored, giving children from families at risk a great opportunity to break their social heritage. 
The school will stand as a great example of how a good education filled with love, care and understanding creates loving, caring and wise students ready to embrace the problems their country are facing.

Risk & challenges

The only challenge will be to fund the construction in time for the new class to start this summer. We will keep fundraising until the school is finished and every coin will become one brick more in the walls. 

Other ways you can help

Check out our website for the organization Huika to read more about our vision.  If you are unable to support the project with economic funds, you can also become active in our empathic revolution by becoming a member of Huika - for free -  on:


 www.huika.dk 


THANK YOU!

story:
17th June 2015

We have just arrived in the Aspire orphanage in Siem Reap where we will be teaching and helping out for the next few weeks.

To say we are overwhelmed is an understatement! Sean Samnang lives here with his wife, mother and two children. He has been giving a home to orphaned children for more than ten years and at present has 30 children in his care. Sean plans to build a school and with donations has already built the ground floor but has no money to finish or furnish it.

Vegetables were planted but a searing heatwave killed many plants. There are chickens and geese but until a good flock is established the cost of feed is high. A donation of a large fishpond has great potential but takes another 10 months for the fish to grow big enough to eat - in the meantime they need to be fed every day...

Cambodia is extremely poor and many people struggle to find food every day. As I write this there are 5 bags of rice left in the kitchen - Sean has $30 to his name and owes over $300 for rice he has already received.

Sean needs help...see below for approx costs.

30 chickens and feed for 1 year $50

A 10 Kg bag of rice feeds the children for a day and costs $25

A mature fruit tree costs $10

Bag of mixed vedge seeds and fertiliser $30

If you would like to help Sean and his family to produce their own food please donate on paypal :  lorna7575@gmail.com

If you would like to do a bit more, for example help financially with building the school, sponsor a child or come and volunteer, please check out Aspire at www.aspirecambodia-edu.org. and email Sean directly.

We have just donated $500 for the purchase of 8 solid wooden doors for the new school and it is very exciting to be part of this wonderful project (see website)

PLEASE SHARE TO HELP ASPIRE' S BEAUTIFUL CHILDREN

story:
About the Work and its Author

At the site of the immunization against Chickenpox appeared a subcutaneous lump. And a story was once published about a girl in Scotland who had such a lump, and who also fell in a pit – a pit which pulled her 200 years back in time. When the locals noticed the raised bump they were convinced that a demon was hiding inside the swelling…

That was the way the Scots thought 200 years ago…so it shouldn't be too hard to guess the status of human comprehension 1000 years ago…

Therefore, regarding the Bible – for which 3000 year old archaeological proof of what is written was recently discovered – it obviously created a need for innumerable interpretations that were suited to the intellectual abilities of people living during the different periods after its dissemination - in the aftermath of many battles and revolutions worldwide, the interpretations of the Bible underwent far-reaching upheavals.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              The "Enlightenment" moment that commenced about 250 years ago lead to contradictory changes in the way the  world looked at religion in general, and specifically at the ways Bible and other religious texts were viewed. The more progressive among the populace reacted by separating State and Religion, and the less progressive dug their heels in and held fast to religion – remaining essentially frozen in time.

There is no doubt that if King Solomon – the wisest man of all, according to Jewish tradition – was alive today, he would produce an interpretation that applied to the world today, while including all the values of the past…

One of King Solomon's descendants, who goes by the name of Ben Solomon (son of Solomon) has taken upon himself to fulfill this task, to write a new interpretation of the Bible. While his interpretation will not stray even a millimeter from the inherent ideas conveyed in the original text, it will integrate the past with the future, and provide answers for anyone who questions or researches using the thinking patterns and intelligence of a man living in the modern world today.

In other words: An interpretation which will return the Bible to its place of prominence in every man's personal library, and more important – to its place of respect in every man's mind. It will serve as a useful tool, as a source of ideas and information for anyone at all who studies it.

There is no doubt that this is a grandiose project by any standards, and one which demands reasonable proof of its feasibility before any request for public funding can be made. The prospectus, if you will, for this tremendous project is attached.


What We Do

* Research and Writing

* Editing and  Pagination

* Translation to as many languages as possible   

* Distribution - world wide 

Here is a one page actual example from the project and after that the Introduction and prospectus of the Project 


2.  Divine Supervision, or in other words: Heavenly Intervention.

The previous chapter ended with the expulsion of man from the Garden of Eden. But it was only natural that the Divine supervision or instruction continued in man’s new home on Earth. As the Bible tells us in Genesis 6, verses 2: “And the sons of God saw the daughters of man when they were beautifying themselves, and they took for themselves wives from whomever they chose.” The type of love between man and God is not unique to this “story”. This style repeats itself, with words that are even more erotic in the Song of Songs: 1. The Song of Songs, which is Solomon's.  2. Let him kiss me with the kisses of his mouth, for your love is better than wine. 3. Because of the fragrance of your goodly oils, your name is 'oil poured forth.' Therefore, the maidens loved you...” And there, as in the previous example, the Bible describes the lofty emotions of satisfaction (and confidence) that man experiences when he senses that God is supporting him or standing behind him in everything he does.

But like every good thing, the instruction also came to an end, and man became totally independent as a dominant presence on Earth.  Independence that could of course never be possible with continued instruction, or even with any sort of Heavenly involvement.  This does not resemble the interaction between father and son, where the instruction and mentoring can continue for a lifetime – for a son’s rejection of his father (something which is quite common…) is nothing like man’s rejection of God. That is to say: Man can make decisions about his life as an independent entity, only if the relationship is completely severed. As it is written in Genesis 6, verse 3: And the Lord said, "Let My spirit not quarrel forever concerning man, because he is also flesh…” Perhaps at first glance this sounds cruel, but in fact – from here on out there is no more Godly mentor and/or Godly protection or supervision over man on Earth, which destined to transform into the wished or dreamed of world for future mankind. And meanwhile, he must take his fate in his hands, within the limitations also defined in Psalm 115, verse 16: The heavens are heavens of the Lord, but the earth He gave to the children of men.

And indeed, disengaging man from Heavenly supervision requires of him to take full control of his life. However, man’s wisdom rapidly and quite naturally led him to feed his desires for possession and mastery, and intensified those desires a thousand fold. Man’s dominance and simultaneous acts enslavement became the central means of meeting his own needs, which constantly increased. And with appetite there must come sustenance. In other words, the strongest ruled, oppressed, robbed, and killed the weakest. As it is written in Genesis 6, verse 5: And the Lord saw that the evil of man was great in the earth, and every imagination of his heart was only evil all the time. So there was no other option but to bring a Flood upon the world.

Over the course of history we have seen many examples of  “the evil of man was great”, due to ignorance, due to the desire to control and conquer, and even due to the mental illness of leaders. So why is that that “the evil of man was great” we are dealing with was sentenced with a Flood?

The contiguity between the disengagement of Heavenly supervision from and “the evil of man was great” (just one verse later) is the key to understanding this issue. The continuation of man’s enslavement to Divine supervision/protection, even after the official detachment – constitutes until this day the reason for oppression, robbery, and killing in the world – and it is all “authorized and permitted”!

For even those who believe – as is the case with all people everywhere – have needs. But today we realize that what we need doesn’t drop out of the sky. So evil deeds are committed with the permission of “God”, and there is no way to stop them other than to wipe out an entire generation (like the Flood generation).

And we can actually see for ourselves that all of the evils mentioned above that man committed in the world have decreased in scope and number in the world, except for those evil acts committed with “God’s permission” – and they are only increasing. And all of those acts are rooted in blind subservience to a God that promises – as something that goes without saying – his supervision and protection. But in the end, it all brings a Flood upon the world.


Introduction and prospectus of the Project 

Nobody will dispute that the Jewish Nation is an extraordinary phenomenon in the history of the world. And what is particularly amazing is the Jewish Nation’s ability to survive for three thousand, five hundred years, particularly when for two thousand of those years they were scattered all over the globe - among nations that tried to force them to forfeit their religion, among nations that ultimately expelled the Jews from their homes, attacked them in pogroms, habitually murdered, robbed, and plundered them, and imposed upon them exorbitant taxes and fines.

Along with this incredible ability to survive comes the fact that 24.5% of the scientists who won the Noble Prizes (not including Noble Peace Prizes) are Jews, while Jews only account for 0.2% of the entire world population. That means that relative to the world population, for every 100 Jews who won prizes, only one non-Jew won a prize!

And rumor has it around the globe, that the distribution of wealth among Jews is even proportionally higher than the number of Nobel Prize winners, to the point where no small number of people fantasize that the Jews control the world…

But in any case, what is most impressive is the fact that wherever the Jews ended up in the Diaspora, they quickly integrated into the most prestigious cultural and economic social domains and became an influential force – if not the most influential force – relative to their proportional representation in the general population.

In this book we will determine whether these phenomena are part of the general plan for the creation of man with regard to the most important stage of his development: improving his ability to think independently, which is in fact man’s main goal in the world – and also the correct way to achieve true happiness as humans.

Unlike what was acceptable in the past, this book was written using an approach and language style that can be comprehensible to every person. Concepts and perceptions that have evolved from human development in our own times are also included. And if you ask what value today's miniscule accumulation of knowledge has opposite the insights originating in the great minds of the past, we will quote one of the sages from long ago: "If a dwarf is placed on the shoulders of a giant, who sees farther? Surely the dwarf! For the eyes of the dwarf are now higher than the eyes of the giant. So too, we are dwarfs astride the shoulders of giants…" Rabbi Yeshaya bar Mali, Di Trani, the "Rid" (1180 – 1250), one of the greatest scholars of his time (and among the greatest of the "Rishonim" among Jewish commentators).

The Bible is the most famous and most widely disseminated creation in the world, and has served (and still serves) as the basis for the three monotheistic religions, that all believe in one God, and in fact in the same God. And the followers of these religions, who account for nearly half of the world's population, each in turn claims to have found the best way to achieving happiness in life on earth, and even more importantly, to achieving happiness in the World to Come.

It's true that as time passed, these religions (Judaism, Christianity, and Islam) produced a few moredenominations, and each denomination interprets or understandsthe holy writings slightly (or extremely) differently. In recent times, university professors have discovered countless examples that disprove things written in the holy texts.

This book will be earthshaking for people on both ends of the spectrum, in that it will also challenge the authenticity of the Bible. Due to the proliferation of so many theories, interpretations, holy wars, and the building of personal careers, the main idea inherent in the Bible has gotten lost by the wayside.

Different theories developed as a result of the widening gap between the established interpretations of the early scholars, which were considered immutable, and the evolving reality. That contradicts what is written in the Bible (to be explained later), and even goes against the aforementioned quoted essay, by the "RID", and even what other scholars wrote even later on.

If we ignore for a moment the classic interpretations, we will discover that the Bible is not a religious text at all, but rather contains a continuum of narrative, educational methods, and iron-clad rules, all with the purpose of guiding and instructing man on how to create an environment conducive to developing independent thinking!

The narrative in the Bible is a way of transmitting messages to man, and the main characteristic of the narrative is its uncompromising preservation of man's right to free will, that is part of his very essence. And in fact, the first "story" that appears in the Bible, after the breakneck description of Creation itself, is the text describing how free choice was first awarded to man (Genesis 3, verses 1-7). In this story, which takes place in the Garden of Eden, the Creator forbids man from eating fruit from the Tree of Knowledge. But he doesn't actually prevent man from committing that transgression, and eating from the forbidden fruit. It's clear that if the Creator did not want to give man the freedom of choice (to receive wisdom), it never would have happened. And it's also clear that this was not a case of God testing man, for what can be gained from testing someone who is only one day old? At that stage, man couldn't even discern between good and evil.

Therefore, it can also be understood that when the Biblical story is taken literally, at face value, there is no one right or wrong answer presented – for if there were, what would happen to our free choice? And so, one should not be surprised that man won't get far by trying to understand the literal meaning of a “story”…Here is an example of how it is possible to learn about a man’s character from just ten simple words, and how to deal with him accordingly (Genesis 8, verse 21): “the imagination of man's heart is evil from his youth”

Man is automatically driven by his survival instinct (or “drive”, according to the more accepted terminology), just like all other living creatures. Once he was granted wisdom (together with the ceremonial bestowal of free choice) man was transformed into the most splendid work of Creation - when he acquired the ability to activate his intellect (consciously), which set him apart from all other creatures on Earth. The ability to activate his intellect gave man the potential for unlimited independent thought – and that is the highest ability and goal attributed to humans in this world.

The complexity of human creation becomes increasingly complicated when man’s wisdom (which begins to develop from his youth) is naturally channeled to nurture his inclinations towards possessiveness and dominance, and intensifies them a thousand times over. And their influence on man subordinates him, and his subjugation to them is in total opposition to his innate ability to achieve independent thought (his mission in life)…

Now we can begin to provide an initial answer to the question so many deliberate over: “What am I doing here in this world?”

“I am here to offer human substance to the world we live in!” Or in simpler language: To succeed in channeling the wisdom to combat the “animal” tendency, and to overcome it, in order to change the world into a place suitable for man to live in. There are no shortcuts. Everything must be accomplished with man’s freedom of choice.

And regarding this matter we have not made much progress....  Is it due to man’s lack of desire to part from his “animalistic” traits, or is it because of the “animalistic” tendency of one man to control another? The control is manifested either with physical force, as was the case in the first days of Creation, or with brain power – in the form of persuasion and/or propagating theories and “ruminations” that send man back to a dawn of Creation state of ignorance. And the result is the same – most of the world still lives in environments that prevent the development of independent thought.

In the book we will elaborate on this topic, and will also touch upon that Biblical suggestions for coping with man’s inclinations. And also (perhaps for the first time ever), we will implement innovative logic to deal with the confusion caused by some of the scholars and researchers that results from the aforementioned “complexities” which have led man to believe he has created himself. And therefore: It doesn’t matter how high we throw the parts of an iPhone, nor does it matter for how many thousands of years we keep trying – the parts will never fall on each other “by themselves” exactly the way the manufacturer intended for them to be connected to each other. The phone will never ring…

The “story” of the Flood describes for us the severe repercussions that can occur when man’s wisdom is naturally channeled to nurture his inclinations towards possessiveness and dominance (Genesis 6, verse 5): And the Lord saw that the evil of man was great in the earth, and every imagination (= instinct) of his heart was only evil all the time. There was no possible solution other than to bring a flood upon the land, and to wipe out every living thing on earth, except for Noah (and his family), who was saved because Noah found favor in the Lord’s eyes – that is to say: He behaved like a human being. (Genesis 6 – 8).

Without a doubt, the message that jumps out of the Flood “story” is: a leader of nation that “has no God” (in terms of law and order) will meet a tragic end.

But what interest does the Bible have in telling us that building the ark took 120 years – especially when just a few years would have been enough?

In fact, the practical answer to this question can be found with the commentators: So that people would understand the significance of Noah’s actions, and repent. But what is the message for later generations, and for today?

To answer that question, we will return to the “ceremonial” words granting the freedom of choice to man, in Genesis 2, verse 17: “But of the Tree of Knowledge of good and evil you shall not eat of it, for on the day that you eat thereof, you shall surely die.” Well, man ate and didn’t die…

But as stated before, according to the simple interpretation of the “story” itself, man won’t get very far…

The: “you shall surely die” refers to those who decide to forfeit their right to free will. In other words: The right to free will that was granted to man is not an option, but rather man must take initiative and extend his hand to take hold of his fate. Otherwise, his very life will be in danger. That is to say, Noah survived the Flood, and together with him anyone else could have been saved, had he only chosen to use his intelligence and understand the significance of Noah’s actions, and join him in the ark. And Noah intentionally extended the time of his “actions” (building the ark) by over 100 years…

Therefore, if we go over our bloodstained history (until today), we will discover that may evils in the world could have been prevented, if people would have only taken their fate in their hands rather than passively sitting and waiting for a heavenly or earthly agent to save them…

Indeed, the “story” of the Flood is told in different version is different cultures, but as we have already begun to understand – the lessons to be learned from this Biblical “story” have far reaching ramifications even on tomorrow’s reality…

And surely, if we delve a little bit more into the “story” of the Flood, we will discover that during the special circumstances of the generation of the Flood, there was still no law and order in the world. The “story” in fact investigates the ability of the most righteous man of the generation (in this case Noah) to have a good influence on his generation (and even on his city, in similar “stories”).  And the conclusion (in all versions) was negative. That is to say: Isolated individuals do not have the power to influence the masses. So the world is doomed, and there is nothing to be done about it?

But actually, the main message of that “story” is: A man’s wisdom and freedom of choice are not able, in of themselves, to bring him to state of independent thought – which is his purpose. Therefore, despite the fact that freedom of choice is mainly expressed through a total absence of Divine intervention in what happens here on Earth, there is no reason to rule out (occasional) Divine intervention to save/repair the world from man’s actions…. Divine intervention occurs at important junctures in the course of humanity - when without that intervention, the world would not be able to achieve its purpose.

And in fact, after the reason for the Divine intervention is made clear to the world, and only the above mentioned reason, man’s status as a person with free will is reinstated (Genesis 8, verses 21-22): “…and the Lord said to Himself, "I will no longer curse the earth because of man, for the imagination of man's heart is evil from his youth, and I will no longer smite all living things as I have done. So long as the earth exists, seedtime and harvest, cold and heat, summer and winter, and day and night shall not cease.” That is to say: For as long as the earth exists, the Lord will not punish or reward man for his actions during his lifetime and everything will occur according to the laws of nature – so that man will feel confident in choosing whatever his heart desires – either good or evil, but he will choose!

Therefore, the Bible consistently explains to man everything happening around him, in order to give him the opportunity to choose his next moves. For instance: Genesis 3, verse 22: “Now the Lord God said, "Behold man has become like one of us, having the ability of knowing good and evil…”  That is to say, the Bible tells us that man’s wisdom is in fact Divine (infinite).

Genesis 3, verse 24: “And He drove the man out, and He stationed from the east of the Garden of Eden the cherubim and the blade of the revolving sword, to guard the way to the Tree of Life.” That is to say, the Bible tells us that: Man was banished from the Garden of Eden, and a special guard was stationed there to prevent him any access to the Tree of Life (the future).

Wars between villages and tribes were commonplace, and sometimes the people associated with a particular village or tribe fought among themselves. It is almost impossible to understand that Bible and its educational methods, without understanding the time period in question, the period when most of humanity was exceedingly ignorant and primitive, and when most were slaves. The free people, or the "enlightened" amongst them, believed in or served dozens (if not hundreds) of gods – and making sacrifices on platforms or in sanctuaries to please/calm the anger of the gods, or to ensure success, was a central cultural activity. The sacrifices were made by the kings or important priests.

Now it should be easy to understand why a significant portion of the Bible discusses the construction of different elements for the Tabernacle (for God), and sacrificial offerings, which were actually the main educational method at that time. We of course must take note of the "minor" changes the Bible introduced into these ceremonies, which in fact made all the difference.

Unlike sacrifices made by many other cultures at that time, most of the sacrificial offerings made by men who lived according to the Bible were voluntarily made based upon each individual's decision to do so. Whether to express thanks or repent for his sins, sacrificial offerings were an accepted way of placating God. On the other hand, a person was at the same time taking responsibility for his actions. (How many people today are willing to publically take responsibility for their failures?) And it wasn't just about acknowledging personal responsibility, but also about paying "atonement" (out of his own pocket) for his sins or his successes with the most lucrative currency of that time: sheep or cattle! Could there have been any better educational method at that time, for instilling the value of taking personal responsibility – which also requires independent thought?

It is important to emphasize that the use of the Tabernacle permanently ended with the construction of a permanent sanctuary, just as offering sacrifices was discontinued at the end of the Second Temple Period. When synagogues were built, prayer replaced sacrifices – as was the case with many more practices that became outdated with the development of humanity, in the sense of: "since the day has passed the sacrifice lapses" (Brachot Tractate 26a) – meaning: If the prescribed time for doing something has passed, the opportunity is lost.

Because love for God or the desire to be close to Him is the recommended way to sustain justice and morality in the world. In this book itself I will explain in depth the advantages of humanity believing in one God, as well as the significance of creativity/activity from a position of independent thought – which is the only thing that remains with man for eternity.

Pleasant reading (and learning)
