About the Work and its Author
At the site of the immunization against Chickenpox appeared a subcutaneous
lump. And a story was once published about a girl in Scotland who had such a
lump, and who also fell in a pit – a pit which pulled her 200 years back in
time. When the locals noticed the raised bump they were convinced that a demon
was hiding inside the swelling…
That was the way the Scots thought 200 years ago…so it shouldn't be too
hard to guess the status of human comprehension 1000 years ago…
Therefore, regarding the Bible – for which 3000 year old archaeological
proof of what is written was recently discovered – it obviously created a need for
innumerable interpretations that were suited to the intellectual abilities of
people living during the different periods after its dissemination - in
the aftermath of many battles and revolutions worldwide, the interpretations of
the Bible underwent far-reaching upheavals.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              The "Enlightenment" moment that commenced about 250 years ago
lead to contradictory changes in the way the 
world looked at religion in general, and specifically at the ways Bible and other religious texts were viewed. The more progressive among the populace
reacted by separating State and Religion, and the less progressive dug their
heels in and held fast to religion – remaining essentially frozen in time.
There is no doubt that if King Solomon – the wisest man of all,
according to Jewish tradition – was alive today, he would produce an
interpretation that applied to the world today, while including all the values
of the past…
One of King Solomon's descendants, who goes by the name of Ben
Solomon (son of Solomon) has taken upon himself to fulfill this task, to
write a new interpretation of the Bible. While his interpretation will not
stray even a millimeter from the inherent ideas conveyed in the original text,
it will integrate the past with the future, and provide answers for anyone who
questions or researches using the thinking patterns and intelligence of a man
living in the modern world today.
In other words: An interpretation which will return the Bible to its
place of prominence in every man's personal library, and more important – to
its place of respect in every man's mind. It will serve as a useful tool, as a
source of ideas and information for anyone at all who studies it.
There is no doubt that this is a grandiose project by any standards, and
one which demands reasonable proof of its feasibility before any request for
public funding can be made. The prospectus, if you will, for this tremendous
project is attached.

What We Do
 * Research and Writing
* Editing and  Pagination
* Translation to as many languages as possible   
* Distribution - world wide 
Here is a one page actual example from the project and after that the Introduction and prospectus of the Project 


2. 
Divine Supervision, or in
other words: Heavenly Intervention.
The previous chapter ended with
the expulsion of man from the Garden of Eden. But it was only natural that the
Divine supervision or instruction continued in man’s new home on Earth. As the
Bible tells us in Genesis 6, verses 2: “And the sons of God saw the
daughters of man when they were beautifying themselves, and they took for
themselves wives from whomever they chose.” The type of love between man
and God is not unique to this “story”. This style repeats itself, with words
that are even more erotic in the Song of Songs: 1. The Song of Songs, which
is Solomon's.  2. Let him kiss me
with the kisses of his mouth, for your love is better than wine. 3. Because of
the fragrance of your goodly oils, your name is 'oil poured forth.' Therefore,
the maidens loved you...” And there, as in the previous example, the Bible
describes the lofty emotions of satisfaction (and confidence) that man
experiences when he senses that God is supporting him or standing behind him in
everything he does.
But like every good thing, the instruction also
came to an end, and man became totally independent as a dominant presence on
Earth.  Independence that could of course
never be possible with continued instruction, or even with any sort of Heavenly
involvement.  This does not resemble the
interaction between father and son, where the instruction and mentoring can
continue for a lifetime – for a son’s rejection of his father (something which
is quite common…) is nothing like man’s rejection of God. That is to say: Man
can make decisions about his life as an independent entity, only if the
relationship is completely severed. As it is written in Genesis 6, verse 3: And
the Lord said, "Let My spirit not quarrel forever concerning man, because
he is also flesh…” Perhaps at first glance this sounds cruel, but in fact –
from here on out there is no more Godly mentor and/or Godly protection or
supervision over man on Earth, which destined to transform into the wished or
dreamed of world for future mankind. And meanwhile, he must take his fate in
his hands, within the limitations also defined in Psalm 115, verse 16: The
heavens are heavens of the Lord, but the earth He gave to the children of men.
And indeed, disengaging man from Heavenly
supervision requires of him to take full control of his life. However, man’s
wisdom rapidly and quite naturally led him to feed his desires for possession
and mastery, and intensified those desires a thousand fold. Man’s dominance and
simultaneous acts enslavement became the central means of meeting his own needs,
which constantly increased. And with appetite there must come sustenance. In
other words, the strongest ruled, oppressed, robbed, and killed the weakest. As
it is written in Genesis 6, verse 5: And the Lord saw that the evil of man
was great in the earth, and every imagination of his heart was only evil all
the time. So there was no other option but to bring a Flood upon the world.
Over the course of history we have seen many
examples of  “the evil of man was
great”, due to ignorance, due to the desire to control and conquer, and
even due to the mental illness of leaders. So why is that that “the evil of
man was great” we are dealing with was sentenced with a Flood?
The contiguity between the disengagement of
Heavenly supervision from and “the evil of man was great” (just one
verse later) is the key to understanding this issue. The continuation of man’s
enslavement to Divine supervision/protection, even after the official
detachment – constitutes until this day the reason for oppression, robbery, and
killing in the world – and it is all “authorized and permitted”!
For even those who believe – as is the case with
all people everywhere – have needs. But today we realize that what we need
doesn’t drop out of the sky. So evil deeds are committed with the permission of
“God”, and there is no way to stop them other than to wipe out an entire
generation (like the Flood generation).
And we can actually see for ourselves that all of
the evils mentioned above that man committed in the world have decreased in
scope and number in the world, except for those evil acts committed with “God’s
permission” – and they are only increasing. And all of those acts are rooted in
blind subservience to a God that promises – as something that goes without
saying – his supervision and protection. But in the end, it all brings a Flood
upon the world.
Introduction and prospectus of the Project 
Nobody will dispute that the
Jewish Nation is an extraordinary phenomenon in the history of the world. And
what is particularly amazing is the Jewish Nation’s ability to survive for
three thousand, five hundred years, particularly when for two thousand of those
years they were scattered all over the globe - among nations that tried to
force them to forfeit their religion, among nations that ultimately expelled
the Jews from their homes, attacked them in pogroms, habitually murdered,
robbed, and plundered them, and imposed upon them exorbitant taxes and fines. 
Along with this incredible
ability to survive comes the fact that 24.5% of the scientists who won the
Noble Prizes (not including Noble
Peace Prizes) are Jews, while Jews only account for 0.2% of the entire
world population. That means that relative to the world population, for every 100
Jews who won prizes, only one non-Jew won a prize!
And rumor has it around the
globe, that the distribution of wealth among Jews is even proportionally higher
than the number of Nobel Prize winners, to the point where no small number of
people fantasize that the Jews control the world…
But in any case, what is most
impressive is the fact that wherever the Jews ended up in the Diaspora, they
quickly integrated into the most prestigious cultural and economic social
domains and became an influential force – if not the most influential
force – relative to their proportional representation in the general population.
In this book we will determine
whether these phenomena are part of the general plan for the creation of man with
regard to the most important stage of his development: improving his ability to
think independently, which is in fact man’s main goal in the world – and
also the correct way to achieve true happiness as humans.
Unlike what was acceptable in
the past, this book was written using an approach and language style that can be
comprehensible to every person. Concepts and perceptions that have evolved from
human development in our own times are also included. And if you ask what value
today's miniscule accumulation of knowledge has opposite the insights originating
in the great minds of the past, we will quote one of the sages from long ago: "If
a dwarf is placed on the shoulders of a giant, who sees farther? Surely the
dwarf! For the eyes of the dwarf are now higher than the eyes of the giant. So
too, we are dwarfs astride the shoulders of giants…" Rabbi Yeshaya bar
Mali, Di Trani, the "Rid" (1180 – 1250), one of the greatest
scholars of his time (and among the greatest of the "Rishonim" among
Jewish commentators).
The Bible is the most famous
and most widely disseminated creation in the world, and has served (and still
serves) as the basis for the three monotheistic religions, that all believe in
one God, and in fact in the same God. And the followers of these religions, who
account for nearly half of the world's population, each in turn claims to have
found the best way to achieving happiness in life on earth, and even more
importantly, to achieving happiness in the World to Come.
It's true that as time passed,
these religions (Judaism, Christianity, and Islam) produced a few moredenominations, and each denomination interprets or
understandsthe holy writings slightly (or
extremely) differently. In recent times, university professors have discovered
countless examples that disprove things written in the holy texts.
This book will be earthshaking
for people on both ends of the spectrum, in that it will also challenge the
authenticity of the Bible. Due to the proliferation of so many theories,
interpretations, holy wars, and the building of personal careers, the main idea
inherent in the Bible has gotten lost by the wayside.
Different theories developed
as a result of the widening gap between the established interpretations of the
early scholars, which were considered immutable, and the evolving reality. That
contradicts what is written in the Bible (to be explained later), and even goes
against the aforementioned quoted essay, by the "RID", and even what
other scholars wrote even later on.
If we ignore for a moment the
classic interpretations, we will discover that the Bible is not a religious
text at all, but rather contains a continuum of narrative, educational methods,
and iron-clad rules, all with the purpose of
guiding and instructing man on how to create an environment conducive to
developing independent thinking! 
The narrative in
the Bible is a way of transmitting messages to man, and the main characteristic
of the narrative is its uncompromising preservation of man's right to free
will, that is part of his very essence. And in fact, the first
"story" that appears in the Bible, after the breakneck description of
Creation itself, is the text describing how free choice was first awarded to
man (Genesis 3, verses 1-7). In this story, which takes place in the Garden of
Eden, the Creator forbids man from eating fruit from the Tree of Knowledge. But
he doesn't actually prevent man from committing that transgression, and eating
from the forbidden fruit. It's clear that if the Creator did not want to give
man the freedom of choice (to receive wisdom), it never would have happened.
And it's also clear that this was not a case of God testing man, for what can
be gained from testing someone who is only one day old? At that stage, man
couldn't even discern between good and evil.
Therefore, it can also be
understood that when the Biblical story is taken literally, at face value,
there is no one right or wrong answer presented – for if there were, what would
happen to our free choice? And so, one should not be surprised that man won't
get far by trying to understand the literal meaning of a “story”…Here is an
example of how it is possible to learn about a man’s character from just ten
simple words, and how to deal with him accordingly (Genesis 8, verse 21): “the
imagination of man's heart is evil from his youth”
Man is automatically driven by
his survival instinct (or “drive”, according to the more accepted terminology),
just like all other living creatures. Once he was granted wisdom (together with
the ceremonial bestowal of free choice) man was transformed into the most
splendid work of Creation - when he acquired the ability to activate his
intellect (consciously), which set him apart from all other creatures on Earth.
The ability to activate his intellect gave man the potential for unlimited
independent thought – and that is the highest ability and goal attributed to
humans in this world.
The complexity of human
creation becomes increasingly complicated when man’s wisdom (which begins to
develop from his youth) is naturally channeled to nurture his inclinations
towards possessiveness and dominance, and intensifies them a thousand times
over. And their influence on man subordinates him, and his subjugation to them
is in total opposition to his innate ability to achieve independent thought
(his mission in life)…
Now we can begin to provide an
initial answer to the question so many deliberate over: “What am I doing here
in this world?”
“I am here to offer human
substance to the world we live in!” Or in simpler language: To succeed in
channeling the wisdom to combat the “animal” tendency, and to overcome it, in
order to change the world into a place suitable for man to live in. There are
no shortcuts. Everything must be accomplished with man’s freedom of choice.
And regarding this matter we
have not made much progress....  Is it
due to man’s lack of desire to part from his “animalistic” traits, or is it
because of the “animalistic” tendency of one man to control another? The
control is manifested either with physical force, as was the case in the first
days of Creation, or with brain power – in the form of persuasion and/or
propagating theories and “ruminations” that send man back to a dawn of Creation
state of ignorance. And the result is the same – most of the world still lives
in environments that prevent the development of independent thought. 
In the book we will elaborate
on this topic, and will also touch upon that Biblical suggestions for coping
with man’s inclinations. And also (perhaps for the first time ever), we will
implement innovative logic to deal with the confusion caused by some of the
scholars and researchers that results from the aforementioned “complexities”
which have led man to believe he has created himself. Man has failed to make
the distinction that law-based regularity is the opposite of fortuity or probability.
And therefore: It doesn’t matter how high we throw the parts of an iPhone, nor
does it matter for how many thousands of years we keep trying – the parts will
never fall on each other “by themselves” exactly the way the manufacturer
intended for them to be connected to each other. The phone will never ring…
In order to strike the iron
while it’s still hot, we will illustrate this concept with a “story” or two,
and will be surprised to discover (or not) that everything is connected to one
principle idea: 
The “story” of the Flood
describes for us the severe repercussions that can occur when man’s wisdom is
naturally channeled to nurture his inclinations towards possessiveness and
dominance (Genesis 6, verse 5): And the Lord saw that the evil of man was
great in the earth, and every imagination (= instinct) of his heart was
only evil all the time. There was no possible solution other than to bring
a flood upon the land, and to wipe out every living thing on earth, except for
Noah (and his family), who was saved because Noah found favor in the Lord’s
eyes – that is to say: He behaved like a human being. (Genesis 6 – 8).
Without a doubt, the message
that jumps out of the Flood “story” is: a leader of nation that “has no God”
(in terms of law and order) will meet a tragic end.
But what interest does the
Bible have in telling us that building the ark took 120 years – especially when
just a few years would have been enough?
In fact, the practical answer
to this question can be found with the commentators: So that people would
understand the significance of Noah’s actions, and repent. But what is the
message for later generations, and for today?
To answer that question, we
will return to the “ceremonial” words granting the freedom of choice to man, in
Genesis 2, verse 17: “But of the Tree of Knowledge of good and evil you
shall not eat of it, for on the day that you eat thereof, you shall surely
die.” Well, man ate and didn’t die…
But as stated before, according
to the simple interpretation of the “story” itself, man won’t get very far…
The: “you shall surely die”
refers to those who decide to forfeit their right to free will. In other words:
The right to free will that was granted to man is not an option, but rather man
must take initiative and extend his hand to take hold of his fate. Otherwise, his
very life will be in danger. That is to say, Noah survived the Flood, and
together with him anyone else could have been saved, had he only chosen to use
his intelligence and understand the significance of Noah’s actions, and join
him in the ark. And Noah intentionally extended the time of his “actions”
(building the ark) by over 100 years…
Therefore, if we go over our
bloodstained history (until today), we will discover that may evils in the
world could have been prevented, if people would have only taken their fate in
their hands rather than passively sitting and waiting for a heavenly or earthly
agent to save them…
Indeed, the “story” of the
Flood is told in different version is different cultures, but as we have
already begun to understand – the lessons to be learned from this Biblical
“story” have far reaching ramifications even on tomorrow’s reality…
And surely, if we delve a
little bit more into the “story” of the Flood, we will discover that during the
special circumstances of the generation of the Flood, there was still no law
and order in the world. The “story” in fact investigates the ability of the
most righteous man of the generation (in this case Noah) to have a good
influence on his generation (and even on his city, in similar “stories”).  And the conclusion (in all versions) was
negative. That is to say: Isolated individuals do not have the power to
influence the masses. So the world is doomed, and there is nothing to be done
about it?
But actually, the main message
of that “story” is: A man’s wisdom and freedom of choice are not able, in of
themselves, to bring him to state of independent thought – which is his
purpose. Therefore, despite the fact that freedom of choice is mainly expressed
through a total absence of Divine intervention in what happens here on Earth,
there is no reason to rule out (occasional) Divine intervention to save/repair
the world from man’s actions…. Divine intervention occurs at important
junctures in the course of humanity - when without that intervention, the world
would not be able to achieve its purpose.
And in fact, after the reason
for the Divine intervention is made clear to the world, and only the above
mentioned reason, man’s status as a person with free will is reinstated
(Genesis 8, verses 21-22): “…and the
Lord said to Himself, "I will no longer curse the earth because of man,
for the imagination of man's heart is evil from his youth, and I will no longer
smite all living things as I have done. So
long as the earth exists, seedtime and harvest, cold and heat, summer and
winter, and day and night shall not cease.” That is to say: For as long as the earth exists, the Lord will not punish
or reward man for his actions during his lifetime and everything will occur
according to the laws of nature – so that man will feel confident in choosing
whatever his heart desires – either good or evil, but he will choose!
Therefore,
the Bible consistently explains to man everything happening around him, in
order to give him the opportunity to choose his next moves. For instance:
Genesis 3, verse 22: “Now the Lord God said, "Behold
man has become like one of us, having the ability of knowing good and evil…”  That
is to say, the Bible tells us that man’s wisdom is in fact Divine (infinite).
Genesis
3, verse 24: “And
He drove the man out, and He stationed from the east of the Garden of Eden the
cherubim and the blade of the revolving sword, to guard the way to the Tree of
Life.” That is to say, the Bible tells
us that: Man was banished from the Garden of Eden, and a special guard was
stationed there to prevent him any access to the Tree of Life (the future).
The
three scenarios below, based on three (aforementioned) quotes from the Bible,
should be sufficient to test the innovativeness and moral rectitude of the
messages transmitted to man via Bible narratives (which were authored at least 3,000
years ago).
1. 
Without a doubt, if someone from the Humanist community had announced 500
years ago that the Divine Creator that religious people believe in doesn’t help
and doesn’t redeem and doesn’t punish, and also doesn’t reward man in this
world: “as long as the earth exists” - he would be burned at the stake or had
his throat slit by sword, or he would have been excommunicated to the end of
his days…
2. 
And it is likewise certain that if someone would dare to claim 500 years
ago that Man has been blessed with Divine wisdom (infinite) – he would also
have beenburned at the stake or had his throat
slit by sword, or he would have been excommunicated to the end of his days…
3.  Similarly, if someone would hazard announcing that 500 years ago: It
is not within man’s power (any man) to know what his future brings or the day
of his death – not by reading coffee, or cards, or the stars, or in any other
way (except, of course, the bright future of those who earn a living engaging
in all of those professions), he should be burned at the stake or have his
throat slit by sword, or be excommunicated to the end of his days…

And
now we will state the opposite. The aforementioned lessons to be learned have

How
could Divine intervention have been explained for the next ten generations

the Lord descended to see the city and the tower that the sons of man had
built. And the Lord said, "Lo! [they are] one people, and they all have

Lord scattered them from there…” But what exactly were
they “punished” for?
One
would think that the response would be just the opposite, for it is good to be

of the “story” itself, we won’t get very far…
Why
a punishment all of a sudden?
This
is, once again, an instance of Divine intervention in order to repair/save the
entire world. At that time, even more than is the case today, only sinister
dictatorships were able to pursue and partially achieve the goal of having only one ruler over the entire world. And we have already learned
that the man’s mission is to achieve independence, independent thought –
through use of his right to free will, which was ultimately granted him.
Therefore,
by dispersing the population into separate tribe, nations, and
countries, the opportunity for man to utilize his free will was maximized –
from then until today. That is the anticipated fate for all autocratic empires
in the world…
*And
what came next: Dispersing the population into separate nations emphasized the
problem created for man, which was a combination of man’s awareness of his
environment (when he acquired wisdom) together with his lack of knowledge of
what the morrow would bring (the blocked path to the Tree of Life – the

placate or appease any force that seemed stronger than him and/or that might

That is to say:
Different and strange laws and moral standards, which were

subjugation to different gods that did not allow man to realize his right to
free choice, the wars and conflicts between the gods with regard to their

The Divine (and
ingenious) solution offered then to man to help him also overcome his
dependence on gods was: Monotheism (Exodus 20, verse 3): “You shall
not have the gods of others in My presence.” Obviously, this is not a case of jealousy or

Monotheism, which
also came down to the world through Divine intervention – was, once again, an

As a “lesson
learned”, Monotheism and its rules would not be taught/demonstrated by isolated

It is commonly
acknowledged that the beginning of this intervention occurred simultaneously

his direct descendants were chosen to become the Treasured Nation.
One can reasonably
assume that our forefather Abraham (who was active in approximately 1800 BC)

will kill me…’” There was no shortage of gods back then, but who could guess which law or
which god any local leader was loyal to on any given day?
And indeed, Avraham didn’t
only understand that everyone must follow the same laws, but he was a living
example of it for the whole world to see, with his complete willingness to
sacrifice his only son – as he was commanded by God (the law).
Even
those who don’t believe in God will surely agree that there is no educational
method better than accustoming people to follow rules – and especially people

“own” god…). And indeed, after successfully passing his final test (binding his
son for sacrifice), Abraham is informed that his descendants have been selected
as the Treasured Nation, as it is written in Genesis 12, verse 18: And through your children shall be blessed
all the nations of the world, because you hearkened to My voice.
Thus
far we have provided a few examples of how Biblical narrative can be understood
– every “story” is complemented by the “story” that follows. And their lessons
are still relevant today. This idea is expanded upon in this book, and the
personal world of every reader will be illuminated by what the book has to
offer.
“…the
Bible is not a religious text at all, but rather contains a continuum of
narrative, educational
methods, and iron-clad rules, all with
the purpose of guiding and instructing man on how to create an environment conducive to…”
The educational methods of the Bible – as is the case with the narratives –
are also presented in the language of olden times, but they certainly still
apply to today’s world (and to tomorrow’s…). The educational methods were the
main tool available for training the Treasured
Nation, where the training process
itself served as a real time demonstration for the rest of the world: How to
establish a family (the strict prohibitions against the “family” chaos that was
once so commonplace, especially among slaves), how to set up an equal

Therefore,
every detail in the training process of the Treasured
Nation was illuminated with a thousand
spotlights, so that every other nation could see and hear, learn and imitate
their behavior, in preparation for the promise made by God to Abraham. To that
end, the descent to Egypt and terrible period of slavery also served as an
example to every other nation or individual who was oppressed or enslaved
(which was, in fact, the state of existence of most of humanity in ancient
times…). For it did not matter what dismal state a person found himself in. His
hope should never waver.
The
climax of the Egypt “story” was the deliverance from Egypt (the release from
bondage in Egypt). According to the Biblical descriptions, this event occurred
about 3,500 years ago, when most of the world was entrenched in a state of
total ignorance and living in caves or temporary dwellings. They established
remote villages without any means of communicating with each other. Even today,
if a person is born into some far-flung tribe in the Amazon rainforest, he will
live in similar conditions. Most of his day will be spent searching for food
for his family – primarily hunting with a sharpened bone as a spearhead…
If
we were to go back to those times, it is certain that ignorance was rampant
because of the difficult living conditions people had to endure – no small
amount of time was spent in battling others to conquer (or defend), capturing
and selling slaves (or freeing them), and burning villages to the ground (or
saving them). Wars between villages and tribes were commonplace, and sometimes
the people associated with a particular village or tribe fought among
themselves. This all created a situation that prevented anyone from learning
anything more than what he needed to survive.
Today
we know that learning requires time and peace of mind. Even the most skillful
teachers and guides will never be able to make their mark if they have no time
to teach, and have no willing students…
And
now, going back to the main “story” line of the Bible, which deals with the
trials and travails of the Children of Israel as they wandered the desert for
40 years: An entire nation of slaves that was released from bondage, and
completely detached from all the suffering it had undergone on a daily basis
for approximately 400 years. A dispersed and scattered nation was gathered from
all its places of dwelling in Egypt, and united within the framework of shared
troubles and hardships. They went on a long journey lasting 40 years, with the
Levites (the teachers) separated from the rest of the nation straight at the
outset… Consequently, how surprising (or not) to discover that this is in fact
the optimal way to learn, to teach, and to formulate a national ethos, without
which its long term existence would be doubtful, if not defunct.
And
what about the ceaseless obstinacy and bitterness expressed by the nation who
left Egypt, against the God who acted so graciously towards them? That is
simply valid evidence of the great difficulties undergone by the dispersed and
scattered slave nation that was at the bottom of humanity's social ladder – as
it struggled to transform itself into a free and united nation that would one
day stand at the forefront of humanity.
The
readers should not take this lightly: Even after more than 200 years of
anti-slavery laws in the United States (laws that were passed only 50 years
later in the Southern States) – and despite human advancement in the USA -
there is still a small group of slave descendants who don't feel like they are
part of the American nation. And they even find it difficult to integrate into
daily life there – even though they have lived there for generations as free
men, in the most developed country in the world.
It
is true that many Bible researchers do not acknowledge all of the events, the
miracles and wonders experienced by the Children of Israel – exactly as they
are related in the Bible. But nobody will deny that these "stories"
serve as the very necessary ethos for creating a nation out of remnants of
tribes and the mixed multitude that joined them. The ethos that was common to
everyone who left Egypt, and which continued to unify the Nation for another
1000 years in the Land of Israel - and even later when the people were
displaced to thousands of different settlements in the Diapsora. This unifying
ethos continues to accompany the Jewish nation - that was established by the descendants of those former
Egyptian slaves - until today!
And
if anyone thinks that building a strong foundation for this nation is a matter
of ancient history, he need only look at what is happening today in the Middle
East, Africa, etc, and what will happen tomorrow or the day after in many of
the European countries…
It
is almost impossible to understand that Bible and its educational methods,
without understanding the time period in question, the period when most of
humanity was exceedingly ignorant and primitive, and when most were slaves. The
free people, or the "enlightened" amongst them, believed in or served
dozens (if not hundreds) of gods – and making sacrifices on platforms or in sanctuaries
to please/calm the anger of the gods, or to ensure success, was a central
cultural activity. The sacrifices were made by the kings or important priests.
Now
it should be easy to understand why a significant portion of the Bible
discusses the construction of different elements for the Tabernacle (for God),
and sacrificial offerings, which were actually the main educational method at
that time. We of course must take note of the "minor" changes the
Bible introduced into these ceremonies, which in fact made all the difference. 
Unlike
sacrifices made by many other cultures at that time, most of the sacrificial
offerings made by men who lived according to the Bible were voluntarily made
based upon each individual's decision to do so. Whether to express thanks or
repent for his sins, sacrificial offerings were an accepted way of placating
God. On the other hand, a person was at the same time taking responsibility for
his actions. (How many people today are willing to publically take
responsibility for their failures?) And it wasn't just about acknowledging
personal responsibility, but also about paying "atonement" (out of
his own pocket) for his sins or his successes with the most lucrative currency
of that time: sheep or cattle! Could there have been any better educational
method at that time, for instilling the value of taking personal responsibility
– which also requires independent thought?
It
is important to emphasize that the use of the Tabernacle permanently ended with
the construction of a permanent sanctuary, just as offering sacrifices was
discontinued at the end of the Second Temple Period. When synagogues were
built, prayer replaced sacrifices – as was the case with many more practices
that became outdated with the development of humanity, in the sense of: "since
the day has passed the sacrifice lapses" (Brachot Tractate 26a) – meaning:
If the prescribed time for doing something has passed, the opportunity is lost.
Thus
we have demonstrated to some extent the educational methods of the Bible, and
specifically the ideas and understandings behind them, which are still relevant
today. Later, while reading this book in its entirety, these ideas will be
expanded upon for the purpose of applying them to modern life.
"…the Bible is not a religious text at all, but rather
contains a continuum of narrative, educational methods, and iron-clad rules, all with the purpose of guiding and instructing
man on how to create an environment conducive to developing independent thinking!"
Iron
clad rules (the laws) of the Bible – in contrast to the educational methods,
and despite the fact that they are written in a language style no longer in use
– are constant and permanent, and will still be valid tomorrow. The goal of the
rules is to build up and strengthen the best environment possible for
developing independent thought. That environment will provide: 
· 
Freedom to learn together with the obligation to teach society's
children. Freedom to engage in economic activities.
· 
Personal and public responsibilities. 
· 
National unity and help for the needy individual. 
· 
Maintenance of public servants, and support for the poor. 
· 
Regulations pertaining to the accumulation of personal property (the
right of ownership) together with social justice. 
· 
Laws of work and rest, and even proper behavior towards animals. 
· 
Etc.
Therefore,
it's no wonder that the first sentence (law) in the Bible, in the series of
"laws and ordinances" deals with freedom – with the release of slaves
(Exodus 21, verses 1 - 2): "And
these are the ordinances that you shall set before them. Should you buy a
Hebrew slave, he shall work [for] six years, and in the seventh [year], he
shall go out to freedom without charge." Temporary bondage (the temporary denial of freedom) is
part of reality, even today. But how should society deal with a person who
wants to live as a slave for his entire life – that is to say, free of
responsibility regarding his own life?
(Exodus
21, verses 5 - 6): But if the slave says, "I
love my master..I will not go free. His master shall bring him…to the door or
to the doorpost, and…bore his ear with an awl, and he shall serve him
forever." This iron clad rule
teaches us that despite man's right to free will, he can also choose not to be
free. That is to say: He doesn't want to take responsibility for his actions,
and thereby disrupts the main purpose of his creation and ability to reach
independence and independent thought. Society should condemn such an individual
for all eternity.
Incidentally:
Regarding the purchase of a slave – The intention is to a form of punishment
imposed upon a person who stole or inflicted damage, and who has no way of
making amends to the owner. In the Biblical method of punishment (in the future
we will surely also implement this method), damages are always remunerated, and
in addition, the culprit must also pay the costs of his imprisonment. That
creates a Win-Win situation.
The
commandment to teach one's children, and the learning process itself, are among
the most central iron clad Biblical rules. This commandment is observed today
throughout the entire world (in every modern place), without any deviation, as
the Treasured Nation once demonstrated. As it is written in the book of Deuteronomy,
chapter 6, verse 7: "And
you shall teach them to your sons and speak of them when you sit in your house,
and when you walk on the way, and when you lie down and when you rise up." This became most apparent at the beginning of the
Middle Ages, when the world was still stuck in total cultural darkness but most
of the Jews had "University" degrees from the first plebian
university in the world. It taught: Torah, Mishna, Talmud, Law, Astronomy,
Ethics, Science, Economics, etc, with an almost infinite list of pluralistic
lecturers…
Today
it is clear that the crowning glory of independent thought is the acquisition
of an education. And even clearer is that the Jewish People, in their role as
the Treasured Nation who must guide and educate the world, had an even greater
incentive to invest in studies, so that everyone would recognize their wisdom
and intelligence. As it says in the concluding remarks made by Moses to the
Children of Israel in the book of Deuteronomy (chapter 4, verses 5 – 7): Behold,
"I have taught you
statutes and ordinances, as the Lord, my God, commanded me, to do so in the
midst of the land to which you are coming to possess. And you shall keep them and uphold them
for that is your wisdom and your understanding in the eyes of the peoples, who will
hear all these statutes and say, 'Only this great nation is a wise and
understanding people. For what great nation is there that has God so near to
it, as the Lord our God is at all times that we call upon Him?'"
This
is the key to understanding the reason for the wondrous facts about the Jewish
nation, which can be found in the opening statement of the introduction, regarding
events beginning 3,500 years ago… 
In
the book itself I will expand on the difference
between a Biblical commandment, which is an iron clad rule for generations to
come, and the commandments that served as educational methods in their times. A
failure to differentiate, or to be more exact – a failure to
understand…ultimately created a separation of "religion" and (the
modern) State. "Religious" laws, which are in fact the "laws and
ordinances" (the iron clad rules) that appear in the Bible, formed the
basis for the modern laws of the Western World. These laws were only applied
about two hundred years ago (in the wake of the French Revolution). Today they
are accepted everywhere in the (free) world.
This
failure to differentiate between Biblical commandments and educational methods was
already transpiredonce beforeby a basic mistake made by all of the Monotheistic religious
leaders, including Rabbi Akiva (17-137 C.E), who was one of the greatest Jewish
rabbis living near the time of the destruction of the Second Temple. This mistake
that can only be explained today by Rabbi Akiva's insufficient historical
perspective. We can see that Divine Intervention took place, if only in order
to remove the obstacles that man himself created. These obstacles prevented him
from realizing his right to free will – without which there is no reason for
existence in this world. And realizing one's free will, whether one's intentions
are good or bad, does not lead to Divine Intervention. As it is written in
Genesis 8, verses 21 – 22: "I
will no longer smite all living things as I have done. So long as the earth exists, seedtime and
harvest, cold and heat, summer and winter, and day and night shall not cease..." But indeed, when man makes bad decisions there are
ramifications, and sometimes they are very serious, as in the case of Rabbi
Akiva: He chose to decree war against the largest and best trained military
force in the world at that time. He thought (mistakenly) that God would
intervene on the side of the just, or on the side of the righteous, or on the
side of those who made the right
choices. 
This
bad decision, lead to the deaths of Rabbi Akiva and "24,000" of his
students, together with a large percentage of the Jewish People. They were
killed, burnt, crucified, taken as captives, and exiled – just as hundreds, and
thousands, and millions of others over the course of generations who ignored
the laws of nature.
And
just like those who ignore the Biblical
warning  "you shall surely die" – which has no respite (until today) for
populations who willingly (or unwillingly) avoid taking their fate into their
own hands, and do not make use of their right to choose that was not granted as
an option, but as part of our nature.
Therefore,
it is no wonder that populations that decided to make use of their free will,
and did so correctly (according to the recommendations found in the Bible),
turned their countries into "Gardens of Eden". There is no better
proof of this than the increasing flow of people to those countries from places
that are run according to different standards altogether. And in no instance
has the opposite every happened…(an
uncontrollable flow of people to the "Garden of Eden" country that
would turn to one that is more like "Gehinom" – "Hell").
A
"Garden of Eden" is possible after an understanding is reached that
the belief in one God does not obligate the believers to join ranks behind the
god of the "Chosen
People". As the prophet
Micah clarified (about 700 years before the Common Era) in chapter 4, verse 5: "For all peoples shall go, each one
in the name of his god, but we will go in the name of the Lord…" That is to say, each People and its beliefs, each
People and its ceremonies according to the traditions they hold close to their
hearts. Because love for God or the desire to be close to Him is the
recommended way to sustain justice and morality in the world. Justice and
morality form the basis for creating the environment necessary for man to
achieve independent thought.
In this
book itself I will explain in depth the advantages of humanity believing in one
God, as well as the significance of creativity/activity from a position of
independent thought – which is the only thing that remains with man for
eternity.
Pleasant
reading (and learning)
The
author

story:
Goldfish Waldorf:

Chance for our Children in the Eastern Heart of Europe


The first steps

In the autumn of 2014 some families in Paks region, Tolna county, Hungary met and began to talk about a new way of education there. Their dream was to found a Waldorf kindergarten and elementary school in the region.

In the Paks Region of Hungary (in Tolna county, which is one of the poorest and less developed counties of our country) there is only one kind of education - maintained and ruled by the state. State schools are year by year more strict and the teaching method is completely against children's natural needs - deals only with the lexical knowledge and keeps children between very strict walls, there's nothing to do with creativity, community, social activities and the mind's freedom.

Waldorf Education is based on an understanding of human development that addresses the needs of the growing child. Waldorf teachers strive to transform education into an art that educates the whole child—the heart and the hands, as well as the head.



When you enter a Waldorf school, the first thing you may notice is the care given to the building. The walls are usually painted in lively colors and are adorned with student artwork. Evidence of student activity is everywhere to be found and every desk holds a uniquely created main lesson book.

Another first impression may be the enthusiasm and commitment of the teachers you meet. These teachers are interested in the students as individuals. They are interested in the questions:

  • How do we establish within each child his or her own high level of academic excellence?
  • How do we call forth enthusiasm for learning and work, a healthy self-awareness, interest and concern for fellow human beings, and a respect for the world?
  • How can we help pupils find meaning in their lives?
All these facts led these families to take the serious decision and risk and started to think and work on a project to bring this alternative education for their own and the area's children and families.

Only few months passed and more families joined the founders and they all agreed on the aim: building a real Waldorf institution in this region.



The Goldfish Waldorf Association

The idea of the foundation was born in September 2014 and in January 2015 ten families and a Waldorf teacher founded the nonprofit Goldfish Waldorf Association (GWA) which would run the institution. Since then the number of the members is rising and more and more parents and teachers join the work.

One of the most important things was to find the right place for the institution. The solution occurred in March: the local government of the town Paks offered the association the old school building of Dunakömlőd (which town belongs to Paks) for renting.

The villigers were delighted to hear about the new school because the building had not been used for twelwe years and therefore the village's future turned into a bad direction - where you can't find good education, sooner or later that place will be empty.

The community has a busy summer now, parents and volunteers are ready to work because there are a lot of things to do. The places for the children in the kindergarden and the first class need to be built and equipped and garden needs to be cleaned and arranged. We would like to open the door this september if possible, 25 children with their families are waiting at this moment to start this "mission" and to show that it is possible to do life and education on a different way.

“Our highest endeavor must be to develop free human beings who are able of themselves to impart purpose and direction to their lives. The need for imagination, a sense of truth, and a feeling of responsibility—these three forces are the very nerve of education.”
― Rudolf Steiner


Why is Waldorf different?

  • Waldorf pedagogy is completely child-focused.

  • Waldorf is social experience not for the children only but for the parents as well.

  • Three equal pillars operate Waldorf institutions: pedagogues, parents and the maintaining association (GWA).

  • The role of the community is more obvious when founding a new institution: Waldorf initiations are made by parents all over the world. Parents work on the accomplishment of the future institution.

  • There is no owner who would want profit.

  • There is no regulatory department, it is completely self-governing.

  • The parents decide what kind of institution they want and it is their responsibility as well.

This is how it works with the GWA too.




Future of the Goldfish Waldorf

There will be eight classes at the elementary school and one group at the kindergarten, so approximately 180 children are going to attend our school. It will be like an original Waldorf: natural and harmonic, where it is happy to enter for both children and parents. We believe that it will remind everyone of the morale it was born with: enthusiasm, love of life, desire to do, harmony, acceptance and most importantly the devotion to children in the area.

And last but not least, it is a chance for families to form a community of people which thinks and takes breath together upon good and noble thoughts, makes social activities for the children and therefore for the better and democratic future of our country in the heart of Europe.

What will the funds be used for?

Our goal of $50,000 would be used for the following:

  • renovating an old school building (painting, changing windows...)

  • repairing the electricity (lamps, connectors...)

  • repairing the watering system and bathrooms

  • equipping the canteen (cutlery, chairs, tables...)

  • creating and equipping an art room and room for wood-works

  • buying a piano and musical equipments to a music room

  • creating a community space for performances, feasts and social activities

  • creating a room for eurythmy (a special important subject in waldorf education)

  • doing and arranging the garden (cleaning, planting, building raised beds for vegetables and flowers)

  • renting a school bus

  • equipping the PE room


Perks

Here is the list of perks given for each amounts of money:
$10:
  • Thank you! :)
$20:
  • special thanks on Twitter and Facebook
$35:
  • printable digital Supporters' Certificate
$60:
  • printable digital Supporters' Certificate
  • printable Waldorf-styled bookmark
$100:
  • Supporters' Certificate
  • hand-dyed t-shirt
  • listed on the Supporters' Wall
$250:
  • Supporters' Certificate
  • hand-dyed t-shirt
  • Waldorf-designed mug
  • listed on the Supporters' Wall
$500:
  • Supporters' Certificate
  • hand-dyed t-shirt
  • Waldorf-designed mug
  • handmade bookmark
  • listed on the Supporters' Wall
$800:
  • Supporters' Certificate
  • hand-dyed t-shirt
  • Waldorf-designed mug
  • handmade bookmark
  • listed on the Supporters' Wall
  • Rudolf Steiner: Calendar of the Soul

$1000:
  • Supporters' Certificate
  • hand-dyed t-shirt
  • Waldorf-designed mug
  • handmade bookmark
  • a book about Waldorf pedagogy
  • listed on the Supporters' Wall
  • Waldorf Curriculum book according to your interest
$2500:
  • art certificate
  • hand-dyed t-shirt
  • Waldorf-designed mug
  • handmade bookmark
  • Waldorf Curriculum book according to your interest
  • a unique painting
  • listed on the Supporters' Wall

    If you would like to help us other ways please share this page on all sites you can:

    • facebook

    If you feel like helping with your own hands and coming here for some volunteer work send us an e-mail!

    In Hungarian: 

    Aranyhal Waldorf

    Esély Gyermekeinknek

    A kezdetek:

    2014 őszén összesodort néhány paksi és Paks környéki családot az élet, s beszélgetéseik egyre inkább egy irányba indultak: egyetértettek abban, hogy gyermekeiket Waldorf intézménybe szeretnék járatni, és abban is, hogy ez lehetőleg ne járjon utazással a kicsiknek.
    A paksi kistérségben állami- és egyházi oktatási formákat választhatnak az itt élők, egyetlen alternatív iskola sincs.
    Mindössze néhány hónap alatt az alapítókhoz új családok csatlakoztak, akik határozottan vallották: Waldorf intézményt akarnak Pakson.

    Az Aranyhal Waldorf Egyesület:

    Az alapítvány ötlete 2014 szeptemberében született. 2015 januárjában tíz család és egy Waldorf tanár megalapították az intézmény majdani fenntartóját, a nonprofit Aranyhal Waldorf Egyesületet. A létszám azóta is folyamatosan bővül, amint egyre többen, szülők és pedagógusok kapcsolódnak be a munkába. Az egyik legfontosabb teendő az óvoda és iskola helyszínének megtalálása volt. Márciusban megszületett a megoldás: Paks Város Önkormányzata felajánlotta, hogy bérbe adja az egyesületnek a régi dunakömlődi iskolát. A falubeliek nagy örömmel fogadták, az óvodáról, és iskoláról szóló hírt, az iskolaépületet ugyanis már több mint egy évtizede nem használták. Sűrű nyár vár ezért az Aranyhal Waldorf formálódó szülői közösségére, a komplexumban ki kell alakítani az óvoda és az iskola első osztályát befogadó részeket, és rendbe kell tenni a kertet.

    Miben más a Waldorf?

    • Különbözik a hagyományos oktatási módtól, mivel a Waldorf pedagógia teljes mértékben gyermekközpontú.

    • A Waldorf közösségi élmény mind a gyermekek, mind a szülők részére.

    • A már működő óvodákat, és iskolákat 3 egyenrangú pillér harmóniája tartja egyensúlyban: a pedagógusoké, szülőké, és a fenntartó egyesületé.

    • Az intézmény alapításakor a közösség szerepe még nyilvánvalóbb: a Waldorf intézmények a világon mindenhol szülői kezdeményezésre jönnek létre, a szülők dolgoznak azon, hogy az első gondolattól az utolsó szögig minden a helyére kerüljön, a majdani óvodában, és iskolában.

    • Nincs tulajdonos, aki profitot várna.

    • Nincs döntéshozó, előíró grémium vagy szerv.

    • a szülők közössége dönti el, a szülők közös felelőssége, hogy hogyan és milyen intézmény születik a munkájukból.

    Pontosan így történik ez az Aranyhal Waldorf esetében is.

    Az Aranyhal Waldorf jövője

    Egészen biztosan lesz öt évfolyam, és legalább egy óvodai csoport, azaz mint egy száz gyerek jár majd ide. Ízig-vérig Waldorf lesz: természetes és harmonikus, ahová öröm belépni felnőttnek és gyereknek egyaránt. Hiszünk abban, hogy magán viseli majd az alapító közösség keze nyomát, s hangulata felidézi majd azt, ahogyan született: a lelkesedést, az életörömöt, a tenni akarást, a be- és elfogadást és főként a gyermekek iránti odaadást.

    Mire fordítjuk a pénzt?

    A 50.000 dolláros célunkat a következőkre használnánk:

    • a régi iskolaépület felújítsa (festés, ablakcserék…)

    • iskolai felszerelések beszerzése (bútorok, táblák, könyvek…)

    • a kert rendbe hozása (faültetés, kertrendezés…)

    • a tanári felszerelése (asztalok, számítógépek, nyomtatók…)

    • az elektromos hálózat karbantartása (lámpa csere, konnektorok…)

    • vizesblokkok felújítása

    • színházterem kialakítása

    • euritmiaterem kialakítása

    • zeneterem kialakítása (zongora, egyéb hangszerek)

    • kézimunka- és asztalos műhely kialakítása

    • iskolabusz-bérlés

    • a testnevelés terem felszerelése

    Egyéb módok ahogy segíthetsz:

    • Ha szeretnél még nekünk segíteni, kérünk, hogy oszd meg minden lehetséges oldalon: facebook, twitter, és minden más.

    • Ha kedvet érzel az önkéntes tevékenységekhez, legyen az építés, vagy más munkák, kérlek vedd fel velünk a kapcsolatot: aranyhalwaldorf@gmail.com

in the region.

only one kind of education - maintained and ruled by the state. transform education into an art that educates the whole child—the heart 
and the hands, as well as the head.When you enter a Waldorf school, the first thing you may notice is 
the care given to the building. The walls are usually painted in lively 
colors and are adorned with student artwork. Evidence of student 
activity is everywhere to be found and every desk holds a uniquely 
created main lesson book.Another first impression may be the 
enthusiasm and commitment of the teachers you meet. These teachers are 
interested in the students as individuals. They are interested in the 
questions:
How do we establish within each child his or her own high level of academic excellence?
How
 do we call forth enthusiasm for learning and work, a healthy 
self-awareness, interest and concern for fellow human beings, and a 
respect for the world?
How can we help pupils find meaning in their lives?
All these facts led these families to take the serious decision and risk and started to think and work on a project to bring this alternative education for their
own and the area's children and families.
Only
few months passed and more families joined the founders and they all
agreed on the aim: building a real Waldorf institution in this region.The
Goldfish Waldorf Association

The
idea of the foundation was born in September 2014
and in January 2015 ten families and a Waldorf teacher founded the
nonprofit Goldfish Waldorf Association (GWA) which would run the
institution. Since then the number of the members is rising and more and more parents and teachers join the work. One of
the most important things was to find the right place for the institution.
The solution occurred in March: the local government of the town Paks offered
the association the old school building of Dunakömlőd
(which town belongs to Paks) for renting.
The
villigers were delighted to hear about the new school because the
building had not been used for twelwe years and therefore the village's future turned into a bad direction - where you can't find good education, sooner or later that place will be empty. 

The community has a busy summer now, parents and volunteers are ready to work because there are a lot of things to do. The places for the children in the
kindergarden and the first class need to be built and equipped and garden needs to be cleaned and arranged. We would like to open the door this september if possible, 25 children with their families are waiting at this moment to start this "mission" and to show that it is possible to do life and education on a different way.“Our highest endeavor must be to develop free human beings who are able 
of themselves to impart purpose and direction to their lives. The need 
for imagination, a sense of truth, and a feeling of responsibility—these
 three forces are the very nerve of education.”
    ―
    Rudolf Steiner

Why
is Waldorf different?



Waldorf
	pedagogy
	is completely child-focused. 
	


Waldorf
	is social experience not for the children only but for the parents
	as well.


Three
	equal pillars operate Waldorf institutions: pedagogues, parents and
	the maintaining association (GWA).


The
	role of the community is more obvious when founding a new
	institution: Waldorf initiations are made by parents all over the
	world. Parents work on the accomplishment of the future institution.
	
	


There
	is no owner who would want profit. 
	


There
	is no regulatory department, it is completely self-governing.


The
	parents decide what kind of institution they want and it is their
	responsibility as well.



This
is how it works with the GWA too.

Future
of the Goldfish Waldorf 


There
will be eight classes at the elementary school and one group at the
kindergarten, so approximately 180 children are going to attend our
school. It will be like an original Waldorf: natural and harmonic,
where it is happy to enter for both children and parents. We believe
that it will remind everyone of the morale it was born with:
enthusiasm, love of life, desire to do, harmony, acceptance and most
importantly the devotion to children in the area. And last but not least, it is a chance for families to form a community of people which thinks and takes breath together upon good and noble thoughts, makes social activities for the children and therefore for the better and democratic future of our country in the heart of Europe.

What
will the funds be used for?

Our
goal of $50,000 would be used for the following:


renovating
	an old school building (painting, changing windows...)

repairing
	the electricity (lamps, connectors...)
repairing the watering system and bathrooms

equipping
	the canteen (cutlery, chairs, tables...)

creating and equipping an art room and room for wood-works
buying a piano and musical equipments to a music room
creating a community space for performances, feasts and social activities
creating a room for eurythmy (a special important subject in waldorf education)
doing and arranging
	the garden (cleaning, planting, building raised beds for vegetables and flowers)
renting a school bus
equipping the PE room

Other
ways you can help:



If you would like to help
us other ways please share this page on all sites you can:

In Hungarian: 

Aranyhal
Waldorf 

Esély
Gyermekeinknek
A
kezdetek:
2014
őszén
összesodort néhány paksi és Paks környéki családot az élet, s
beszélgetéseik egyre inkább egy irányba indultak: egyetértettek
abban, hogy gyermekeiket Waldorf intézménybe szeretnék járatni,
és abban is, hogy ez lehetőleg ne járjon utazással a kicsiknek. A paksi kistérségben állami- és egyházi oktatási formákat választhatnak az itt élők, egyetlen alternatív iskola sincs. Mindössze néhány hónap
alatt az alapítókhoz
új
családok csatlakoztak, akik határozottan vallották: Waldorf
intézményt akarnak Pakson. 

Az
Aranyhal Waldorf Egyesület:
Az
alapítvány ötlete 2014
szeptemberében született. 2015 januárjában tíz
család és egy Waldorf tanár megalapították
az intézmény majdani fenntartóját,
a nonprofit Aranyhal Waldorf Egyesületet. A létszám azóta
is folyamatosan bővül, amint
egyre többen, szülők és
pedagógusok kapcsolódnak
be a munkába. Az egyik legfontosabb teendő
az óvoda és iskola helyszínének
megtalálása volt. Márciusban megszületett a megoldás: Paks Város
Önkormányzata felajánlotta, hogy bérbe adja az egyesületnek a
régi dunakömlődi iskolát. A
falubeliek nagy örömmel fogadták, az óvodáról,
és iskoláról szóló
hírt, az iskolaépületet
ugyanis már több mint egy évtizede nem használták. Sűrű
nyár vár ezért az Aranyhal Waldorf formálódó
szülői közösségére, a
komplexumban ki kell alakítani
az óvoda és az iskola első
osztályát befogadó részeket,
és rendbe kell tenni a kertet.
Miben
más a Waldorf? 



Különbözik
	a hagyományos oktatási módtól,
	mivel a Waldorf pedagógia
	teljes mértékben gyermekközpontú.


A
	Waldorf közösségi élmény mind a gyermekek, mind a szülők
	részére.


A már
	működő
	óvodákat, és iskolákat 3
	egyenrangú pillér harmóniája
	tartja egyensúlyban: a
	pedagógusoké, szülőké,
	és a fenntartó egyesületé.


Az
	intézmény alapításakor a
	közösség szerepe még nyilvánvalóbb:
	a Waldorf intézmények a világon mindenhol szülői
	kezdeményezésre jönnek létre, a szülők
	dolgoznak azon, hogy az első
	gondolattól az utolsó
	szögig minden a helyére kerüljön, a majdani óvodában,
	és iskolában. 
	


Nincs
	tulajdonos, aki profitot várna. 
	


Nincs
	döntéshozó, előíró
	grémium vagy szerv.


a
	szülők közössége dönti el,
	a szülők közös felelőssége,
	hogy hogyan és milyen intézmény születik a munkájukból.




Pontosan
így történik ez az Aranyhal
Waldorf esetében is.


Az
Aranyhal Waldorf jövője


Egészen
biztosan lesz öt évfolyam, és legalább egy óvodai
csoport, azaz mint egy száz gyerek jár majd ide. Ízig-vérig
Waldorf lesz: természetes és harmonikus, ahová öröm belépni
felnőttnek és gyereknek
egyaránt. Hiszünk abban, hogy magán viseli majd az alapító
közösség keze nyomát, s hangulata felidézi majd azt, ahogyan
született: a lelkesedést, az életörömöt, a tenni akarást, a
be- és elfogadást és főként
a gyermekek iránti odaadást.


Mire
fordítjuk
a pénzt?


A 50.000 dolláros célunkat a következőkre
használnánk:


a
	régi iskolaépület felújítsa
	(festés, ablakcserék…)


iskolai
	felszerelések beszerzése (bútorok,
	táblák, könyvek…)


a
	kert rendbe hozása (faültetés, kertrendezés…)


a
	tanári felszerelése (asztalok, számítógépek,
	nyomtatók…)


az
	elektromos hálózat
	karbantartása (lámpa csere, konnektorok…)

vizesblokkok felújítása
színházterem kialakítása
euritmiaterem kialakítása
zeneterem kialakítása (zongora, egyéb hangszerek)
kézimunka- és asztalos műhely kialakítása

iskolabusz-bérlés


a
	testnevelés terem felszerelése


Egyéb
módok ahogy segíthetsz: 



Ha
	szeretnél még nekünk segíteni, kérünk, hogy oszd meg minden
	lehetséges oldalon: facebook, twitter, és minden más. 
	


Ha
	kedvet érzel az önkéntes tevékenységekhez, legyen az építés,
	vagy más munkák, kérlek vedd fel velünk a kapcsolatot:
	aranyhalwaldorf@gmail.com

story:
WE ARE AVATAR VIRTUAL LEARNING

We're a group of professors, course developers and test administrators with over 40 years of combined experience in higher education.  We know college can be the incredible experience limited to those few who can afford the high cost of a higher education.  Right now too many students can't afford college.  They either never start, drop out part way or finish college with unmanageable student debt.  The 1.2 Trillion dollar bill being carried around by former students is a sign of the importance of the problem. We believe there is a way to make college affordable and lower the burden on students and taxpayers. We are starting our own non-institutional approach to getting college credit without college tuition cost.  A new model for higher education that pushes the burden on learning more on student shoulders and less on the expensive college institutional approach.


COLLEGE LEARNING REIMAGINED

All college education is fundamentally self-education. The purpose of a college degree program has always been to teach you how to learn and direct you to resources so you can use it to improve your knowledge and skills. For this reason most accredited universities fully recognize passing scores on the College-Level Examination Program (CLEP) tests as full credit in their degree programs. To graduate with an undergraduate degree, you’ll need to accumulate a minimum of 120 credits in 40 or so classes of which well over half can be tested out of using the CLEP program. This approach allows students with intelligence, ingenuity, drive, and persistence to complete their undergraduate studies with little or no financial aid including student loans. Getting a degree from the college of their choice with less than a year of tuition cost is a very real achievement that that only takes drive and persistence. We stand committed to helping students whose goal is a higher education find a affordable path to gaining it.


WHAT WILL IT BE LIKE TO BE AN AVATAR STUDENT?

Students don’t have to worry about an admissions process, student affairs offices, course offering schedules, qualifying for financial aid or other bureaucratic issues until it's time to enroll in their college. All they need to do to get started is register on the Avatar site and select the courses they feel comfortable about completing and testing for. Students can focus on one course at a time, finishing each one in a few weeks or do several at once taking a few months to complete.  Video lectures, text books and virtual labs along with real time student discussion is available for students. In addition the process of course selection and the work they put into them will help the students find what they are passionate about and what they might be good at. This allows students to better identify the future career for themselves and the path to reach it.  Help and support is available through peer to peer interaction and recommended support links. For a student studying full-time it’s possible to study for and pass a CLEP examination with course accreditation every few weeks.


WHY DO WE NEED YOUR HELP?

We took some of the first steps to making Avatar Learning a reality, but we need your support to take the next ones. We’re now raising funds on Indiegogo to develop the course content and infrastructure for 33 exams in five subject areas that the College Boards has approved for CLEP exams.  These course content shells modeled after traditional college online programs will covering the material taught in courses that are generally taken in the first few years of college. Indiegogo is an amazing platform designed to accelerate support for ideas like ours. After watching our video, we hope you'll share our excitement about making college more affordable to everyone and possibly reducing the country's 1.2 Trillion dollar student loan debt.  Our initial one course prototype (although limited) is fully functional at a college level of instruction.  We’re ready to move on to the next step of developing all 33 courses. Thanks to your support, our experienced staff will be ready to start production of course work at the end of the campaign. We're be all set to deliver college level course work for a small fraction of the cost of students attending a full college course schedule.


WHAT WILL THE FUNDS BE USED FOR?

Volunteer staff has gotten us this far but additional staff and support is needed. Our goal of $50,000 will enable us to get a space for the facilities, Avatar servers and content and development staff.


OUR CORE TEAM

Prof. David Gross ( PhD (e))

David is a computer engineer with over ten years teaching at the graduate and undergraduate level at colleges and universities.  David is a qualified Subject Matter Expert (SME) and over the years has received extensive training to create standardized online course shells for several universities. A number of his course shells are currently in use at major universities and online programs.  David has been innovating in the online education field for the past 5 years by improving course delivers, project emphasis and social media support. With Avatar learning he wants to brings this educational approach out of the expensive college environment.

Dr. John Frantz (Ph.D.)

John has had a 13 year teaching career as an economics lecturer before taking up a post in training and development at a major accreditation organization he was lead of a major training development initiative for the software industry. John has led many professional development programs, including a work-based learning degree designed specifically for adult learners in the workplace, and various Masters programs in management systems.

Proctor Hassania Aboutayeb (B.S., S.T.A.)

In 2008, Hassania developed early components of her school's test proctoring process and began working with the international students exchange as an assessment specialist.  In 2013, she transitioned to scheduling and placement operations. Her new responsibilities include providing leadership and direction in all aspects of operations to achieve strategic and business objectives.


WHAT DO YOU GET FOR YOUR CONTRIBUTION?

When you contribute to the Avatar Virtual learning effort you will become part of the higher education revolution! And you can also select some perks that will help you tell others about what we are doing so they can join us too.

Our feature perk for $25 is the Avatar Study Buddy. An official Avatar multi-color highlighter and computer brush perfect for the studious student. This fun figure has a computer brush on head and different color highlighter ink inside each limb.  It is an exclusive Avatar item only available for our Indiegogo backers. You also get a personalized thank you email from our founding group.

Our perk for $50 is the Avatar Happy Hub Guy, a 4-port USB hub. This fun figure lets you plug in your USB devices into the arms and legs to share one USB connection on the computer, perfect for the well connected (grin) student..  It is a fun and useful Avatar item available for our Indiegogo backers. You also get a personalized thank you email from our founding group.


Our top perk at the $100 level is a full registration into the Avatar Learning System for you or so you can gift it to a deserving student.  This membership will become available when the first stage of the system for 12 initial courses are completed (estimated June 2016).

Check out our full list of perks for additional details and to find the ones that are a good fit for you.


AVATAR LEARNING Q&A 

How easy is it to enroll in a course?

There is no individual course enrollment.  Students register for annual access to the service and have available all course material and assessments.

Is Avatar Learning valid at all colleges and universities? 

Avatar Learning is a college type program of study that prepares you for CLEP validation.  at your selected college or university.  Actual acceptance is left to the individual institute but at this time testing is accepted by over 2,900 colleges and universities.

When will I be able to access Avatar Learning?

With appropriate funding the first dozen courses should be available from the internet by mid 2016 with the next two dozen by the end of year 2016.

How long will each course take?

The material is self-paced with no set time allocated.  It is expected that student hours devoted to learning each course's set material would be equal to that of similar online college course (i.e. 75 hours).

What fees will be charged for each course.

The courses will not be charged individually.  Instead a small annual registration fee that provides access to all courses will be charged for system maintenance and course updates.

Is books and lab material included?

No, however each course will provide links to suitable study material including books, lectures, software and lab equipment. In the case of books an appropriate link to online book stores like Amazon will be included.

How can I contact you? 

You can email us at AvatarVirtualLearning@gmail.com, and we will get back to you as soon as possible!

Can you tell us more about the course and testing process?

Each course is broken down into sessions corresponding to the course objectives.  Students can complete each session then perform a self-assessment or if they already feel comfortable for that session material they can take the self-assessment first.  Once they feel comfortable with their mastery of the material a test CLEP exam on the subject can be taken.  The actual CLEP exam is done at the college of their choice or testing center for course completion credit.

How can I contact you? 
You can email us at AvatarVirtualLearning@gmail.com,
and we will get back to you as soon as possible!
Can you tell us more about the course
and testing process?
Each
course is broken down into sessions corresponding to the course
objectives.  Students can complete each
session then perform a self-assessment or if they already feel comfortable for
that session material they can take the self-assessment first.  Once they feel comfortable with their mastery
of the material a test CLEP exam on the subject can be taken.  The actual CLEP exam is done at the college
of their choice or testing center for course completion credit.

story:
It all started....

when several Polish parents, based on experiences with their own children, saw the need for a new approach to children in the pre-school age.
Through a network of friends the project was started, with enthusiasm and zeal.
A piece of land, with an old farm building on it, centrally situated in the village of Wołczkowo outside Szczecin, was purchased. It was thought that the building could be kept, renovated and turned into a kindergarten. Polish rules and regulations resulted in this becoming an unpredictably complicated, and very expensive enterprise.

Now, several years later

we have realized that a new, purpose built building is a safer and more reliable option, and the intervening time has been used to extend our network of co-workers, reaching into the village, but also including The National Spiritual Assembly of the Bahá'ís of Poland, The Anisa Foundation in Germany, and a Kindergarten with similar aims and principles, Wilde 9, in Guest in Germany, only two hours drive from us.
One of our co-workers, Ela, has taken a diploma in child care and Ala, with a batchelor in pedagogy, and about to complete her masters in pedagogy, has joined the group.

When fully operating

our kindergarten will 'stand on four legs':

1) The understanding that man is a spiritual being, and only an education that takes into account the body, mind and soul can help the child to develop his or her full potential.

2) A bi-lingual environment, where English is used in songs and games, to underline that we are world-citizens and live in a world that is becoming one country.

3) An awareness of the environment eg. food will be organically grown, preferably locally produced, and the children can explore, or help in our garden / playground.

4) Consultation, as used in Bahá'í administration, will be used in all decision making and conflict resolution.

We have come a fair way

but need a helping hand with the economy in order to finish the building.

You can help

By contributing to this crowd funding effort.

By sharing the link with all your friends, neighbours, relatives and colleagues.

With funds available, our builder will finish the building and we'll open the kindergarten as soon as possible after that.

When up and running we plan to be financially self-sufficient.

story:
Hello everyone! Daisy here, Krueger Middle School's 8th grade volleyball coach. This is my second year coaching and teaching here at Krueger and I am loving every minute of it. While we had a very successful year winning more games last season than in the past 5 seasons, we were still missing a few essentials that would help us improve our game, but more importantly, help build the confidence and self esteem of these young ladies. The 7th and 8th grade teams lack enough basic equipment for the teams to effectively practice. They need more equipment such as balls, ball carts, and nets. Furthermore, through no fault of their own, some of the girls cannot even afford proper gym shoes, kneepads, or a water bottle

My goal here is to purchase new volleyballs, ball carts, ball bags for away games, nets, a proper net storage system, reusable water bottles, knee pads, uniform shorts, a few pair of shoes, and snacks for each game for both 7th and 8th grade teams.

We all know middle school is a challenging time of a child’s life. We also know that organized sports can contribute to a person’s well being and success later in life. Please invest a little to improve this sports opportunity for these young ladies. Your contribution will also help future athletes at Krueger Middle School. We really appreciate your time, effort, kindness, and resources put into our goals of having an even more successful season!
