story:
•  had the pleasure of working with Tiffany Dion. I have coached her for film and television as well as taught an on-camera class that she attended.  Tiffany is an amazing young actress.  She is committed to her craft, believable, natural and always prepared.  Tiffany has the ability to stay in character and has a raw talent that always enhances her performance. She takes direction well and always keeps you wanting more.  It is my pleasure to recommend Tiffany for any and everything.  She will be an asset to any set and is a directors dream.  I feel very fortunate to have worked with her and I  know she will shine in all situations!”
 - Marjorie Morhaim, Manager, Casting Director, Coach

"Tiffany Dion is one of the best working actresses in Central Florida, and it has been a pleasure to work with her on multiple projects. This girl has it, and I can't wait to see where her career goes from here!" - Steven Shea, Director

"As Producer of the music video "Memory" and the short film "The Devil's Waltz", I had the pleasure of working with Tiffany. I was impressed with her maturity, professionalism and ability to immerse herself into her character.  Her role in "The Devil's Waltz" was incredibly emotional and challenging.  Her performance is riveting as a young foster girl who is preyed upon by her foster father.  Tiffany is an exceptional young actress who has amazing talent.  I look forward to seeing her continued accomplishments in this industry! " - Melissa Gruver, Producer

"I had the pleasure of working with Tiffany recently, and I was blown away with her talent.  It’s not every day I come across a young actor who can turn on the water works in an instant. When she wasn’t on screen she was diligently running her lines. Such a professional. I considered myself lucky to watch her performance through my viewfinder, and look forward to following her career.  She’s going to be big." - Ryan Dean, Cinematographer, Director, Photographer

"As a director, I have worked with Tiffany Dion on three separate projects.  She has been the lead actor in two of those projects.  In the time that I have worked with Tiffany, I have yet to hear a complaint from her.  Her attitude is exceptional and her commitment to these projects and to her roles is impressive.  I have no doubt that Ms. Dion will continue to find success and opportunity in the industry.  She is willing to work hard, readily accepts criticism and is committed to excellence.  I sincerely hope my last project with Tiffany will NOT be my last!" - Dale Metz, Director/Cinematographer

"From a 'Production' perspective, Tiffany brings an incredible amount of preparation and professionalism to set. Nails her lines. Hits her marks. Delivers emotional commitment in every scene and is a joy be around.  From a 'Programmer' perspective, I know that when I see a project that has cast Tiffany, I can expect her to elevate the production and the material." - Tim Anderson, Programming Coordinator, Florida Film Festival

“Tiffany Dion isn't merely a vocal technique and performance student of mine. She is a dear, sweet friend whom I have had the privilege to watch grow and give tools to aid her in the process of becoming a winning singer/actress. Tiffany has a voice made for the musical theatre ingenue and the style and beauty to keep her in demand. Margie Haber will be such an asset to her career. Tiffany just needs to act and needs to sing. She strives for excellence in her roles and doesn't stop until her directors are pleased and proud of her performance.” - Carolyn Douras Fallin, Vocal, Voiceover and Dialect Coach

story:
John Jeevaratnam is a professional designer / artist. He has 5+ years of post secondary school education in full time, post graduate & professional development studies. His career competencies have taken him to Broadcast Media Design, Digital Media Design and Illustration. He has worked in-house full-time with CBC (Canadian Broadcasting Corporation) and NBC in America as a Graphic Designer.

After spending many years in design production, it was time for John to step away from full-time editorial design work and branch out and expand on his competencies. Expanding from his college experience in photography, John began building a portfolio from his passion in nature photography and found his next step, Photo Journalism. Having experience working for news agencies, getting out of the office to get the shots was appealing to him. Currently studying Photojournalism with New York Institute of Photography, John has spent his time and money building his toolbox of equipment.

John is searching for funding to support his passion in Photography.

He has maintained a blog site with over 350 followers for over 2.5 years, called:

www.everything-nature.com

He also has a photography site:

http://johnjeevaratnam.com

https://johnjeevaratnam.carbonmade.com

story:
About Anupshahr, Where We Are!

Anupshahr is a tehsil, situated on the banks of the Ganges, comprising of several villages in the district of Bulandshahr in Western Uttar Pradesh state in India.

The place is also infamous for widespread poverty, unemployment and illiteracy. The condition of women and girls is even worse in the highly patriarchal societal arrangements there.

In the villages where we work, girls and women rank the lowest in societal hierarchy. Spending on education for girls is considered to be a waste as parents are highly concerned about marrying her off soon. Due to such mind-sets, daughters are considered to a burden in the families and are always neglected over sons. Women work continuously in fields and other household chores and are still the victims of domestic violence and again, seen as a burden.

Main occupations are farming and labour work – and both earn very less income. There are fewer opportunities to engage in occupations that led to economic and social growth of the families. For girls and women especially, there are almost no other options than assisting their families in farming, which doesn’t led to any added income.

Most of the families are below poverty line in Anupshahr and many of them have no access to electricity, basic healthcare facilities, or even access to toilets for that matter.

What we do at Pardada Pardadi

Empowering girls and women through education and employment

Pardada Pardadi Educational Society has been working in Anupshahr since 2000, having initiated several programmes for economic and social empowerment of girls and women.

Education for girls has been the core of Pardada Pardadi’s initiatives. We run four Pardada Pardadi Schools in Anupshahr which provide free education from Kindergarten to class XII, to nearly 1400 girls from marginalised communities from over 65 villages. The school has pioneered the ‘Ten rupees a Day’ model wherein students receive a scholarship for each day’s attendance, to encourage their families.

We also work through Self-Help Groups with over 2000 women from nearly 50 villages providing them skills training and employment opportunities.

Quality schooling for girls that offers a complete package of academic education, personality development classes, exposure through sports, cultural activities, computer training, English speaking, food and nutrition, health and hygiene – aiming at the holistic growth of the girls; Transportation to school and back home, for girls coming from far off villages – bicycles and school buses, depending on the distance; Rs. 10 being credited to every girl’s account starting class VI, for a day’s attendance at school; Opportunities for girls to engage in meaningful vocational learning and pursuing dignified employment opportunities later, thereby bringing their families out of the trap of poverty; Career counselling of girls and trainings and exposure for their overall personality development; Four girls from Pardada Pardadi, have also been selected for Community College Initiative Programme by US Govt. to study in the US for a year; Engaging the girls in a variety of cultural activities that challenge the regressive social norms and raise awareness on creating an environment that encourages mental and physical growth of girls; Healthcare and counselling on adolescent issues which otherwise is unimaginable for the girls in the community; Mobilising the women from the community into Self Help Groups that empower them socially as well as economically, through group savings; Offering vocational trainings to the women and jobs to sustain their families comfortably; Distribution of solar lanterns to the families from villages at subsidised rates; getting individual toilets made in the houses of our regular students and getting community toilets made in the villages.

Time and again, we have tried to awaken the community to be sensitive towards the rights of their daughters and women. For example, through Ganga Arti (prayer of the holy river Ganga (Ganges) by girls, the way male priests have been doing for centuries – to challenge the male dominance in this field and to challenge the norm that restricts the women from worshipping during their menstrual cycle) and Rural Marathon (marathon for girls and women, encouraging them to come out and claim spaces – girls otherwise are expected to be homely and not go out of their homes at all - playing and running are unimaginable for adolescent girls)

In 2012, PPES launched the sports initiative as an additional means to inculcate leadership skills, confidence, endurance and team spirit amongst its students.

In 2014, the first Pardada Pardadi Half Marathon was organised in which 1000+ runners participated. PPES goes beyond education by implementing a number of community development initiatives spanning gender empowerment, financial empowerment and health and hygiene.

We need your help!

Half Marathon for promoting the girl child in rural villages on 23rd August 2015

We are holding the event on 23rd August 2015, on the theme ‘Aao Saath Chalein’ to promote the ‘Right to Play’ especially among the girls in the villages. The girls come from the communities where they are treated as inferior humans to boys. We, through our school and other initiatives, have been trying to break this and our girls have been setting new standards by participating in a variety of sports at different levels, competing with the world and becoming role models for other girls.

Marathon is one such initiative through which we are trying to promote this cause and encouraging girls from the community to come out and claim the surroundings. This also goes to encourage the parents to provide their girls with equal opportunities to learn, grow and explore as much as they provide for their boys.

In light of the recent campaigns to promote the right to play in the country, we really feel that more of such initiative should be organised. In a highly patriarchal society like Anupshahr, such initiatives matter all the more. This marathon would be our attempt to engage our girls from Pardada Pardadi as well as from surrounding villages, in play and other such expressions which enable their physical and mental growth. This would also go a long way in developing their personalities, enlightening the parents and encouraging them to give equal opportunities to their girls to grow and live!

We solicit your participation in this run for the girl child!

Please help us make this event a success by donating for organising it.

We are organising the event with a professional marathon event management organization named “Run with Me” and the marathon will be held in Anupshahar (Bulandshahr, Uttar Pradesh). The total population of the village is approx. 2,00,000 from which expected population of more than 20,000 will be viewing these events.

Total expected runners are going to be approx. 2000 plus which include girls from our school, local runners, runners from Bulandshar, Delhi, other non-governmental organisations, participants from corporates etc.

Through this event, we aim at raising a minimum of Rs. 20,00,000. The budget for the direct and indirect costs for organising the event is approximately Rs. 10,00,000 and we aim at raising an equal amount to support free-of-cost education, health and nutrition and skill building programmes for the girls from villages of Anupshahr. It would also be utilised for the women empowerment initiatives of Pardada Pardadi.

So, we urge you to raise your hands and yourself to come with us for the cause and initiative we are working on to create a better India for our coming future.

Anybody donating for the cause is registered free for the marathon!

Let’s run for our girls together!

Your presence and participation in the marathon would be very encouraging for our girls and women from these villages and also for Pardada Pardadi team.

Details for the marathon are as follows:

Minimum Age Eligibility:

ü  Half Marathon – 18 years as on 23rd August 2015

ü  5 Kms and 10 Kms – 18 years as on 23rd August 2015

Remember, you donation would go a long way in creating a society that cherishes its girls and where girls are given all the opportunity to grow and learn in a dignified way, thereby leading to girls’ empowerment in rural villages.

Donate for the cause!

Spread the word!

Give wings to our girls to fly!

story:
Short Summary

Summer is one of the best times of the year for children.  School is out and the weather is hot! As individuals and families plan for vacations, and other summer activities, many children and families here in Michigan have serious concerns. 

Did you know in Michigan, over ninety-seven thousand (97,000) individuals, including children, were counted homeless during 2014 and that Michigan ranked number five (5) in the United States and first in the Midwest for homeless residents? Giving attention to this growing population, especially children and their educational needs, we are CALLING FOR YOUR SUPPORT to aid approximately five hundred (500) children residing in homeless shelters in Metropolitan Detroit and surrounding areas with new backpacks complete with grade-appropriate school supplies! Today, you can make a difference in the lives of children in DETROIT!

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking two hundred (200) individuals to set aside the price of one (1) lunch and donate ten dollars ($10) or more to champion this cause for the purchase of backpacks and necessary school supplies for the upcoming school year.

The Impact

“Help Children in Detroit get “Back on Track”. In connecting with five (5) agencies that service families and children in Metropolitan Detroit and surrounding areas, children and families have been identified that include Hispanic, Caucasian, Arab, and African American population. 
We need your support by Monday, August 24, 2015.  No gift is too small! “Together we make a difference one individual at a time and one community at a time.”

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean YOU cannot help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about THIS campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo, FB, Twitter, Instragram as share tools!

Paula Ratchford Ministries is a faith-based 501(c) 3 non-profit organization with a mission to enhance and improve the social and economic status of impoverished and underserved individuals and communities. 

CALLING ALL CHAMPIONS: There is a CAUSE in Detroit, and you are part of the ANSWER!

story:
Thank you so much for checking out my Breath of Bliss campaign. I have been studying and working in the healing arts for over 20 years. I am a Reiki Master, Sound Healer and Intuitive Coach. I love sharing this powerful work.

Breath work has been a powerful catalyst for healing and positive change in my life and I'm so excited to become a facilitator for this healing work. 

For several years I worked in a luxury service field and felt far from the healing practice I love. I was helping people, I worked with some amazing women and the job was glamorous - but I still had that little voice in my head telling me I was meant to be working in the healing arts. I was not living my true calling and purpose. And, when you don't heed that little voice, Spirit will do it for you. The proverbial rug was pulled out from underneath me and not only did I lose my job but very shortly after that my health crashed and I found out I was very ill.  I have been on an intense journey of self-healing. And breath work has been a key component in my current vitality, happiness and health.

Because I have had so many leaps and bounds in my physical, emotional and spiritual growth through my own breath work practice, I feel called to facilitate the beautiful Breath of Bliss for others. The Breath of Bliss is profoundly transformational. This work releases stress, quiets the mind and is deeply detoxifying.

Breath is Life. The body uses the oxygen in your breath for energy. Without breath we cease to live. Our breath not only keeps us alive but dictates the very quality of our life. I am so excited to share this work with you.

My vision for this campaign is a co-creation of mutual support. I'm on a mission to share breath work with as many people as possible. I have created some healing offerings here at a deep discount to support your journey as you in turn support mine. My intention is to return with new tools and teachings to share with those who feel called to work with me. I hope that you can feel the depth of my intention through what I have shared here and are inspired to contribute. 

To see a video about the Breath of Bliss Ceremony you can click on the link at the top of the page that says "Gallery". The video is around 3 minutes and will give you a great feeling for this work. 

If you have any questions feel free to contact me. Just click on the pink "Contact" link above to send me a message. 

I would be honored to guide you through a Breath of Bliss ceremony or individual Breath of Bliss healing session upon my return. 

I am here to support you. 

All LOVE and BLESSINGS, Kristi


__________________________________________________________

Campaign Funds

The funds from this campaign will go towards my travel to and participation in the facilitator training for Breath of Bliss. Your investment in your own healing will give me the momentum to bring this work to the world. 

Facilitator Training: $2,399.00

Airfare: $1,326.00

Lodging: 17 nights @ $28 per night: $476.00

story:
What is Youth Yoga?

If you ask us what we could change about our yoga practice, it would only be that we wish we found it sooner.  

This is precisely what Diana became conscious of one day during meditation.  The health and well being benefits she experienced from her mindfulness exercises made her realize that if only people were introduced to Yoga from an early age, people would be happier as stress, anger and anxiety would be greatly diminished. She knew that at a large scale, this could change the world.  She was compelled to act on this feeling, so she decided to assemble a group of people and organize what was originally supposed to be a one week community event in a few low income schools.  Yoga teachers would volunteer their time and take over PE class at no cost to the school.  The event was so successful that it's needless to say, Youth Yoga quickly turned into a non-for-profit organization!


How does the YY program work?
Youth Yoga meets with the Principals of each school and builds a program that is tailored to the school's specific needs and curriculum.  Our programs all follow the learning pillars required by the California Board of Education and focuses on physical and mindfulness exercises that give students strength, confidence and piece of mind.

Currently, YY has a year-long program at Abraham Lincoln, a LAUSD high school in the heart of Downtown Los Angeles. YY is also starting a program with an all female at risk transitional high school,  and we are developing a curriculum for a LAUSD middle school servicing before and after school programs.
Presently, Youth Yoga's certified instructors and staff volunteer their time and they are assisted by a team of ambassadors based upon appropriate ratios of teacher to student.
 

YY needs You! 

Physical Education teachers have also participated alongside their students and have raved about the difference they've noticed in their student's behavior and overall performance in school.  

The demand for YY programs is growing fast and we are committed to being in as many schools as possible.  Our vision is to start locally and grow into a national and global organization!  We know that with your help, we can achieve our mission!

As we apply for grants and government funding, our programs depend on us, the community.  No amount is too small and every dollar makes a difference in a teenager's success.  To make it easy, we've evaluated that: Every 50$ contribution is equivalent to the full operations of 1 certified yoga instructor, for 1 period, at 1 school.

Several schools are interested in  having YY as part of their permanent curriculum and we need to raise 75 000$ in order to fulfill these demands rapidly.  If we don't reach our goal, we will not be able to fulfill the high demand, program development and our involvement with schools will be delayed and ultimately the impact on our Youth will not be at it's full potential.  However, whether we reach our goal or not, your generous contributions do help us progress and move forward in sustaining our current programs.

We've put together a collection of fun perks as a symbol of gratitude to you.  Most of them involve Robert Sturman Photography.  Robert is a beautifully talented artist who's captured extraordinary photos of his subjects doing Yoga.  His photography has been featured in the New York Times and can be found on his website http://www.robertsturmanstudio.com

We can't wait to get you your goodies and thank you for helping us make this campaign successful!


Other Ways You Can Help!

There are so many ways you can help us reach our goal!  

Please share this link with everybody and tell them about our mission.  The more people know about our campaign, the faster we can reach our goal and get these kids some awesome yoga!

If you are interested in going beyond your contribution on our campaign, please visit our website and sign up to be one of our volunteer ambassadors.  If you are a certified Yoga instructor and would like to work with us, please let us know! 

Our email is youthyogaweek@gmail.com and our website is http://www.youthyoga.com

PLEASE SPREAD THE WORD BY USING THE INDIEGOGO SHARE TOOLS!!

Thank you!!

Namaste

story:
Phase 1: $36,000

Fight BDS infomercial and educational literature.

With the growing pressure being felt by donors to take part in the BDS movement against Israeli Academics it is important for us to join together to fight this senseless attack. 

We Fund The Cure helps fund vital medical research projects at Ariel University. Recently we had large donors pull $1.5m in funding at the last minute due to BDS. While we respect a donor's right to be comfortable with their decision to donate to the cause of their choice we must take action to correct this injustice.

Here at WFTC, we cannot sit back and watch valuable medical research not continue simply because of where a university is located. 

Ariel University has one of the most diverse campuses in Israel.  I challenge you to find a more diverse and vibrant community anywhere in the Middle East. The students of Ariel are a patchwork of races, religions, and students from around the world.  To punish a non-political Academic Institution is wrong no matter your world political view.

The vital research being carried out at Ariel University will be given freely to everyone, no matter the gender, race, country of origin, or religious affiliation of the patient.

This is why we have started this grassroots campaign.  We are not going to attack people's choices; instead we are going to turn to the larger enlightened global community as a whole, those who are not swayed by half-truths and aggressive smear campaigns.  Because the truth needs no defense, it by design is absolute!

We Fund the Cure is asking you, to help us, help Ariel University and to fight the falseness and hatred against Israel Academics.

Phase 2: Crowd-funding and social media campaign to replace $1.5m lost for medical research due to BDS

story:
www.syedmahmoodkazmi.com Short Summary

As part of my Birthday goals, I am raising funds for the refugee of Syria to make my birthday memorable and help the people in need.

As you know the recent story of Aylan Kurdi, a 3 year old kid whose country has been burning in the fire of war from past years. His parents Abdullah and Rehen wanted a safe future for their kids, Aylan & 4 year old brother Galip. 

Their goal was the same like any other human being, a better and safe future. They practiced the same along with thousands of people fleeing from violence and flooded towards neighbors and Europe. Sadly, their ship was drown which resulted in the drowning of 2 year old Aylan, his brother and mother.

Read the complete story here on the website of CNN.

I am raising funds as part of my birthday goals to help the Syrian Refugees and the donations will be handed over to either UNHCR or International Red Cross Red Crescent Movement by hand in their offices in New York.

Who I am?

My name is Syed Mahmood Kazmi, a humanitarian, Red Crosser and Human Rights Activist. I have done Masters in Sociology and Masters of Advanced Studies in Peace and Conflict Transformation from University of Basel, Switzerland.

Read my story on the website of IFRC here.


What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • I am setting up the initial goal of $1000 for the Syrian Refugees.
  • The money will be handed-over in person to the representatives of UNHCR or International Red Cross Red Crescent Movement.
  • I will make sure to question the representatives in person and will ask about the level of support they need, transparency and will engage them for better delivery of help.
  • Whatever will be raised in this time, will be used in the relief or comfort of the Syrian refugees.

The Impact

Our combined efforts can really make a big difference in the lives of Syrian Refugees who are fleeing the violence in their country.

  • My small effort is part of the activities, I have been engaged with throughout the years especially helping the vulnerable.
  • In past, I have successfully raised the funds for the victims of disasters like floods and earthquake in Pakistan. It changed many lives.
  • Your single effort or donation will help and ease the lives of many people around the globe. It's our time to make a difference from wherever we live.

Risks & Challenges

I personally would be interested to volunteer or help the Syrian Refugees as part of my previous experience with Pakistan Red Crescent Society and International Red Cross Red Crescent Movement. 

  • I am a dreamer, doer and believer. It's time to DO SOMETHING now. 
  • Even a single dollar (1$) can help. 
  • Don't be shy in helping your fellow global citizens of the planet Earth.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • If you can't help financially, No problem! You can still help by getting the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Let's own this campaign. It's our global cause.
  • You can always use the Indiegogo share tools! Please share it on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram or wherever possible. Someone out there might help just because of your single share.

And that's all there is to it. Use the hashtag #LetsHelpSyrianRefugeesNow
More: www.syedmahmoodkazmi.com

story:
WHAT IN THE WORLD AM I DOING?

It's not just me...WE'RE BUILDING A SCHOOL IN KENYA! What a THRILL. For those of you who don't know me, my name is Kamari and I just got back from one of the craziest experiences of my life. I went to Kenya on a relief/missions trip and got my heart handed to me when I visited the Precious Kids Center in Kitale. Small but mighty, The Precious Kids Center serves children with disabilities to provide the support they need to learn, grow, and reach their full potential. Many of the children live on the current property. The founder and director of the center is Sammy Hammork, a 20 something rock star from Orange County,CA who MOVED to Kitale and now takes care of the kids on every level possible. From their health, education, and emotional support Sammy literally does it all... frequently will little help. This last week through generous donors, God has provided the funds to finish a new home for the children currently living at Precious Kids Center! There are currently 38 kids and four house mothers packed into a little house on less than a quarter of an acre. It’s crowded and, though the kids don’t seem to mind, they have all been patiently working towards the goal of moving the new property where there will be more space to learn play and grow. I personally spent a couple of days at the current property and fell in love with the children. There are many difficulties but I have so much hope in their future and this center will provide more than an education but a home. My goal is to get the new school built asap and get the kids learning and thriving on their new campus! 

What We Need & What You Get

So here is the quick and dirty:

  • PHASE 1:  Buy the land- 1 Acre - $22,225
  • PHASE 2: The classrooms -1 Classroom  $5,531 // 10 classrooms needed for a total of $55,310. This may seem like a lot of money but people literally fund personal EP & album projects for the same amount. We're building an entire school! THIS CAN AND WILL BE DONE. 

There will be a few surprises for donors as we get closer and closer to our goal. So, other than giving out of the kindness of your heart there's that to look forward to. WHO DOESNT LIKE SURPRISES!?

The Impact

  • In my time in Kenya I saw a lot of things that seemed hopeless. Women and children sleeping in garbage and having to do unbelievable things just to get through the day.  Even with that the children were that bright light that proved that not only was there a hope but there is a future. We take so many things for granted, this school is investing in potential to some who may not otherwise see their purpose lived out. This center will indeed save lives. It already has. 
  • This is my 3rd fundraising project. Every one I've ever launched has funded. Not because of me, but because of the grace of God and the generosity of others. This is the largest fundraiser I've ever done which will take an even larger amount of faith. That tells me God is already at work. It's building my faith and I hope it builds yours.

Risks & Challenges

Like anything worth working for there are a few hurdles that may be faced. In specifics to this project there's the process of changing the ownership of the land and getting all of the building permits that are needed before we can start construction. BUT GOD IS BIGGER THAN ALL OF THIS! So, I challenge you to 40 days of PRAYER. All you have to do is lift this project up in your prayers. If you cant give financially then please say a prayer for Sammy and these kids. In addition to your prayers PLEASE share this campaign on all your social media platforms. Help this campaign spread like wildfire. WE HAVE 40 DAYS!!!

PHASE 1:  Buy the land- 1 Acre - $22,225


PHASE 2: The classrooms -1 Classroom  $5,531 // 10 classrooms needed for a total of $55,310. This may seem like a lot of money but people literally fund personal EP & album projects for the same amount. We're building an entire school! THIS CAN AND WILL BE DONE. 


There will be a few surprises for donors as we get closer and closer to our goal. So, other than giving out of the kindness of your heart there's that to look forward to. WHO DOESNT LIKE SURPRISES!?
The Impact

In my time in Kenya I saw a lot of things that seemed hopeless. Women and children sleeping in garbage and having to do unbelievable things just to get through the day.  Even with that the children were that bright light that proved that not only was there a hope but there is a future. We take so many things for granted, this school is investing in potential to some who may not otherwise see their purpose lived out. This center will indeed save lives. It already has. 

This is my 3rd fundraising project. Every one I've ever launched has funded. Not because of me, but because of the grace of God and the generosity of others. This is the largest fundraiser I've ever done which will take an even larger amount of faith. That tells me God is already at work. It's building my faith and I hope it builds yours.

Risks & Challenges
Like anything worth working for there are a few hurdles that may be faced. In specifics to this project there's the process of changing the ownership of the land and getting all of the building permits that are needed before we can start construction. BUT GOD IS BIGGER THAN ALL OF THIS! So, I challenge you to 40 days of PRAYER. All you have to do is lift this project up in your prayers. If you cant give financially then please say a prayer for Sammy and these kids. In addition to your prayers PLEASE share this campaign on all your social media platforms. Help this campaign spread like wildfire. WE HAVE 40 DAYS!!!

story:
Short Summary

This team is a student run organization in which all proceeds help to pay for steel fabrication costs. We are very competitive, and involved in annual competitions.

What We Need & What You Get

The United Steel Bridge Club of City College of New York designs and constructs a bridge each year within the constraints of the ASCE National Steel Bridge Competition Guidelines. The American Society of Civil Engineers United Steel Bridge Club of City College of New York would like to request your assistance in financially supporting our organization.

The team is trying to fundraise $2000 to be used toward materials for the bridge. Although this amount will not completely cover the cost of fabricating the bridge, your contribution will be greatly appreciated.

The Impact

Your support will help the USBC Team represent their program at regionals at NJIT in New Jersey.

Going to regionals will provide the team members the experience needed for the program to grow and improve.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute financially, please let your friends know about this project. You can use Facebook, Twitter, Indiegogo share tools to spread the word.

story:
I was trying to find good books and courses for preparing USMLE steps and I was paying lots of money for them. Finally I had bits of what I was looking for and considerably less money. It took me a lot to build the puzzle from bits. I passed the exams and got the ECFMG certification.


But I still couldn't find what I wanted. It's about concise information, analytical and visual, that would be available for free, easily, that any medicine student or medicine professional could access on the go.


Right now, www.askmish.com is a blog where I uploaded synthesis of few major medicine chapters. But there are so many more to come. In order to be able to provide these, this is what I needed to do in the coming months and this is where I need your help:
  - 6 more presentations: EKG interpretation, Drugs, Cardiology, Pulmonary diseases, Gastroenterology, Nephrology. Deadline: December 15th, 2015
  - upgrade from blog to website in 6 months to 1 year. Deadline: December 15th, 2015
  - designing the mobile interface of the website in 6 months to 1 year so everyone could see the website well on mobiles. Deadline: December 15th, 2015


Total cost: around 10000$


During those months  time will be occupied with finishing 6 presentations, attending classes for web design and replacing pictures on presentation slides with animated graphics  (4700$ cost per year), buying all the books and courses (around 500$) necessary for preparing the presentations, possible electronic equipment repair or replacement ( max. 1400$), upgrade from blog to website (around 2000$) designing mobile interface (4-500$), looking for new sponsors for finishing all Internal Medicine (10 more chapters) in 2016.
Any medicine professional knows how difficult is to find coherent information and my website could easily meet this need for the benefit of all of us.

story:
School Vision:

Our vision for all Rosewood students is that they acquire a far different set of knowledge, skills and perspectives than previous generations.  They will be prepared to share with, work alongside and communicate with persons from different backgrounds.  We will begin the teaching necessary for our students to be better prepared to understand and confront complex global issues as they continue on their academic journey.

Our Story:

My name is Linda Crowder and I am the proud principal at Rosewood Elementary, School for Advanced Studies (SAS), home of the HUSKIES!  This is my 7th year as the principal at Rosewood.  During my tenure we became a SAS in 2011, with a focus on Project Based Learning which is strongly tied to the CCSS and 21st Century Skills. Rosewood is a Transitional Kindergarten (TK) through 6th grade campus located in a densely populated area of Los Angeles and West Hollywood. We were one of 37 schools within the LAUSD and only 1 of 4 schools in Local District 4 to pilot the TK program in 2010, so we have the evidence to support the importance of early education and differentiation.  Approximately 325 students attend Rosewood: there is 1 TK, 2 first grades, 2 second grades, 2 third grades, 2 forth grades, 1 fifth grade, 1 sixth grade and 2 Autism Core special day classes.  I have 15 classroom teachers and one resource specialist.  I have no out of classroom personnel.

Though our neighborhood student enrollment is increasing, most of our students attend under either work permit (parent works in the neighborhood), open enrollment (we are school of choice), or inter district permit (student resides in a different school district).  Many of our parents work at Cedars-Sinai Hospital, The Beverly Center, local hotels, other various businesses in the neighborhood and some work as nannies. Students come to us from Palmdale, the San Fernando Valley, Inglewood, South Gate, and many other areas throughout LA County and because of this we are a very diverse school.

Demographics:  40% Latino

  26% African American

  26% White

  3.9% Korean

  2.7% Filipino

  .9% Chinese

  .9% Japanese

  .3% Laotian

  .3% American Indian

  .6% Indian

  1.3% Other

Rosewood Elementary is a school wide Title I school.  “Title I is part of the Elementary and Secondary Education act of 1965, and is the foundation of the federal commitment to closing the achievement gap between low-income and other students.  The 1994 reauthorization of Title I shifted the program’s emphasis from remedial education to helping all disadvantaged children reach rigorous state academic standards expected of all children”. Approximately 54% of our students are eligible for free or reduced lunch.  We provide all students with free breakfast through a program called Breakfast in the Classroom.  Students staying in an after school program receive a free meal through a program called Supper at School.  I have students in homeless situations, parents that are or were incarcerated, and families struggling to put food on the table.  I take students regularly to Operation School Bell, an organization that provides new school clothes to students from impoverished circumstances. By working with these children, we improve school attendance, promote learning and enhance self-esteem.

As a School for Advanced Studies, we begin early identification of gifted youth, beginning in Transitional Kindergarten. We received “Exemplary” status based on the school-site GATE data and comprehensive school wide Gifted and Talented Education (GATE) program narrative.  We also exceeded the District’s 6% identification goal for African American, Latino, or school wide population. 

Though we are a School for Advanced Studies we believe in educating the whole child.  Though we live in a global society that requires students to think critically and creatively and solve complex problems; we must first ensure that the basic needs of our students are met so that they can be active participants in their learning.  We follow Maslow's hierarchy of needs, a theory of human developmental psychology in which basic needs must be met before one can grow.  Maslow used the terms "physiological" (food, water, etc.), "safety" (feeling safe), "emotional" (feelings of belonging and love) and "esteem" (feeling good about oneself), and "self-actualization" (reaching full potential). I have students who worry about their next meal, having a place to sleep, and abuse or neglect in the home.  For these students in particular engaging in an academic setting is not their priority.  As a school we have many services to help at risk youth as well as all youth – we offer after school tutoring during our first semester and Saturday School during our second semester.  The National Council of Jewish Women provides a homework club twice a week for students in need,  Koreah  L.A. sends volunteer readers to read to and with students needing additional supports as well as self- esteem boosts, Cedars-Sinai Hospital provides an art therapy program, at the school site, to students that have suffered some type of trauma, and students take part in The Morning Mile, a running club that takes place before the start of the school day to get them motivated for the day and as a means to address the issue of childhood obesity .

Why are we running this campaign?

We are running a campaign to raise $ 278,634.  This funding is for a Technology Media Lab.

“In the 21st century, students must be fully engaged.  This requires the use of technology tools and resources, involvement with interesting and relevant projects, and learning environments – including online environments – that are supportive and safe.

…In the 21st century educators must be given and be prepared to use technology tools; they must be collaborators in learning – constantly seeking knowledge and acquiring new skills along with their students.”

  • Arne Duncan, U.S. Secretary of Education

    We currently have a computer lab with the old iMAC 3g’s, those colorful plastic bubble type computers.  It is a working lab and allows students the opportunity to word process, research, use some educational software, and to take their Accelerated Reader (AR) online tests.  With Common Core State Standards and the charge to ensure that all students are college and career ready in literacy no later than 12th grade, we must be able to provide all of our students and teachers with the tools to be successful.

    Rosewood students are at a disadvantage in that the state tests administered to students in grades 3 – 12 are no longer pencil paper tests, but done on a device.  The test is called the SBAC – Smarter Balanced Assessment Consortium.  Students that do not have access to the necessary technology may not do as well and when the scores begin to count, these students will not have the same academic opportunities.  One example of this is when students in grades 2 – 12 took the California Standards Test (CST); those scores were part of the documentation for eligibility in the Gifted and Talented Education program.  We are going into year three of this test.  During the rollout two years ago, Rosewood Elementary was given 35 iPads with keyboards for students to use during testing and the iPads were removed from the school after testing.  During this last school year we were given 70 iPads with keyboards for students to use for testing and I am grateful that they were not taken at the end of the school year.  My students will be able to begin the 2015-2016 school year with this working technology.

    With this information you may be wondering “Why a Technology Media Lab and not just give every child a device”?  Placing an iPad in a child’s hand without either the child or teacher knowing what to do with the device is not a good use of resources.  We are viewing this campaign as the first of two fundraising campaigns.  This campaign will fund a Technology Media Lab and the second campaign will be to place a device in every student’s hand. 

    During this campaign our goal is to have a Technology Media Lab with a fully credentialed technology teacher, a lab with both pc’s and mac’s so our students know how to use different computers, students will learn typing and basic and advanced computer skills, students will learn to make and edit movies, create websites or pod-casts, learn to code, art design, and be able to learn these things through active learning.  Teachers and Teaching Assistants will be provided necessary professional development to ensure they know how to use the technology and how to integrate that technology into the classroom.  The Technology Media Lab will ensure the 21st Century Skills of communication, collaboration, creativity and innovation along with providing students with the much needed media and technology skills are being met.

    The Technology Media Lab teacher will also assist teachers with integrating the use of technology into the curriculum as well as the appropriate in class use of the iPads.  This year we will have 5 Smartboards in 5 classrooms, the Technology Media Lab teacher will also work with these teachers to ensure they are effectively using the Smartboards in the classrooms.

    The Technology Media Lab teacher will:

  • teach students in grades TK – 6 how to use the technology in the Technology Lab
  • stress the importance of the safe use of technology at school, at home, and in the community
  • train and support classroom teachers in the use of technology to supplement instruction
  • facilitate technology integration training and professional development for teachers and teacher assistants
  • train teachers in the use of media, equipment, and technology to support technology integration in the instructional program
  • develop and train teachers to develop technology integrated Common Core lessons
  • use knowledge about current ideas, trends, methods, programs, and equipment for technology integration to ensure optimum instructional delivery
  • facilitate the use of instructional technology and the use of the computer as an educational tool to enhance student achievement
  • serves as a resource to classroom teachers in the use of technology, media, and data as an educational tool and in the use of a variety of instructional technologies in the classroom

What we need

Hardware

Estimated

20 iMac 27 inch with AppleCare

$43,240.00

20 HP z230

$28,000.00

20 Samsung 27-Inch Screen LED-Lit Monitor (S27E390H)

$5,400.00

Total

$76,640.00

Software

Estimated

40 Microsoft Office Home and Student Edition

$4,400.00

20 Seats of Final Cut Pro X

$5,999.80

20 Seats of Avid Media Composer First (Free Edition)

$0.00

Total

$10,399.80

Printer

Estimated

HP Color LaserJet Enterprise M553dn

$800.00

Optional 500 Page Paper Tray

$229.00

Full set of replacement Toner (B, M, Y, C) = $700

Total

$1,029.00

Copier

Estimated

Xerox WC3655S B/W Copier 47ppp

$2,000.00

Consumable Supplies - 12 Month Term

$240.00

Prints Per Page

$0.03

Total

$2,240.03

AV Equipment

Estimated

Samsung UN65J6300 65-Inch 1080p Smart LED TV or Optoma HD Projector

$1,660.00

Samsung Blu-ray Disc Player

$90.00

Apple TV with AppleCare

$98.00

Universal Mobile TV Cart TV Stand (AVA1500-60-1P) or Projector Ceiling Mount

$150.00

6 Sony FDR-AX100/B 4K Video Camera with 3.5-Inch LCD (Black)

$10,200.00

6 Sony NP-FV100 Rechargeable Battery Pack

$630.00

6 Sony BCTRV Travel Charger - Black

$192.00

6 Tripods 

$1,080.00

40 Headphones

$600.00

40 Sets of Speakers

$800.00

40 G-Technology G-DRIVE Hard Drives with Thunderbolt

$15,200.00

40 Apple Thunderbolt Cables

$1,040.00

12 Sony 128GB SDXC UHS-1 Class 10 Memory Cards (SF128UX/TQN)

$840.00

20 Transcend Information USB 3.0 Media Card Readers (TS-RDF5K)

$126.00

   

25 HDMI Cables

$80.00

Impact 4 Light Green Screen Kit

$875.00

Blackmagic Design Production Studio 4K

$1,700.00

Other

Total

$35,361.00

Consultants  Estimated

Full Time Credentialed Computer/Media Lab Teacher

$128,000.00

Professional Development for Teachers and Teaching Assistants 

$24,400.00

Optional 3 yr Next Business Day + DMR LaserJet M552/3 Support

$230.00

Optional Xerox Customer Education 

$335.00

Total

$152,965

Total Expenses

$278,634.83
 

Risks and Challenges:

I do not foresee any risks with this campaign.  The challenge will be raising the money quickly enough so that all of our students are able to have access to the technology to place them on a level playing field with students at other schools.  

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you are not in a position to contribute, we can still use your help.  Please spread the word about our project.  Help us help prepare our students for 21st Century skills and college and career readiness.

story:
¿Quién soy?

Mi nombre es Gabriel Silva. Soy un abogado panameño con un gran interés en mejorar la calidad de educación de mi país. Fui profesor en la Universidad Católica Santa María la Antigua, he dictado seminarios en colegios públicos y privados a lo largo de Panamá y he fundado y trabajado en varias organizaciones no gubernamentales (ONG) que buscan mejorar la educación en Panamá.  

Yo también, como muchos de ustedes, reconozco que uno de los retos más grande para Panamá es la calidad de educación. El desarrollo que está viviendo el país no será sostenible si no le damos las herramientas apropiadas a las actuales y futuras generaciones. 

Por eso, junto con otros jóvenes, hemos empezado una ONG llamada Enseña por Panamá que tiene como objetivo incrementar los niveles de educación en Panamá al posesionar a jóvenes líderes profesionales como docentes en colegios en áreas principalmente marginales a lo largo y ancho del país. 

¿Qué es Enseña por Panamá?

Enseña por Panamá es una ONG panameña que forma parte de la reconocida red internacional de ONGs llamada Teach for All. En términos sencillos, estamos abriendo en Panamá una "franquicia" de Teach for All. Teach for All tiene operaciones exitosas en más de 35 países. 

En concreto, Enseña por Panamá reclutará, entrenará y posesionará a jóvenes profesionales graduados de universidades en colegios públicos del país. Estos talentosos profesionales dictarán las clases como docentes en las áreas que son expertos, desde química hasta inglés. Sin embargo, nuestros profesionales han pasado por un riguroso proceso de selección en donde fueron elegidos los más competentes, líderes, inteligentes,dinámicos, y los que tienen mayor potencial para ser agentes de cambio en las comunidades de los colegios que atiendan. 

¿Cuál es la Situación Actual?

Al día de hoy Enseña por Panamá ya cuenta con un equipo de trabajo tiempo completo, un convenio de cooperación con el Ministerio de Educación de Panamá, un convenio de cooperación con Teach for All, el patrocinio de algunas personas y empresas y muchas ganas de trabajar y mejorar la educación en Panamá. 

Sin embargo, es importante que el proyecto se de a conocer y recaude fondos adicionales para poder empezar a posesionar a los profesionales en colegios en el próximo ciclo escolar del 2016. 

Por ello, el 6 de agosto de 2015 empiezo  un viaje en bicicleta a lo largo del país, por 30 días, en donde visitaré los colegios más remotos de nuestro país para dar a conocer el proyecto y entender a mayor plenitud la realidad educativa de Panamá que sólo conocemos por estudios. También el objetivo es recaudar fondos para poder ayudar los inicios de Enseña por Panamá en el 2016.

¿Por qué donar a Enseña por Panamá?

En nombre de Enseña por Panamá, por medio de esta campaña, te solicito  amablemente cualquier tipo de contribución económica que nos puedas por favor ofrece para empezar este proyecto que promete mejorar los niveles de educación en Panamá. El proyecto ha tenido casos de gran exitoso en otros países, y no dudamos que en Panamá nos irá bien.

Al tu donar a esta campaña estarás aportando directamente a los fondos de Enseña por Panamá y a su inicio en el 2016. Ayudarás a cubrir los costos de operación de un equipo sobresaliente con un gran corazón que ha estado trabajando por 1 año en esta iniciativa y los costos requeridos para preparar y posesionar a nuestros profesionales en colegios públicos marginales en nuestra República en el 2016.

Si piensas que la educación es importante, y quieres ver un Panamá con mejores niveles de educación, éste es tu proyecto.  No dejemos que el lugar donde los panameños nacen, determine la calidad educativa que reciben.

story:
Short Summary (for those who don't like reading) :

On May 12, 2015 the second earthquake occurred in Nepal with a magnitude of 7.3 . Its epicenter was located in the Dolakha district destroying hundreds of thousands of homes, injuring thousands and killing hundreds. 

For a week I (Kathrine Norsk) visited the district, lived in their temporary homes and met up with the principals of two schools that collapsed during the earthquake. The school management boards each made an estimate cost of building a new school. They are all ready to do the work so their kids can study in a safe environment. All they need is your help to get the materials. 

The greatest thing about this project is that the money goes directly to the source. This is our personal contribution to helping Nepal. There is no administration fee. No profit. All the donations will go towards buying the needed materials and it is managed by the Co-Founder of the project, Suman Nepal, who is currently living in Denmark and working for Unicef. He is visiting his home country in October to ensure the completion of the project. 

Your contribution to this project ensures that the children in a minimum of two schools can study in a safe environment once agin. Education is the way out of poverty and you will be able to ensure the future of these children. The schools are in an area where other donations are scarce due to the location. However these children deserve an education just as much as everybody else and you can be a part of making the difference! 

Do you need to know more? If so, everything is explained below and you can always contact me (Kathrine Norsk) or Suman Nepal (Co-Founder). If not, then all you need to do is press the donation bottom and you are on your way to be a part of making a difference for more than a hundred children in Nepal!

How it all started:

After a semester abroad at SCAD Hong Kong, I planned a two month journey around Asia, to explore the continent I had never seen. The last stop was Nepal, where I was suppose to hike the Annapurna circuit. Since it was the last stop, I booked my ticket back to Denmark months prior to the trip. 

On April 25th the first Earthquake happened in Nepal, and though I have never been there, I have close friends from Nepal and I have exhibited at the Kathmandu National Museum. As a self-paying student, money does not grow on the trees, and the donation I was able to make had minimal impact. Instead I thought of changing my purpose in Nepal and use my photographic skills to help fundraising in the way I know best - through images and storytelling.

I contacted my friend Suman Nepal, who I met through Unicef back in Denmark 2014. I expressed my intentions, got him on board, and before I knew it I had a place to stay and a project to research.

What we did:

On May 12 2015 the second earthquake occurred with a 7.3 magnitude. Its epicenter was located in the Dolakha district destroying hundreds of thousands of homes, injuring thousands and killing hundreds. 

From the 22nd-28th of July, I visited the Dolakha district in Nepal. This area takes around seven hours to reach by bus from Kathmandu (the capital), however after the earthquake and with the current monsoon rain, many landslides and floods are making it difficult to reach the district and the aid distributed has been limited. Despite the obstacles, we managed to get there and back to complete the research.

After hours of driving and walking, I witnessed the hundreds of thousands of collapsed homes. It was almost three months after the earthquakes, yet the damages were vivid. New temporary homes had been built out of the rooftops and utilities had been rescued from the destroyed homes. 

Walking through the villages of Dolakha, witnessing the temporary homes built out of rooftops.

Yadav Ghimlrey walking through the ruins of the home he grew up in.

During my stay in Dolakha I  was accompanied by Yadav Ghimlrey, one of Suman Nepal's friends. Yadav grew up in Dolakha and he was my research partner and translator during my stay in Dolakha. We spent the next days visiting schools which had been destroyed by the earthquakes. The children were now being taught in something called TLC's - Temporary Learning Centers, which locals had built with their own time and money so the kids could continue learning. 

One day we hiked an hour up a mountain to Kutidada Primary school. On the way to the school we came across another school. After being surrounded by collapsed buildings I was surprised to see that this particular school was still standing. Due to a more robust foundation, the school had survived the earthquake. This is the type of structure that we wish to construct for the other schools if we get enough funding.

As we made our way to the top, we immediately witnessed the collapsed school. Next to the school was the so called TLC, but as the rain started pouring we quickly concluded that this building was indeed a temporary structure. 

 We came unannounced but the enthusiasm from the principal was felt immediately. He made a few phone calls and before I knew it nearly twenty men and women, the school management board, had reached the top, ready to hear about the possibilities of improving the educational environment for the children. It was warming to see the enthusiasm of the community. They were ready to help get Nepal and the school back on its feet, all they needed was a little help - This is where all of you now have the chance.  

The school management board


We met up with a few other schools, but the same enthusiasm wasn't felt, so we kept searching for people who needed and wanted our help. In the end of the week we met up with another principal in Charikot, the biggest city in the Dolakha district. Once again we were met with eager and a principal who wanted the best for his children. He handed me over a plan of what he would like to do for the school. As we told him that we could not confirm any amount (because it all depends on you), he replied: "Any help is greatly appreciated". We again sat down to discuss the financials, to have an overview of the cost of rebuilding the school. This school has children from grade one through high school, and like Kutidada it was in great need.

Meet the crew:

Kathrine Norsk (Project Leader):  Kathrine is the project initiator. She is studying towards a Bachelor´s of Fine Art Photography with a focus in charitable work, travel and documentary photography and generally using arts to make a social impact.

Suman Nepal (Co-Founder): Suman is the main fundraiser of the project. He is also the one personally delivering the donation to the two school. He will ensure that the money is spent on the materials for rebuilding the schools, when he returns to his home county in October to complete the project. 

Yadav Ghimlrey (Dolakha Guide): Yadav was the translator and research guide who took me around Dolakha and gave me the necessary insight to start the project.

What will we do? What do we need?

We have the schools and we have the estimated cost. Now we just need the help. With the donation made, we will do a personal handover of the funds to the two principals. A list of the cost is already made and approved by the Department of Education in Nepal, making sure all the funds go exactly where they are suppose to. In case you are more interested in the specifics, a copy of the meeting as well as the financial plan, can be found in the gallery. 

The Impact

Many people are in need, and it can be one of the greatest gifts to help out when you can. Sometimes it can be hard to donate to big organizations because you are not sure exactly where your donation is going. With A.I.D.E. you are sure to know exactly where the funds go, because we are such a small, transparent group. You know that if you donate it will give back the classrooms that were taken away from the kids during the earthquake. Education is the way out of poverty, and you will be able to ensure the future of these children. 

Throughout the whole process, we (Kathrine & Suman) will always be there to answer questions and update if needed. My biggest interest is simply that we can give back the classrooms so the students can keep learning and get a brighter future. 

Now all there is left to say is: LET'S DO THIS, LET'S DO THIS TOGETHER!

Other Ways You Can Help

Money doesn't grow on the trees for everyone, and we are well aware of that. That does not mean that you cannot help out! By using your personal network and the Indiegogo share tools, you can help us spread the word to your connections. SO even if you cannot donate, you can still be a part of the team and help us spread the word!
